original_zh_text: 啊！可算遇着你了，小姐。您为这营地做的贡献比谁都多。<page>我琢磨着您的好意，做了个小玩意当回礼。<page>就是个信物！但我把看家本事都使上了！让它在孤独的旅途上陪您解个闷。<page>带着它上路吧，记得这里永远欢迎您。
translated_text: ¡Oh, yeah! Oh, yes! "Good to see you for a moment, lady. " You 're more fair in this area than most of us.<page>I 'm willing to think about all your efforts and do something in return.<page>It 's just a symbol, really. I put all my talents in and did everything I could! There is something in the lonely path.<page>You are always welcomed during your trip.
secondary_translated_text: 오, 그래!오, 네! "잠깐만 만나서 반갑습니다, 아가씨. "당신은 이 지역에서 우리보다 더 공평합니다.<page>나는 너의 모든 노력에 대해 생각하며 그 대가로 무언가를 할 용의가 있다.<page>그것은 단지 상징일 뿐이야, 정말이야.나는 내 모든 재능을 넣어 내가 할 수있는 모든 것을했다!외로운 길에는 무언가가 있다.<page>당신은 항상 당신의 여행 동안 환영.

original_en_text: <hpage>This camp seems in poor condition, good bug. With the lands around turning deadly, I’d worry for its safety.<page>Aye. We surely aren’t seeing its finest moment, but this place has been serving us passing bugs for as long as any can remember.<page>It’s faith, you see! All those pilgrims, now and past. Our devotion holds it together. The camp’ll remain, and provide, no matter the troubles.<page>
original_zh_text: <hpage>这处营地破败不堪，周遭又暗藏危险，我担忧其安危。<page>唉，确实不是鼎盛时候。但这里长久以来侍奉过往虫众，已不知过了多少年月。<page>是信仰维系着这片营地，明白吗？是古今朝圣者的虔心庇佑着这里。任外面灾厄横行，营地永存。
translated_text: <hpage>The field is bad, and the insects look good.As the surrounding lands become deadly, I am concerned for your safety.<page>Of course, we haven't seen this best moment yet, but as long as someone remembers it, this place offers us a service of making mistakes.<page>This is faith. Pilgrims are now and in the past. Our devotion unites them. Whatever your problem, the camp will help you.<page>
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>밭이 나쁘고 곤충이 잘 생겼다. 주변 땅이 치명적으로 변함에 따라 나는 너의 안전을 걱정한다.<page>물론, 우리는이 최고의 순간을 아직 보지 못했지만, 누군가가 그것을 기억하는 한, 이 장소는 우리에게 실수를하는 서비스를 제공합니다.<page>이것이 신앙이다.순례자들은 지금과 과거에도 있다.우리의 헌신은 그들을 하나로 묶습니다.당신의 문제가 무엇이든, 캠프는 당신을 도울 것입니다.<page>

original_en_text: <hpage>What ritual calls you all together, pilgrim?<page>Our brother, this poor wretch in my arms, has walked his last aching step. We gather here to sing him farewell, and to mourn our great loss.
original_zh_text: <hpage>诸位聚集在此举行什么仪式？<page>这位兄弟，我怀中的可怜虫，已走完最后一步。我们在此唱别，哀悼逝者。
translated_text: <hpage>Dear pilgrims, what ritual do you practice?<page>Our brother, the poor man in my arms, took his last step in pain. We have gathered here to say goodbye and mourn his loss.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>친애하는 순례자 여러분, 여러분은 어떤 의식을 실천하십니까?<page>우리 형제, 내 품에 안겨있는 가난한 사람이 고통 속에서 마지막 걸음을 내딛었습니다.우리는 작별 인사를 하고 그의 상실을 슬퍼하기 위해 여기에 모였다.

original_en_text: If the veiled bugs have an interest in you, enough to brave the wastes beyond our borders, then you must be rather special, yes?<hpage>In my own lands, some may once have seen me so. In this place, with my strength sapped, I am just another traveller.<page>Ohho! A traveller, but still something more. I can see it now. Of course! That focus!<page>Did those veiled bugs realise who they snared? Perhaps it is they who should be worried, eh?
original_zh_text: 既然覆面者对你有兴趣，甚至不惜穿越边境荒原掳走你，你肯定不是什么等闲之辈吧？<hpage>在故土，或许曾有虫如此看待我。但在此地，力衰之躯只不过是一介旅者。<page>嚯嚯！旅者？不止如此。我可看得很清楚，这专注的眼神！<page>那些覆面虫知道自己网住了谁吗？该提心吊胆的怕是他们，对吧？
translated_text: If the voila insects belong to you, and you have the courage to cross the border, you must be special.<hpage>Perhaps someone has seen me in my own country, where my strength has diminished and I am only a traveler.<page>Oh, I screamed! Travelers and many more, of course. I already see it! Such an approach!<page>Who imprisoned the disguised insects? Should we be concerned about this?
secondary_translated_text: 보일라 곤충이 당신에게 속해 있고 국경을 넘을 용기가 있다면, 당신은 특별해야합니다.<hpage>어쩌면 누군가가 내 자신의 나라에서 나를 보았을지도 몰라, 그곳은 내 힘이 줄어들고 나는 단지 여행자일 뿐이다.<page>오, 내가 비명을 지르다!물론 여행자 및 더 많은.나는 이미 그것을 보았다!이런 접근법!<page>누가 변장한 곤충들을 투옥했는가?우리는 이것에 대해 걱정해야합니까?

original_en_text: My wish. Oh my wish! I need fruits of the world, three little darlings. I need them! Does the kingdom not send you, little you, to grant my desire?
original_zh_text: 我的祈愿。啊我的祈愿！我要这世间的三枚果实，小宝贝果实。我需要！王国没派你，小小你，来满足我的渴求？
translated_text: My wishes, my wishes. I need the fruits of the world, three children, we need them! Did the king send you to fulfill my wishes?
secondary_translated_text: 내 소원, 내 소원.나는 세상의 열매가 필요해, 세 아이가 필요해!왕이 내 소원을 이루기 위해 당신을 보냈습니까?

original_en_text: Ahh, awake at last! You should mind your strength, traveller. There’s no use wasting energy on an old nobody like me.<hpage>I see that now, madam. My welcome to your land has not been kind. I had reason to be wary.
original_zh_text: 啊哈！可算醒了！你该省省力气，旅者。在我这老骨头身上浪费气力可不值当。<hpage>现在我看清了，女士。但此地的待客之道可不友善。我保持警惕自有道理。
translated_text: Wake up, finally! Travelers should be careful with their forces.There is no need to waste energy on an anonymous person like me.<hpage>- I understand, ma 'am. I have come to your land. We are right to be careful.
secondary_translated_text: 드디어 일어나라!여행자는 자신의 힘에주의를 기울여야합니다. 나 같은 익명의 사람에게 에너지를 낭비 할 필요가 없습니다.<hpage>- 이해합니다, 부인.나는 너의 땅에 왔다.우리가 조심하는 것은 옳다.

original_en_text: Up with you! Up! I won’t have you dying on my floor!
original_zh_text: 给我起来！快起来！我可不想看你死在我的地板上！
translated_text: With You! Stand Up! I will not let them die in my land. "
secondary_translated_text: With You!일어나!나는 그들이 내 땅에서 죽도록 내버려두지 않을 것이다. "

original_en_text: <hpage>I am no pilgrim. I am Hornet, and I arrive in your land by no choice of my own.<hpage>I was brought to your kingdom by force, captured by strange bugs clad in veils.<page>Oho! How curious! The bugs of the Citadel, at the summit of our land. They veil themselves in service to their faith, or perhaps as slaves to something greater...<hpage>Then I shall seek their Citadel. If the veiled bugs would go to such lengths to bring me here, I intend to find out why.<page>Oho! Ferocious! Intimidating! Yours is no pilgrim’s spirit! You’ve the bearing of a hunter.<page>Welcome then, fierce traveller, to Pharloom! Our holy yet haunted land.<page>Before you depart, permit an old bug a brief warning. Best keep that weapon drawn.<page>Our kingdom is gripped by a curse. Its paths grow wild and dangerous, and though some still attempt the climb to the Citadel at its crest, none return to speak of what they see.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我名为大黄蜂。我并非朝圣者，也不是自愿来到这里。<hpage>是一群覆面怪虫将我绑来这里的。<page>嚯！稀奇！那是圣堡的虫子，盘踞在我们土地上头。他们覆面侍奉信仰，或者说……是更可怖之物的奴仆……<hpage>那我会找到圣堡。既然覆面者费心绑我来到这里，我一定会查清缘由。<page>嚯！够凶！这可不是朝圣者的脾性！你分明带着猎手的气魄。<page>那么欢迎你，剽悍的旅者，来到纺络！这个神圣却遭诅咒的国度。<page>启程前容老虫多句嘴，最好时刻握紧你的兵刃。<page>我们的王国正被诅咒啃噬。道路变得混乱凶险，山顶那座圣堡——尽管仍有勇者试图攀登，却无虫归来讲述见闻。
translated_text: <hpage>I am not a pilgrim, I am a pilgrim and I can only come to your country.<hpage>I was forcibly taken to his kingdom and captured by a strange insect with a veil.<page>Oh my god! What a curiosity! The insects in the castle are on top of the earth. They need faith, or perhaps they are slaves to something greater.<hpage>If these hidden mistakes brought me here, I 'll find out why.<page>Oh my god! It was intensive! Threatening! His spirit is not the spirit of a pilgrim, he resembles a hunter.<page>You, the tough traveler, welcome to the Lantern! It is a sacred place, but it is a ghost.<page>Before you go, please briefly warn about old mistakes.<page>Our kingdom is surrounded by a curse, the road has become rough and dangerous, and some have tried to climb back to the top of the castle, but no one told them what they saw.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>나는 순례자가 아니라 순례자이며, 당신 나라에 올 수 밖에 없습니다.<hpage>나는 강제로 그의 왕국으로 끌려갔고, 베일을 쓴 이상한 곤충에 의해 포획되었습니다.<page>오, 세상에!얼마나 호기심인가!성 안에 있는 곤충들은 땅 위에 있다.그들은 신앙이 필요하거나, 아마도 그들은 더 큰 무언가의 노예일 것이다.<hpage>만약 이런 숨겨진 실수들이 나를 여기로 이끌었다면, 나는 그 이유를 알아낼 것이다.<page>오, 세상에!그것은 집중적이었습니다!위협이!그의 정신은 순례자의 정신이 아니라 사냥꾼과 같다.<page>강인한 여행자여, 랜턴에 오신 것을 환영합니다!그것은 신성한 장소이지만, 그것은 유령이다.<page>떠나기 전에 오래된 실수에 대해 짧게 경고하십시오.<page>우리 왕국은 저주로 둘러싸여 있고, 도로가 거칠고 위험해졌고, 어떤 사람들은 성 꼭대기로 다시 올라가려고했지만, 아무도 그들이 본 것을 말하지 않았습니다.

original_en_text: So you’re another pilgrim then? Scuttled out of the darkness to climb the great path and bow at its gilded peak?
original_zh_text: 这么说你也是个朝圣者？从黑暗里钻出来就为攀那条路，去镀金尖顶上叩拜？
translated_text: Are you a Pilgrim? Dig in the darkness, climb the road and lean over the mountains of gold?
secondary_translated_text: 당신은 순례자입니까?어둠 속을 파고 길을 오르고 황금 산 위에 기대어?

original_en_text: Well, look at that! You’ve gone and donated all those shell shards, just like I wished for! I can scarcely believe it!<page>Those shards are valuable, alright. Brilliant for crafting and fixing, very versatile.<page>More than that, though... it was a warm thing you did, the sort of kindness you don’t see much in this weary place.<hpage>Was this kindness? I must take care to learn of this land and claim what advantage I can from it. Answering requests like yours can often fit those ends.<page>Oh, it’s like that, is it? Well, even still, the help’s well appreciated, miss. Best of luck in your travels, and may every wish of yours be granted!
original_zh_text: 哎呀呀！你居然真捐了这么多甲壳碎片！跟我许的愿一模一样！简直不敢相信！<page>这些碎片用处可不少，又能造东西又能修修补补。<page>不过更重要的是……你做了件暖心事，这破地方可少见这种善举。<hpage>善意？我需要审慎了解这里，好为自己谋取利益。回应你的祈愿只是手段。<page>哦，原来如此？但帮忙总归是好的，小姐。祝旅途顺利，愿你所有愿望都能实现！
translated_text: Look at this. As I wanted, I was given all the bullets! That's incredible!<page>It is ideal for production and maintenance and can be used in a wide range of applications.<page>But that 's not all, what you 're doing is a warm and good thing you 'll rarely find in this tired place.<hpage>Are you honest? I have to be careful to know this land and reap its benefits. Volunteers like you often achieve these goals.<page>« Yes, yes, yes? Thank you for your help, girl. Have a good trip and all wishes come true!
secondary_translated_text: 이거 봐.내가 원하는 대로, 나는 모든 총알을 받았다!정말 신기해요!<page>생산 및 유지 보수에 이상적이며 다양한 응용 분야에서 사용할 수 있습니다.<page>그러나 그것이 전부는 아닙니다. 당신이하는 일은이 피곤한 곳에서 거의 찾을 수 없는 따뜻하고 좋은 일입니다.<hpage>당신은 정직한가요?나는 이 땅을 알고 그 혜택을 얻기 위해 조심해야 한다.여러분 같은 자원봉사자들은 종종 이러한 목표를 달성합니다.<page>"그래, 그래, 그래?도와줘서 고마워, 아가씨.좋은 여행 되세요, 모든 소원이 이루어지세요!

original_en_text: Oh, oh dear... what fearful events are sent to test we poor pilgrims! How could it be that our path to paradise is infested with such beasts?<page>To brave such a world... oh my. I’ll need more rosaries, that’s for certain. Please traveller, won’t you trade with me?
original_zh_text: 噢，圣堡啊……为何设置这等可怖灾厄考验可怜的朝圣者！通往乐土之路怎么会遍布恶兽？<page>要继续朝圣之路……唉，需要更多念珠。旅者，愿意交易吗？
translated_text: - Yes, dear. It would be a terrible event to experience poor pilgrims. How could it be to fill the road to heaven with such animals?<page>Brave before the world - oh, I definitely need more Rosaries.And now a traveler.You don't do business with me? "
secondary_translated_text: - 네, 자기야.불쌍한 순례자들을 경험하는 것은 끔찍한 일이 될 것이다.어떻게 그런 동물들로 천국으로 가는 길을 가득 채울 수 있겠는가?<page>세상 앞에서 용감한 - 오, 나는 확실히 더 많은 Rosaries 가 필요합니다. And now a traveler. You don 't do business with me? "

original_en_text: You are my wish granter, yes? My wish! I need fruits of the world, three little darlings. I need them, so I wish!<page>You made the promise. A binding stronger than sin. Bring me the three Mossberries. Precious fruit! Grant my wish, and then the work begins!
original_zh_text: 你实现我的祈愿，对吧？我的祈愿！我要这世间的三枚果实，小宝贝果实。我需要，所以祈愿！<page>你应诺祈愿，比罪孽更牢固的契约。带给我三颗苔莓。珍果！应我祈愿，大业方启！
translated_text: You are fulfilling my wishes, right? My wishes! I need the fruits of the world, three children. I want them, therefore I want them.<page>I promise that this is a stronger bond than sin.Give me three muses.Precious fruit! Let your wish come true and the work begins!
secondary_translated_text: 당신은 나의 소원을 성취하고 있는 거죠, 그렇죠?내 소원!나는 세 명의 아이들이 세상의 열매를 필요로 한다.나는 그들을 원한다, 그래서 나는 그들을 원한다.<page>나는 이것이 죄보다 더 강한 결합이라고 약속한다. 나에게 세 개의 뮤즈를 줘. 소중한 열매!당신의 소원이 이루어지고 일이 시작됩니다!

original_en_text: I’ve a long way to go, and much more to see. For now though, let’s just rest a little while, eh?
original_zh_text: 前面还有不少路要走，也有不少新鲜事物等着发现。但现在，不如一起休息一会吧。
translated_text: We still have a long way to go and a lot to see, but for now let 's take a break.
secondary_translated_text: 우리는 아직 갈 길이 멀고 볼 것이 많지만, 잠시 휴식을 취합시다.

original_en_text: Times are hard, so fresh supplies are always welcome! Bugs arrive here with nothin’ and often leave without much more.
original_zh_text: 时局艰难，物资紧缺！虫子们来时两手空空，走时也带不走啥。
translated_text: Time is hard, but fresh things are always welcome. This mistake is nothing, and when it is gone, it is nothing.
secondary_translated_text: 시간은 힘들지만 신선한 것은 언제나 환영합니다.이 실수는 아무 것도 아니고, 그것이 사라지면 아무 것도 아니다.

original_en_text: Well now! Seems I’ve traded you the last of my supplies, so I’ve got no more excuses to linger down here.<page>I’ll soon be making my way up to the great Citadel. As holy as I am with rosaries, I’m sure my path will not be an arduous one...
original_zh_text: 哎呀！最后的存货都换予你了，这下没借口留下啦。<page>很快要上圣堡了。揣着这么多念珠，肯定能一路顺畅……
translated_text: Everything is okay, everything is okay! All right, all right! All right! There is no excuse here, because it is as if I am exchanging the last supplies with you.<page>I am a saint of the Rosary, but I am convinced that my journey will not be difficult.
secondary_translated_text: 모든 게 괜찮아, 모든 게 괜찮아!좋아요, 좋아요!좋아요!여기서 변명이 없는데, 마치 내가 마지막 보급품을 당신과 교환하는 것 같기 때문이다.<page>나는 묵주기도의 성자이지만, 나의 여정은 어렵지 않을 것이라고 확신한다.

original_en_text: Bring more Mossberries here. Mmm. Yes, we will trade. Precious rosaries for fresh berries! Seek them wherever you see the green moss grow!
original_zh_text: 带更多苔莓来。嗯。用念珠换鲜果！青苔生长处都有踪迹！
translated_text: Bring me some mousse, please. Yes, let's make a deal. Beautiful rosary of fresh berries! Even if you see green flies growing, try to do it!
secondary_translated_text: 무스 좀 가져다주세요.네, 합의를 합시다.신선한 베리의 아름다운 로자리!초록 파리가 자라는 것을 보더라도, 시도하십시오!

original_en_text: You bear your blade well, hunter, and you’ve skill, no doubt, so I don’t mean any unkindness when I say you still seem a little frail.<hpage>I was a long time spent captive, bound by seals strange to me. My strength is diminished, but recoverable.<hpage>By the time I reach that Citadel, I’ll be ready to face what waits.
original_zh_text: 你执刃的姿态不错，猎手，本领想必了得。不过恕我直言，你看上去仍有些虚弱。<hpage>我遭囚禁多日，又被陌生封印束缚。气力虽然衰微，但尚可恢复。<hpage>等我抵达圣堡之时，自然会做好准备。
translated_text: Hunter, you 're a good swordsman, and you certainly have some skills, so there 's no point in saying that you look a little weak.<hpage>For a long time I have been bound by a strange seal. The strength has decreased, but it will be able to recover.<hpage>When I arrived at the castle, I was preparing for what was to happen.
secondary_translated_text: 헌터, 넌 검을 잘 잘 잘하고, 확실히 약간의 기술이 있어, 네가 약해 보인다고 해도 아무 소용이 없어.<hpage>오랫동안 나는 이상한 도개에 묶여 있었다.실력은 떨어졌지만 회복할 수 있을 것이다.<hpage>내가 성에 도착했을 때, 나는 무슨 일이 일어날지 준비하고 있었다.

original_en_text: Oh! Hunter, aren’t you in a sorry state? You’re all bound up, looking worse than when we first met!<hpage>My shell has become host to a cruel parasite. Though my natural strength keeps it from consuming me entirely, I’m much weakened by its presence.<page>Well, this just won’t do! Pharloom’s already in the snare of one fell curse, we can’t have another vying to leech what life remains.<page>Best you head quick over to that town of bells, at the core of our kingdom. I’ve an uncle hidden about there, an old hermit, and a horrid curmudgeon.<page>That hermit’s a hard one to befriend, but he holds some knowledge about this kingdom’s maladies. If anyone’s able to point you to a cure, it’ll be him.
original_zh_text: 哦！猎手，看你这副惨状。全身像被缠住，比初见时更狼狈了。<hpage>我受到险恶寄生体的侵蚀。虽凭借本源之力阻止了吞噬，仍被大幅削弱。<page>这怎么行！纺络已然陷于一道诅咒，怎能再让另一道来争夺残存的生机。<page>快去王国腹地的钟心镇，我在那有个隐居的叔父，就是脾气臭得很。<page>与他结交并不容易，但他了解不少病症。要说有谁能指点医治方法，非他莫属。
translated_text: Oh my god! - Are you happy, Hunter? You 've been attacked, and you look worse than when we met!<hpage>My innate strength did not allow me to completely swallow myself, but its presence made me weaker.<page>It won't work! Faro is trapped by the curse of corruption, and she can't let other men compete for the rest of her life.<page>They fled to the city of Bel, in the heart of our kingdom. I had a hidden uncle, an old and rude, terrible man.<page>The recluse had a hard time making friends, but he understood the disease of the kingdom.If anyone can tell you about the cure, it 's you.
secondary_translated_text: 오, 세상에! - 행복해, 헌터?당신은 공격을 받았고, 우리가 만났을 때보다 더 나빠 보인다!<hpage>내 타고난 힘은 나를 완전히 삼킬 수 없었지만, 그것의 존재는 나를 약하게 만들었습니다.<page>그것은 작동하지 않을 것입니다!파로는 부패의 저주에 갇혀 있으며, 남은 생애 동안 다른 남성들과 경쟁하게 할 수 없습니다.<page>그들은 우리 왕국의 중심부에 있는 벨으로 도망하였다.저에게는 숨겨진 삼촌이 있었는데, 늙고 무례하고 끔찍한 남자였어요.<page>이 은둔자는 친구를 사귀는 데 어려움을 겪었지만, 그는 왕국에 대한 질병을 이해했습니다. 누군가가 당신에게 치료법을 말할 수 있다면, 그것은 당신입니다.

original_en_text: Mmm, the precious fruit! And... oh! Such fruit! Perfectly ripe! Perfectly fragrant! Perfectly round! Take what you have earned, much of much rosaries!
original_zh_text: 嗯，珍果！啊……极品！熟透！芬芳！浑圆！拿好，念珠多多，你当之无愧！
translated_text: and precious fruits. and then... Oh! That fruit! Fully prepared! That's all, the smell! The perfect round. Use the most money you earn!
secondary_translated_text: 귀중한 과일들그리고 나서...오! 오!이 과일!완전히 준비!그게 다야, 냄새!완벽한 라운드.당신이 버는 돈을 가장 많이 사용하십시오!

original_en_text: O-oh! Traveller! Won’t you stop and make trade with an old pilgrim? Surely something here will aid you in your great journey!
original_zh_text: 噢！旅者！来与我做笔交易？总有物件能在旅途中助你一臂之力！
translated_text: Oh my god! Travellers! Are you not going to stop making treaties with ancient pilgrims? What you have here will definitely help your trip!
secondary_translated_text: 오, 세상에!여행자들!당신은 고대 순례자들과 조약을 맺는 것을 멈추지 않을 것입니까?당신이 여기에있는 것은 확실히 당신의 여행을 도울 것입니다!

original_en_text: You keep the fruit for yourself? For greed? Strange choice! It will only weigh you down...
original_zh_text: 私藏果实？贪婪？奇怪选择！徒增负担……
translated_text: Do you eat your fruit? Because of greed? What a strange choice! It just makes you feel heavy.
secondary_translated_text: 당신은 과일을 먹습니까?탐욕 때문에?얼마나 이상한 선택인가!그것은 단지 당신을 무겁게 느끼게 한다.

original_en_text: Don’t go thinkin’ fear’s keepin’ me from my own pilgrimage! S’just there’s a lotta work still to do here and few bugs able to do it.
original_zh_text: 别以为我是怕了才不去朝圣！实在是这里活儿多帮手少。
translated_text: Do not think that fear hinders my pilgrimage. "There is so much that can be done, and so little that can be done.
secondary_translated_text: 두려움이 나의 순례를 방해한다고 생각하지 마라. "할 수 있는 일은 많고 할 수 있는 일은 거의 없다.

original_en_text: Sing for our brother, who has died a devout death! All his pains and torments left behind, like the dust shrugged from a traveller’s shawl.
original_zh_text: 为兄弟而歌，他死得虔诚！所有苦痛皆抛却，如旅者抖落披肩尘埃。
translated_text: All his sufferings and trials are left behind, like the dust of a traveler 's clothes.
secondary_translated_text: 그의 모든 고통과 시련은 여행자의 옷의 먼지처럼 뒤에 남아있다.

original_en_text: Promised, then. A binding stronger than sin. Bring me the three Mossberries. Precious fruit! Grant my wish, and then the work begins!
original_zh_text: 祈愿已承，比罪孽更牢固的契约。带给我三颗苔莓。珍果！应我祈愿，大业方启！
translated_text: This is a stronger bond than sin.Give me three muses.Precious fruit! Let your wish come true and the work begins!
secondary_translated_text: 이것은 죄보다 더 강한 유대감이다. 나에게 세 가지 뮤즈를 줘. 소중한 열매!당신의 소원이 이루어지고 일이 시작됩니다!

original_en_text: Mm. Mmm! Who is it? An intruder! Terrible! To interrupt a humble druid as they work!<hpage>I meant no intrusion, druid. The sound of your laughter drew me to investigate.<hpage>This settlement is built around an old structure of the Weavers. Do you know of them? Do they inhabit this land still?<page>Mm? What settlement? What Weavers?! You speak nonsense!
original_zh_text: 嗯。嗯嗯！谁在那儿？入侵者！可恶！竟敢打扰德鲁伊修行！<hpage>无心冒犯，德鲁伊。你的笑声引我前来探查。<hpage>这聚落环绕古织者遗迹而建。你可知晓他们？是否仍居于此？<page>嗯？什么聚落？什么织者？！胡言乱语！
translated_text: Oh ~! Yes! "Who are you? Invasion! That's terrible! The work of the humble droid has been interrupted!<hpage>I don't want to interrupt you, droid. His laughter prompted me to investigate.<hpage>This colony was built around the old building of the House of Tkachov. - You know what? Do they still live on earth?<page>What's it? What is it? Reconciliation? What sewing machine? You are ridiculous!
secondary_translated_text: 오 ~!네! "너는 누구니?침략!정말 끔찍하군요!겸손한 드로이드의 작업이 중단되었습니다!<hpage>방해하고 싶지 않아, 드로이드.그의 웃음소리가 나를 조사하게 했다.<hpage>이 식민지는 Tkachov 의 집의 오래된 건물 주위에 지어졌습니다. - 뭐지 알아?그들은 아직도 지구에 살고 있습니까?<page>뭐예요?뭐야?화해?어떤 재봉틀?넌 우스꽝스럽다!

original_en_text: <hpage>Madam, I return seeking power to aid the construction of a trap, at request of your sibling residing atop the Citadel.<page>Aye, hunter. So you managed to rouse the old fool. I’ve known it coming, felt it, and glad I am! <page>Rest’a my family spent far too long huddled and glum... or dead! Not me! I’d always been thinkin’ it a waste to just take what’s coming, when her up top wakes.<page>Better to fight for freedom or go out in a blaze, oh ho!
original_zh_text: <hpage>女士，我应你同胞之请归来，寻求助力建造陷阱——他正蛰伏圣堡之中。<page>啊，猎手。你果然说动了那老顽固。我早有预感，真是欣慰！<page>家族里其他虫要么缩着发愁……要么死了！我不一样！早就觉得坐等顶上那位苏醒是浪费生命。<page>宁可死也要争取自由，嚯嚯！
translated_text: <hpage>At the request of his brothers and sisters, who live on top of the castle, I again asked for help to build an electric trap.<page>I woke up like an idiot. I know what's going on, I'm happy.<page>My family has been living together for a long time and she is not happy. Or die! No, me! I think it is useless to accept what will happen after awakening.<page>Fight for freedom or burn it.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>성 꼭대기에 살고있는 그의 형제 자매들의 요청에 따라, 나는 다시 전기 함정을 만드는 데 도움을 요청했습니다.<page>나는 바보같이 깨어났다.나는 무슨 일이 일어나고 있는지 알고 있고, 나는 행복하다.<page>우리 가족은 오랫동안 함께 살았는데 그녀는 행복하지 않다.아니면 죽으세요!아니, 나야!깨어난 후에 무슨 일이 일어날지 받아들이는 것은 쓸모없다고 생각한다.<page>자유를 위해 싸우거나 불태우십시오.

original_en_text: Mmm, the precious fruit! Ah... but! This one is not so fresh. Rotten! Stench of death! A meagre amount of rosaries for you. As much as you deserve!
original_zh_text: 嗯，珍果！啊……但这颗不鲜。腐坏！死气熏天！只配少少念珠！
translated_text: and precious fruit. MIGHT! - It's not new, dirt. The smell of death! A small rosary to do what you deserve!
secondary_translated_text: 귀중한 과일.가능! - 새게 아니야, 더러운 놈아.죽음의 향기!당신이 마땅히 할 일을 하기 위해 작은 로자리!

translated_text: <hpage>- Skin, please. The pilgrim 's name is Pilby.

original_en_text: Once this wishwall is up, bugs’ll be able to seek help from any able shell around. You could even try granting a couple of wishes yourself, missy!
original_zh_text: <page>等这祈愿墙立起来，大伙就能向能者求助了。小姐你说不定还能帮忙实现几个愿望呢！
translated_text: Once this wall of wishes has been built, the insect can turn to any competent shell for help.
secondary_translated_text: 소원의 벽이 만들어지면 곤충은 도움을 요청하기 위해 어떤 유능한 껍질에 의지 할 수 있습니다.

original_en_text: Rest here with me as long as you like. I’m not ready to leave yet, and a little company is always nice.
original_zh_text: 你想休息多久都可以。我尚未准备好启程，有个伴总是好的。
translated_text: You can relax with me here. "I 'm not ready to go yet, dear friends, that 's always good.
secondary_translated_text: 여기서 나와 함께 휴식을 취할 수 있어요. "나는 아직 갈 준비가되어 있지 않다, 사랑하는 친구들, 그것은 항상 좋은 일이다."

original_en_text: Down here, you can’t hear the cries of the pilgrims above, only the faintly ringing bells. I’ll stay and meditate a little longer, before I start my own pilgrimage...
original_zh_text: 在这儿听不见上头朝圣者的哭嚎，只有隐隐钟鸣。启程前我要多冥想会儿……
translated_text: Here you can not hear the screams of pilgrims, only the faint bells. I will stay and meditate for a while, and then start my pilgrimage. "
secondary_translated_text: 이곳에서는 순례자들의 비명을 들을 수 없고, 희미한 종소리만 들을 수 있다.나는 잠시 동안 머물고 명상을 할 것이고, 그 후에 순례 여행을 시작할 것이다. "

original_en_text: Farewell, brother Pilby. May your shell harden the path for others to tread.
original_zh_text: 永别了，小皮尔比。愿你的甲壳为后来者铺路。
translated_text: Farewell, Brother Pilby. Your body is paving the way for others.
secondary_translated_text: 안녕히 계세요, 필비 형제당신의 몸은 다른 사람들을위한 길을 열어줍니다.

translated_text: The Beast. Beast! Terrible beast!

original_en_text: ...Hm. Who here knows the name of this little pilgrim?
original_zh_text: ……嗯。在场有谁记得这虫的名字？
translated_text: ...¿Does anyone know the name of this little cake?
secondary_translated_text: ...¿이 작은 케이크의 이름을 아는 사람 있나요?

original_en_text: Common stuff, shell shards, but very practical. I can use ‘em to patch almost anything up, and this camp’s always in need of some mending.
original_zh_text: 甲壳碎片虽然普通，但实用。我能拿它们修补大半东西，这营地可少不了修修补补。
translated_text: This is an ordinary thing, shell of shell, but it is very practical. Virtually everything can be repaired, but this field needs to be repaired.
secondary_translated_text: 이것은 평범한 일, 껍질의 껍질이지만, 매우 실용적이다.사실상 모든 것이 수리될 수 있지만, 이 필드는 수리해야 한다.

original_en_text: And another poor pilgrim lost, eh? Just the thought of it makes me weary. Better to put my head down and work ‘til the job’s done...
original_zh_text: 又没了个朝圣者？光想想就累得慌。还是干活吧……
translated_text: I'm tired of thinking about it, better work with my head down until you're done.
secondary_translated_text: 나는 그것에 대해 생각하기에 지쳤고, 당신이 끝날 때까지 머리를 숙이고 일하는 것이 낫다.

original_en_text: Hm? A fellow pilgrim, are you? About to start your great journey to the holy Citadel up top?<hpage>I am no pilgrim, sir, though it seems we will be travelling a similar path.<page>Not a pilgrim? Well, it makes no difference, I suppose. We all must walk the roads, up and up, though most of us will fall long before we see the grand gates.<page>If you’re wise, you’ll stop here and rest a while before heading out into that dangerous world...
original_zh_text: 嗯？你也是朝圣者？准备启程攀登圣堡了？<hpage>我并非朝圣者，先生，但前路或许相仿。<page>不是？也罢。众生皆须行路攀爬，但大多未睹圣门便殒命。<page>你若明智，启程前应该在此休整……
translated_text: What's it? What is it? You're a pilgrim, right? Really? Are you ready for a trip to the Holy City?<hpage>I 'm not a pilgrim, but I think we 're on a similar path.<page>You are not a pilgrim, right? We all had to go down the road, but most of us fell before we saw the beautiful gate.<page>If you were wise, you would stop here, rest for a moment, and enter this dangerous world.
secondary_translated_text: 뭐예요?뭐야?당신은 순례자죠?진짜?거룩한 도시로 여행할 준비가 되셨습니까?<hpage>나는 순례자가 아니지만, 우리는 비슷한 길을 가고 있다고 생각한다.<page>넌 순례자가 아니야, 그렇지?우리는 모두 길을 내려야 했지만, 우리 대부분은 아름다운 문을 보기 전에 넘어졌다.<page>만일 네가 현명했다면, 너는 여기서 멈추고 잠시 휴식을 취하고 이 위험한 세상으로 들어갔을 것이다.

original_en_text: And for the parting, a gift. An amulet of we druids. Or me druid? No others, I think.<page>May it ease your sorrows, wish granter. May it cry for you when no tears are left!
original_zh_text: 临别赠礼。我们德鲁伊护符。或者，我的护符？似乎只剩我。<page>希望它能缓解你的哀伤，授愿者。眼泪干涸时，护符为你哭泣！
translated_text: I have one more gift before I say goodbye. It is a Droid amulet. Am I a Droid? I don't think there's anybody else.<page>O blessed one, soothe the pain and stay with you. When there are no more tears, let them weep for you.
secondary_translated_text: 작별인사를 하기 전에 선물을 하나 더 갖고 있어요.그것은 드로이드의 부적이다.나는 드로이드인가?나는 다른 사람이 없다고 생각한다.<page>"복된 자여, 아픔을 완화시키고 너희와 함께 있으소서. "더 이상 눈물이 없을 때, 그들이 당신을 위해 울게하십시오.

original_en_text: Mmm! Mmm! You carry a sweet, precious smell with you. A fruit! Will you trade it for rosaries?
original_zh_text: 嗯嗯！嗯！你身上的甜美气息。鲜果！用念珠交换？
translated_text: Ooo! Ooooo! It gives a sweet and precious smell. fruit! Why not replace it with the rosary?
secondary_translated_text: 오오!오오오!그것은 달콤하고 귀중한 향기를 준다.과일!왜 그것을 로저로 대체하지 않습니까?

original_en_text: <hpage>I wonder, little pilgrim. What calls you and your fellows up to the Citadel? If the way is dangerous, why take the journey at all?<page>Strange question to be asking of a pilgrim. Our holy land calls on us. To journey up is our greatest task. Who are we to refuse?<page>Guided by faith, we climb through flaming fields, across rolling moors, and up great gilded steps. All to reach that eternal, shining Citadel.<page>Once I’m good and ready, I’ll make the climb myself...
original_zh_text: <hpage>小朝圣者，我有些好奇。是什么召唤你前往圣堡？既然道途凶险，为何仍要涉险？<page>问朝圣者这话可真怪。圣堡召唤，攀登就是我等天职。怎么能违抗？<page>凭着信仰穿越火野，踏过灰沼，登上金阶。只为抵达永恒辉煌的圣堡。<page>待准备妥当，我就会启程……
translated_text: <hpage>"I know, little pilgrim, what did you and your friends do to get to the castle? If the road is dangerous, why go in this direction?<page>A question for pilgrims. The Holy Land calls us. The journey is our main job. Who has the right to refuse?<page>We are guided by faith to ascend to the field of fire, the swirling valley and the magnificent golden ladder.<page>When you 're ready, go out alone.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>"알다시피, 어린 순례자여, 당신과 당신의 친구들은 성에 도착하기 위해 무엇을 했습니까? "길이 위험하다면 왜 이 방향으로 가요?<page>Pilgrims 에 대한 질문거룩한 땅이 우리를 부르고 있다.여행은 우리의 주요 업무입니다.누가 거절할 권리가 있나요?<page>우리는 신앙으로 인도하여 불밭과 회전하는 계곡과 웅장한 황금 사다리로 올라갑니다.<page>준비되면 혼자 나가라.

original_en_text: Mmm. Mmm! The pain... my mind aches. Why? The berries, the nasty fruits. Oh the visions!<page>You, wish promiser. Wish granter. You brought me what I needed and stayed by my side. Companion through my ordeal. I could ask for nothing more.
original_zh_text: 嗯。嗯！痛楚……心如火灼。为什么？莓果，秽果。啊，那些幻象！<page>你，应诺者，授愿者。你实现我愿，伴我受难。我再无所求。
translated_text: Oh ~! Yes! "The pain is... My heart hurts, why? Berbins, boring fruit. Oh, my vision!<page>It is a promise of hope. They gave me what I needed and they were by my side. He overcame the difficulties. I cannot ask for more.
secondary_translated_text: 오 ~!네! "고통은...내 심장이 아파, 왜?베르빈, 지루한 과일.나의 비전!<page>그것은 희망의 약속입니다.그들은 나에게 필요한 것을 주었고 그들은 내 옆에 있었다.그는 어려움을 극복했다.나는 더 많은 것을 요구할 수 없다.

original_en_text: Ahhh! Ahhh-ohhhh! The smell is right! Like the others! But very young! Oh, voice of the woods! Oh, dance of the queen! Oh... oh! Beat harder, let us hear it! Oh! Ohhhhhhhh!
original_zh_text: 啊啊！啊——噢！气味对了！就像其他！但尚幼嫩！啊，林间之声！啊，女王之舞！啊……啊！搏动吧，让我聆听！啊！啊啊啊！
translated_text: ¡Oh, yeah! Oh, yes! Oh, yes! Oh, yes! He has good taste! Just like everyone else! But the young people! The noise of the forest! The Queen's Dance! Oh, yes! Oh! Oh! Click it so I can hear it. Oh, yes!
secondary_translated_text: 오, 그래!오, 네!오, 네!오, 네!그는 좋은 취향을 가지고 있다!다른 사람들처럼!하지만 젊은이들!숲의 소음!여왕의 춤!오, 네!오! 오!오! 오!누르면 내가 들을 수 있어요. 오, 네!

original_en_text: Sing, brothers and sisters! Sing, and drown out this burdensome sorrow! Sing out the name of this poor pilgrim, whose journey had nary begun!
original_zh_text: 唱吧，兄弟姐妹！用歌声淹没这沉痛哀伤！为这未启程便陨落的朝圣者高歌！
translated_text: Sing, brothers and sisters! Drink and drown in this pain! He sings the name of a poor pilgrim whose journey has not yet begun.
secondary_translated_text: 형제 자매 여러분, 노래하세요!마시면 이 아픔에 빠지세요!그는 아직 여정을 시작하지 않은 가난한 순례자의 이름을 노래합니다.

original_en_text: Have you heard the talk of what waits just beyond this camp?<page>Brittle caverns of bone, the very base of Pharloom, filled with all manner of deadly creatures and jagged dangers.<page>It’s said ancient bugs once made their homes amidst it.<page>Who could believe! In such a hostile, unstable place! In all my time, I’ve never met a bug so brave.
original_zh_text: 你可曾听闻营地外的传闻？<page>骸骨脆岩构成纺络的基底，布满凶兽利齿。<page>据说古虫曾在此安家。<page>谁信啊！这种险恶之地！我这辈子没见过这么勇敢的虫。
translated_text: Have you heard of what awaits you outside the camp?<page>The fragile bony holes at the bottom of the farm are full of deadly creatures and dangers.<page>Ancient insects are believed to have lived here.<page>Who Believes Us? In such an unstable, unstable place. I have never met such a brave insect.
secondary_translated_text: 캠프 밖에서 당신을 기다리고있는 것에 대해 들어 본 적이 있습니까?<page>농장 바닥의 취약한 뼈 구멍은 치명적인 생물과 위험으로 가득합니다.<page>고대 곤충들이 이곳에 살았다고 믿어지고 있다.<page>누가 우리를 믿는가?이렇게 불안정하고 불안정한 곳에서나는 이렇게 용감한 곤충을 만난 적이 없다.

original_en_text: Sister, sister! What is that long, gleaming tooth you carry with you? Is it a weapon?<hpage>It is indeed, though you need not fear. I will not raise it against you. Its edge is meant for predators and other foes.<hpage>I strongly suggest you arm yourself similarly before your own journey begins.<page>Alas... for a pilgrim, that’s sin you speak of, sister.<page>We arm ourselves with prayer, garb ourselves in faith, and hope they prove enough to reach the Citadel’s glory. Such is our way...
original_zh_text: 姐妹！你带的闪亮长牙是武器吗？<hpage>正是，但无需惧怕。此刃只与掠食者与敌手相向。<hpage>强烈建议你启程前也备件武器。<page>唉……姐妹此言对朝圣者实属亵渎。我等以祷言为刃，以信仰为盾，唯此方能抵达圣堡。此乃吾辈之道……
translated_text: Sisters! Sisters! What brilliant teeth do you have? Is this a weapon?<hpage>That 's true, but you shouldn't be afraid. I 'm not going to tell you about it, it 's useful for predators and other enemies.<hpage>We strongly recommend that you arm yourself in the same way before you go on a trip.<page>¡Oh, yeah! For pilgrims, this is what you call a sin.<page>We can be armed with prayer, clothed with faith, and enough for the glory of the castle.
secondary_translated_text: 언니들!자매님들!당신은 어떤 이빨을 가지고 있습니까?이건 무기인가요?<hpage>그건 사실이지만, 너는 두려워하지 말아야 한다.나는 그것에 대해 말하지 않을 것이다. 그것은 포식자와 다른 적들에게 유용하다.<hpage>우리는 당신이 여행을 떠나기 전에 같은 방식으로 자신을 무장하는 것을 강력히 추천합니다.<page>오, 그래! "이것이 바로 너희가 죄라고 부르는 것이다.<page>우리는 기도로 무장하고, 신앙으로 옷을 입으며, 성의 영광을 위해 충분할 수 있습니다.

original_en_text: Oh! Back again? The wishwall is up! Ready for all the poor souls who’ve been left behind down here.<page>In Pharloom, wishes are granted to those truly devout, or so they say. And there ain’t no harm in us dregs having wishes too.<page>Why, I even went and added a little wish of my own to the wishwall! Fair’s fair. I did build the thing. Seems like the kingdom should be granting my wish before anyone else’s.
original_zh_text: 哦！回来啦？祈愿墙完工了！就等底下这些可怜虫来许愿了。<page>纺络的愿望只赐给真正虔诚的虫，都这么说。但咱这些底层渣滓许个愿总不犯法吧？<page>嘿，我还在墙上偷偷加了自己的小愿望！公平嘛，墙是我造的，圣堡该先实现我的愿望才对。
translated_text: Oh! Oh! Have you returned? The walls of desire are growing. Preparation for the Poor.<page>Wishes are given to those who are really good and to those who talk, whether we like our shit or not.<page>I added my little wish to the wall of wishes! Justice is justice. I have done it. The kingdom seems to satisfy my desires.
secondary_translated_text: 오! 오!오! 오!돌아왔어요?욕망의 벽이 커지고 있다.가난한 사람들을 위한 준비<page>소원은 우리가 우리의 똥을 좋아하든 싫어하든 정말로 좋은 사람들과 이야기하는 사람들에게 주어집니다.<page>나는 소원 벽에 나의 작은 소원을 추가했다!정의는 정의입니다.나는 그것을 해냈다. 왕국은 나의 욕망을 만족시키는 것 같다.

original_en_text: <hpage>What’s this you’re building, sir? A sign of some kind?<page>Aye, aye. You’re a sharp bug! A wishwall. It’s past time this old camp had one. As the resident fixer, I’ve taken it upon myself to sort it out.<page>They’re a popular thing about Pharloom, wishwalls. Useful too. So many prayers left unanswered. Gives ‘em a place to go.
original_zh_text: <hpage>先生这是在建造什么？某种标识？<page>啊，好眼力！这是祈愿墙。这老营地早该有一个。身为驻场维修师，自然该由我操办。<page>祈愿墙在纺络可流行了，很实用。那么多没回音的祈愿，总得有个归处。
translated_text: <hpage>What do you do? What are the signs?<page>You are a living insect. Walls of desire. In this old field there is one. I, as a specialist, is responsible for solving this problem.<page>"Wishing Wall " by Pharloom - Many prayers have gone unanswered, give me a place to go.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>뭐하는 거야?어떤 징후가 있습니까?<page>당신은 살아있는 곤충이다.욕망의 벽.이 오래된 현장에는 하나 있다.전문가로서 나는 이 문제를 해결할 책임이 있다.<page>Pharloom 의 "Wishing Wall" - Many prayers have gone unanswered, give me a place to go.

original_en_text: I must listen carefully... and pray with uninterrupted devotion. Only then will my faith be strong enough... to carry me upward...
original_zh_text: 必须专注聆听……虔心祷告。唯有如此，方能坚定信念，支撑我攀登……
translated_text: We pray that it will not be interrupted. Only then will my faith be strong. "Accept this."
secondary_translated_text: 우리는 그것이 중단되지 않기를 기도합니다.그때만 나의 믿음이 강해질 것이다. "이것을 받아들이세요. "

original_en_text: S’not a surprise it’s you rallying us to action, hunter. You had the sense about you, a bug bringing change’n all.<page>Course you’re more than just a bug, aint’cha! More than Weaver. Guess it’d take someone like you for my family to dare hope at success.<page>Go and prove our trust now, won’t you? We’ve spent our lifetimes wishing for another path. With a bit of luck, you might grant it.
original_zh_text: 果然是你来召集我们行动，猎手。我初见便知你是变革者。<page>当然，你并非寻常虫类，也不止是织者。看来只有你这般存在，才让我族敢奢望成功。<page>现在就去证明你值得我们托付吧？我们毕生渴求踏上另一条道路。如果运气眷顾，你或许能成全我们。
translated_text: No wonder you did it, Hunt. They have a sense of the mistakes in themselves that led to the change.<page>You 're not just a grandmother, are you? Really? I think that only people like you can wish my family success, and I'm not sure that's the case.<page>Let's show our confidence now. We all want a different path. If you're lucky, you can achieve it.
secondary_translated_text: 네가 그랬다는 건 당연한 일이야, 헌트.그들은 변화로 이어지는 자신의 실수가 있다는 느낌을 가지고 있습니다.<page>넌 그저 할머니가 아니야, 그렇지?진짜?당신 같은 사람만이 우리 가족의 성공을 기원할 수 있을 것 같은데, 그게 사실인지 잘 모르겠어요.<page>이제 자신감을 보여주자.우리 모두는 다른 길을 원해요. 운이 좋으면, 여러분은 그것을 성취할 수 있어요.

original_en_text: Well. Though this pilgrim’s name has been lost, still we sing.
original_zh_text: 罢了。虽名讳已失，歌声依旧。
translated_text: All is well, all is well, even though the names of the pilgrims have disappeared, we continue to sing.
secondary_translated_text: 모든 것이 좋고, 모든 것이 좋고, 순례자들의 이름이 사라졌음에도 불구하고, 우리는 계속 노래합니다.

original_en_text: Been hearing awful whispers in camp, about pilgrims driven mad by the hardships of the climb, crying out and attacking their fellows.<page>You’ve been out there. Tell me, is it really so?<hpage>You’ve heard it true, sir. On the roads, both pilgrims and beasts alike are consumed, driven to violence by a haunted thread, the source of which I have yet to discover.<page>Ah... I’d feared it was so. I won’t be able to trust a single face out on the path, then.<page>The risk of death was daunting enough, but the loneliness of such a journey, that seems almost too much to bear... Ah well. Just another test of our devotion, I suppose.
original_zh_text: 营地里常听到些可怖的流言，说攀登艰辛逼疯朝圣者，使其癫狂嚎叫，袭击同伴。<page>你是从外面来的。告诉我，真有这种事？<hpage>传言非虚，先生。路上朝圣者与野兽皆遭丝咒侵蚀，陷入狂暴，其源未明。<page>唉……果然。看来路上谁都不能信了。<page>死亡已经足够可怕，但独行的寂寞……简直难以承受……也罢，这是我等信仰必经的试炼。
translated_text: From the camp you could hear terrible rumors that the pilgrims had gone mad from the difficulty of climbing the mountain, crying and attacking their comrades.<page>Are you there, tell me! Are you really here?<hpage>Along the way pilgrims and animals absorbed ghostly threads, causing them to commit violent acts, the origin of which is still unknown.<page>¡Oh, yeah! Maybe that 's what happened. I can't believe the faces on the street.<page>The danger of death is quite terrible, but the loneliness of such a journey seems almost unbearable.
secondary_translated_text: 캠프에서 당신은 순례자들이 산을 등반하는 어려움으로 미쳐 울고 동료들을 공격했다는 끔찍한 소문을 들을 수있었습니다.<page>너 거기 있어, 말해줘!너 진짜 여기 있냐?<hpage>순례자와 동물들은 길을 따라 유령의 실을 흡수하여 폭력적인 행동을 저질렀는데, 그 기원은 여전히 알려지지 않았습니다.<page>오, 그래!아마도 그것이 일어난 일일지도 모른다.나는 거리의 얼굴들을 믿을 수가 없다.<page>죽음의 위험은 매우 끔찍하지만, 그러한 여행의 외로움은 거의 견딜 수 없는 것처럼 보입니다.

original_en_text: We pilgrims arm ourselves with prayer, garb ourselves in faith, and hope they prove enough to reach the Citadel’s glory. Such is our way...
original_zh_text: 朝圣者以祷言为刃，披信仰为甲，唯此方能抵达圣堡。此乃吾辈之道……
translated_text: We, pilgrims, armed with prayer, clothed with faith, may be enough for the glory of the castle.
secondary_translated_text: 우리 순례자들은 기도로 무장하고 신앙으로 옷을 입고 성의 영광을 위해 충분할 것입니다.

original_en_text: <hpage>What duty binds you to this old chapel, madam? The structure barely stands, and I see no signs of congregation.<page>Aye! Gone! The lot’o them, fled and hidden. But I’m not leaving till I’ve set this place right...<page>...It’s that Citadel above, you see. Even now, in Pharloom’s long decline, the simple bugs, they’re witless before it. Too grand. Too majestic. Too powerful.<page>This building’s state is a sad example of those who’d dare suggest another path...
original_zh_text: <hpage>女士，是何职责将你束缚在这破败教堂？此处梁柱倾颓，更无信众踪影。<page>唉！都散了！逃的逃藏的藏。但我要留下……直到把这儿整顿妥当……<page>……你瞧，都是上头圣堡造的孽。即便纺络衰败至此，愚昧虫众仍对其俯首。太宏伟，太威严，太强大。<page>这座建筑的惨状，正是胆敢另辟蹊径者的下场……
translated_text: <hpage>What are your responsibilities to the Old Church? The buildings were barely standing, and there was no sign of a meeting.<page>Ah, yeah! Ah, yes! We're out! Many have fled and hid themselves, but I will not leave until we have cleared this place.<page>... During the long fall of Faram, even now, these simple mistakes were foolish before.<page>The state of the building is a sad example for those who dare to offer a different path.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>낡은 교회에 대한 당신의 책임은 무엇인가?건물들은 거의 서있지 않았고, 회의의 흔적도 없었다.<page>아, 그래!아, 네!우린 나가야겠어!많은 사람들이 도망하여 숨었으나, 우리가 이 곳을 깨끗하게 할 때까지 나는 떠나지 않을 것이다.<page>...파람의 오랜 몰락 기간 동안, 지금도, 이러한 간단한 실수는 이전에는 어리석었다.<page>건물의 상태는 감히 다른 길을 제시하는 사람들에게 슬픈 예입니다.

original_en_text: Eh? What fortune is this? Our wish answered, even in a moment so dark!<page>You’ve proved quite the saviour, miss, and you’ve certainly earned the appreciation of this whole sorry lot.<hpage>You are welcome, sir. For you few, I hope these supplies may aid.
original_zh_text: 哎呀！这什么好运？这么黑暗危险的时刻祈愿居然实现了。<page>您真是救星啊小姐，我们这群可怜虫都打心眼里感激您。<hpage>能帮上忙就好。希望这点补给对你们有用。
translated_text: What's it? What is it? What is this wealth? Even in these dark times, our wishes have been fulfilled.<page>Lady, you have shown yourself to be a Savior, and you have indeed earned the praise of the poor.<hpage>Welcome to Doctor. I hope this material will be useful to many of you.
secondary_translated_text: 뭐예요?뭐야?이 부는 무엇입니까?이 어두운 시절에도 우리의 소원은 이루어졌습니다.<page>아가씨여, 당신은 자신을 구세주로 보여 주셨고, 가난한 사람들의 찬송을 받았습니다.<hpage>박사님께 환영합니다.이 자료가 여러분 중 많은 분들에게 유용하기를 바랍니다.

original_en_text: You, in the cloak... pray tread softly. I am meditating, gathering my faith... before my pilgrimage begins.<hpage>My steps are soft enough, madam. If I have disturbed you, it was not my intent.<page>Ahh... even your speech... far too loud. I can scarcely hear my thoughts. Please, be away...
original_zh_text: 穿披风那位……脚步放轻。我在冥想聚神……为朝圣做准备。<hpage>脚步够轻了，女士。若打扰了你实非本意。<page>唉……连说话声……都太吵。静不下心。请快离开……
translated_text: Wear a coat and pray lightly. We meditate and acquire faith. Before the pilgrimage begins.<hpage>My legs are very soft, ma ' am. Even if I interrupt, it is not my intention.<page>¡Oh, yeah! And his speech too. There's so much noise that I can barely hear my thoughts. Go out there.
secondary_translated_text: 외투를 입고 가볍게 기도하세요.우리는 명상하고 신앙을 얻습니다.순례가 시작되기 전에.<hpage>내 다리는 매우 부드럽습니다, 부인.내가 방해한다고 해도, 그건 내 의도가 아니야.<page>오, 그래!그리고 그의 연설도 마찬가지다.소음이 너무 많아서 내 생각을 거의 들을 수 없다.나가라.

original_en_text: I see you’ve gone and opened up the great bone gate back there. And without even asking my permission! Feeling curious, were you?<hpage>There is a vast grave beyond. I’d assumed most bugs died climbing the path, but it seems many fell before their trek had barely commenced.<page>Aye! Lost their lives to beasts, or to luck turned rotten. Others were simply formed too frail.<page>At least those poor souls can rest together. Death and death and death, the eternal promise of our eternal kingdom. Eventually, it claims us all.
original_zh_text: 看来你擅自开了后头的巨大骨门，甚至问都不问我！不怕好奇害死虫？<hpage>门后是片巨冢。本以为众虫多是殒命在攀登途中，但似是有许多死于起步？<page>唉！有的死于猛兽，有的运气不好，也有天生孱弱的。<page>但至少这些可怜虫可以共眠。无止尽的死亡，永恒国度的永恒承诺，终将吞噬众生。
translated_text: There I saw him open the big bony door and come out. You're very curious, right? Really?<hpage>I thought that most of the insects would die when I climbed this trail, but it seems that many of the insects fell before the start of the hike.<page>Ah, yeah! Ah, yes! Their lives are taken away by animals or spoiled by fate.The form of others is very fragile.<page>At least poor souls can sleep together. Death is the promise of our eternal Kingdom. In the end, it will take all our lives.
secondary_translated_text: 거기서 나는 그가 큰 뼈로 된 문을 열고 나가는 것을 보았다.정말 호기심이 많군요, 그렇죠?진짜?<hpage>이 산책로에 올라갈 때 대부분의 곤충들이 죽을 줄 알았는데, 하이킹이 시작되기 전에 많은 곤충들이 쓰러진 것 같다.<page>아, 그래!아, 네!그들의 삶은 동물에 의해 빼앗겼거나 운명에 의해 망쳐졌다. 다른 사람의 형태는 매우 취약하다.<page>적어도 가난한 영혼들은 함께 잠을 잘 수 있다.죽음은 우리의 영원한 왕국에 대한 약속입니다.결국, 그것은 우리의 모든 생명을 가져갈 것입니다.

original_en_text: Hunter! I’m thinking it was you that cleared my basement?<hpage>On first arrival here, the nesting creatures didn’t take kindly to my passing.<page>Ohho. They’re cranky bugs, alright. And they made an awful mess down here with their hatching and breeding.<page>You’ve my many thanks for seeing them off!
original_zh_text: 猎手！地窖里的那些家伙是你清理的？<hpage>初到此地时，那些栖居者可不待见我路过。<page>哈哈，都是些坏脾气的虫子。他们孵卵繁衍把下面搞得一团糟。<page>多谢你赶走了它们！
translated_text: The hunters! Have you cleaned the basement?<hpage>When I first came here, the nesting creatures were not very impressed with my death.<page>No, no, no, no. Incubation and reproduction have caused confusion.<page>Thank you for sending me! "
secondary_translated_text: 사냥꾼들!지하실을 청소했나요?<hpage>내가 처음 여기 왔을 때, 둥지를 짓는 생물들은 내 죽음에 대해 별로 감명을 받지 못했습니다.<page>아뇨, 아뇨, 아뇨, 아뇨.<page>나를 보내주셔서 감사합니다! "

original_en_text: <hpage>The bugs of your land, I have watched them, climbing towards their absolution without the flicker of a thought to what it means.<page>Aye. But isn’t it always such for those snared to serve your higher caste?<page>Our mortal mob did once act some defiance, unawares maybe, but successful in part, goaded towards it by Weavers’ will’n all.<hpage>You speak of the Citadel? Its former function has failed, but I can still sense its purpose, some. It is church and cage both.<page>Aye. Devised by your ancestors that monstrosity, and their wicked, clever minds. A system, or a web they’d likely call it, a way to keep their mother sealed in slumber, and themselves free to lavish in their false rule.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我观察了这片土地的虫。他们一心爬向救赎，却不懂这意味着什么。<page>是啊，但被你们高等族群使唤的不都这样。<page>我们凡虫不是没反抗过。当年被织者忽悠着，居然还真成了点事。<hpage>你说圣堡？虽然荒废了，还是能感觉到它的用途：既是教堂又是牢笼。<page>是啊。你祖辈造的这怪物，用狡猾心思织成网，让母亲陷入沉眠，自己却在外面称王。
translated_text: <hpage>I have seen the worms of your earth begging for forgiveness, but I do not know what it means.<page>But isn't that what all the people who serve their higher caste do?<page>Our bandits resisted, perhaps unconsciously, but, with Weaver's will and all the incentives, they succeeded in part.<hpage>Do you mean the castle? The previous function has failed, but the purpose is still felt.This is a cell, this is a church.<page>So their ancestors created these monsters and evil and smart spirits.You can call it a system or a network, a way to give your moms sleep and spend their free time with the wrong rules.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>"나는 너희 땅의 벌레들이 용서를 구걸하는 것을 보았지만, 그것이 무슨 뜻인지 모르겠다.<page>그러나 그것이 그들의 높은 카스트를 섬기는 모든 사람들이 하는 일이 아닌가?<page>우리의 강도들은 아마도 무의식적으로 저항했지만, 위버의 의지와 모든 인센티브로, 그들은 부분적으로 성공했습니다.<hpage>성을 뜻하는 거야?이전 기능은 실패했지만 목적은 여전히 느껴집니다. 이것은 세포이고 이것은 교회입니다.<page>그래서 그들의 조상들은이 괴물과 악과 영리한 영을 만들었습니다. 당신은 그것을 시스템 또는 네트워크라고 부를 수 있습니다, 당신의 엄마를 잠을주고 잘못된 규칙으로 자유 시간을 보낼 수있는 방법입니다.

original_en_text: <hpage>Maker, I bring a delivery from Bellhart below, lacquer for your long work.<page>Ahh. Know you distort the order of things, Old One. It is a rare want of your caste to serve us mortal bugs.<hpage>I am not my kin, Maker. I have seen enough pain born of their dominion. As much as I may, I choose to stand apart.<page>If your blood allows it so... And my thanks still for the lacquer. Pharloom’s fresh faces will welcome its sheen.
original_zh_text: <hpage>匠师，我从钟心镇送来漆料，够你用很久。<page>啊呀，古老者，这怎么合适。侍奉我们凡虫可不是你们族群的作风。<hpage>我和同族不一样。看够了他们统治下的苦难，自然不会同流合污。<page>不知您的同族会怎么想……但还是多谢漆料。纺络的新面孔会喜欢的。
translated_text: <hpage>Producer, I have sent from Berhart to supply the ink for your long-term work.<page>"Oh, I know that you are perverting the order of things, old man.To serve worms, men, is a rare desire of your caste.<hpage>I am not the Father nor the Creator. I have seen enough of the suffering caused by your regime. It may be so, but I decided to go.<page>If his blood allows, he likes to paint.The fresh face of the beacon is in the light.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>프로듀서님, 저는 버하트에서 당신의 장기적인 작업에 잉크를 공급하도록 보냈습니다.<page>"오, 나는 당신이 사물의 질서를 왜곡하고 있다는 것을 알고 있습니다, 노인. 벌레를 섬기는 것은 당신의 계급에서 드문 욕망입니다.<hpage>나는 아버지도 창조주도 아니다.나는 당신의 정권이 초래한 고통을 충분히 보았다.그럴 수도 있겠지만, 나는 가기로 결정했다.<page>그의 피가 허락한다면 그는 그림을 그리는 것을 좋아한다. 빛 속에서 빛나는 등대의 신선한 얼굴이다.

original_en_text: Until cavern’s collapse, the masks must be made!
original_zh_text: 直到洞窟崩塌，雕刻都不能停！
translated_text: You need to make a mask before the cave collapses!
secondary_translated_text: 동굴이 무너지기 전에 마스크를 만들어야 한다!

original_en_text: Enough talk, Old One. My contract remains. I’ll work till caverns’ collapse.<hpage>Very well, Maker. If it is within my power to do so, I shall see your lands saved.
original_zh_text: 聊够了吧，古老者。契约还在，我要继续刻面甲，直到大地崩塌。<hpage>好吧，匠师。要是有办法，我会保护好这片土地。
translated_text: Enough, old man, my contract is still in effect. We'll work until the cave collapses.<hpage>Bravo, Maker. If I can do this, I can save your country. "
secondary_translated_text: 그만해, 노인, 내 계약은 여전히 유효하다.우리는 동굴이 무너질 때까지 일할 것이다.<hpage>Bravo 메이커내가 이걸 할 수 있다면, 네 나라를 구할 수 있을거야. "

original_en_text: Ahh. Old One. Your kind should know it’s rude to expose me such. Unmasked, the task becomes heavy. <hpage>I had the desire to hear you lucid, Maker, though you may protest.<page>Aye. Well its no great shock to have you visit. I’ve felt the stirrings of our monarch, even all the way out here, the tremors of her kin brought close.<page>You’re planning a confrontation with her then? The one atop? Our great, frayed god?<hpage>Our meeting seems inevitable, though first I seek the strength to ensure a favourable outcome.<page>Ha! As I’d have guessed! Your ancient kind aren’t told to abide one another peaceably.<page>Well, assuming you prevail, I’ll ask only that my labour may continue. No matter the state of these lands, you should well know the necessity of my service.
original_zh_text: 啊呀，古老者，你们这一族最清楚，不戴面甲交谈太失礼了。<hpage>我就是想和清醒的你聊聊，别见怪。<page>好吧。不过我倒是不奇怪你会来。连我这都能感觉到那位的躁动，想必就是因为你。<page>所以你打算要去她算账？找我们伟大却又衰败的女王？<hpage>迟早要见，但我得先积蓄力量。<page>哈！早猜到了！你们古族从来都是窝里斗。<page>要是你赢了，我只求能继续刻面甲。无论王国结局如何，我的活都不能停。
translated_text: Oh, old man, a man like you must know how rude it would be to expose me.When the veil is torn, the work becomes difficult.<hpage>You may protest, but I want to hear your clear voice, Creator.<page>I felt here the excitement of our monarch, even when the trembling of his parents was near.<page>Are you fighting her? Up here? Tired and tired God.<hpage>Although our meeting seemed inevitable, I first sought the strength to achieve a favorable outcome.<page>Ooo! Just as I imagined it! Elderly people are not invited to live in peace.<page>If I win, I ask that my work continue, and I will not be able to do so. Whatever the state of the earth, you must be well aware of the need for my services.
secondary_translated_text: 오, 늙은이, 당신 같은 사람은 나를 폭로하는 것이 얼마나 무례한지 알아야합니다. 베일이 찢어지면 일은 어려워집니다.<hpage>당신은 항의할 수 있지만, 나는 당신의 맑은 목소리를 듣고 싶습니다, 창조주여.<page>나는 여기서 그의 부모의 떨림이 가까웠을 때에도 우리 군주의 흥분을 느꼈다.<page>너는 그녀와 싸우고 있니?여기 올라가요?피곤하고 피곤한 하느님.<hpage>비록 우리의 만남은 불가피해 보이지만, 나는 먼저 유리한 결과를 얻을 수 있는 힘을 찾았다.<page>오오!내가 상상했던대로!노인들은 평화롭게 살도록 초대받지 않는다.<page>만약 내가 이기면, 나는 나의 일을 계속해 달라고 부탁한다.지구의 상태가 무엇이든간에, 너희는 나의 봉사에 대한 필요성을 잘 알고 있어야 한다.

original_en_text: Back again, Old One? The effects of your... altercation with the pale mother... those are plainly sensed. The fate for these caverns feels grim.<page>I’ll take it things have taken a turn more complicated? Or was this the aftermath anticipated all along?<hpage>In our meeting, a mortal blow was dealt, but the monarch’s desperate death throes now threaten to take this whole kingdom with her.<page>Ha! I’m not surprised! It’s always the way, aye? Your ancient kind, vying for dominion, and us mortal bugs squashed unseen underneath.<hpage>It was freedom I sought, Maker. Naive perhaps, but this is not the fate I wished to come.
original_zh_text: 又来了古老者？我感觉到了你和苍白女王争斗……不过看来情况不太妙。<page>我猜事情变得复杂了？还是说你早料到会这样？<hpage>我给了她致命一击，可她临死挣扎要让整个王国陪葬。<page>哈！一点都不意外！你们古族争权夺利，我们小虫子活该被碾碎。<hpage>我想要自由，匠师。既为了我也为了你们。或许是有些天真，但这不是我要的结局。
translated_text: "Are you back, old man? "Obviously your flu is pale, and you 're going to fight with your mom.<page>Do you think it 's getting more complicated? Or is it the expected result?<hpage>We were dealt a fatal blow during the meeting, but the desperate mourning of the monarch 's death now threatens the entire kingdom.<page>Ooo! I'm not surprised! It has always been, right? What? While their ancient species compete for supremacy, our human insects are being crushed out of sight.<hpage>This is the freedom I seek, the Creator. It may seem naive, but this is not the fate I wanted.
secondary_translated_text: "돌아왔어, 노인? "분명히 독감은 창백하고 엄마와 싸워야 할 것 같다."<page>더 복잡해졌다고 생각하십니까?아니면 예상된 결과인가?<hpage>우리는 회의에서 치명적인 타격을 받았지만, 군주의 죽음에 대한 절망적인 애도는 이제 왕국 전체를 위협하고 있습니다.<page>오오!난 놀라지 않아!그건 항상 그랬죠, 그렇죠?뭐야?그들의 고대 종들이 우위를 놓고 경쟁하는 동안, 우리의 인간 곤충들은 시야에서 분쇄되고 있습니다.<hpage>이것이 내가 추구하는 자유, 창조자입니다.순진하게 보일지 모르지만, 이것은 내가 원하는 운명이 아니다.

original_en_text: All deserve a face. A chance to be! Until I wither, for the faceless I shall provide.
original_zh_text: 所有生灵都该有张脸，有机会存在！只要我还没倒下，就会给无面者造脸。
translated_text: Everybody has a face, possibilities! We feed the faceless to death.
secondary_translated_text: 누구나 얼굴이 있고, 가능성이 있다.우리는 얼굴없는 사람들을 죽게 한다.

original_en_text: To exist, to die, a face is needed. It is the essential thing.
original_zh_text: 不论死活，都得有一张脸。这是根本。
translated_text: You need a face to live and to die, that 's the most important thing.
secondary_translated_text: 살아 죽기 위해서는 얼굴이 필요해, 그게 제일 중요한 거야.

original_en_text: <hpage>Maker, I bring a delivery from Bellhart below, lacquer for your long work. <page>Good! Good! To seal. To protect. May Pharloom’s fresh faces gleam bright.
original_zh_text: <hpage>匠师，我从钟心镇送来漆料，够你用很久。<page>好！好！用来封存，用来保护。让纺络的新面孔闪闪发亮。
translated_text: <hpage>Producer, I have sent from Berhart to supply the ink for your long-term work.<page>Everything is okay, everything is okay! All right, all right! All right! Closed for protection, the new face of May Farrow is shining.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>프로듀서님, 저는 버하트에서 당신의 장기적인 작업에 잉크를 공급하도록 보냈습니다.<page>모든 게 괜찮아, 모든 게 괜찮아!좋아요, 좋아요!좋아요!보호를 위해 폐쇄, 메이 파로우의 새로운 얼굴이 빛나고 있습니다.

original_en_text: Take reward for service made, visitor! Gift for you, to spend or treasure!
original_zh_text: 收下报酬吧客人！要用掉还是收着都行！
translated_text: The tourists will be rewarded for the services provided.Gifts for you are worth using or worth it!
secondary_translated_text: 관광객은 서비스 제공에 대 한 보상을 받을 것입니다. 선물은 사용할 가치가 있거나 가치가 있습니다!

original_en_text: A visitor! Grand you are. But you have already a mask. Already a face. It is for those without that I must carve.
original_zh_text: 欢迎！尊贵的客人。可你已经有面甲了，已经有脸了。我的刻刀只为无面者服务。
translated_text: Visitors! You are very good, but you wear a mask. I already have a face. You must create a sculpture for those who do not.
secondary_translated_text: 방문객들!당신은 매우 잘하지만 당신은 마스크를 쓰고 있습니다.나는 이미 얼굴이 있다.그렇지 않은 사람들을 위해 조각을 만들어야 한다.

original_en_text: To work! To work! The masks must be carved.
original_zh_text: 雕刻！雕刻！必须继续雕刻面甲。
translated_text: Go to work! Go to work! The mask is sculpted.

original_en_text: Did you treat with the creature upon the summit?<page>Your legged ancestors once found her company compelling, enough to build their chambers and their calling device at the height of this perilous peak.<hpage>I have paid my respects, and been granted her favour. Her down now fills my cloak, and does much to ward against the frost of these heights.<page>To pass something so precious... That’s a mighty gift you’ve been given. Seems she’s thrown her lot in with you.<page>I’d not have guessed her so opposed to our threaded monarch, but then she too must have sensed the wretched state of things, and the harsher change to come.
original_zh_text: 见过山顶上那位了吗？<page>你那些多足的先祖对她十分信服，甚至在这么险的山峰上修了屋子打造机器。<hpage>我去拜访过了，也受到了她的青睐，得了这身御寒的绒毛。<page>连这个都送你……真是下了血本。她把宝押在你身上了。<page>没想到她这么反对苍白之主，恐怕她也看出纺络情况不对，有大事要发生了。
translated_text: Have you ever met creatures in the mountains?<page>His ancestors found the attraction in his company to build a room and telephone equipment on this dangerous hill.<hpage>I respected her and won her favor. His feathers filled my coat and helped me withstand this high ice.<page>Giving something valuable is a powerful gift that you will receive. It seems that she has given it her destiny.<page>I did not expect her to speak out so strongly against our cursed monarch, but she must have also felt the poverty of the situation and the more serious changes that were inevitable.
secondary_translated_text: 산에서 생물을 본 적이 있습니까?<page>그의 선조들은 이 위험한 언덕에 방과 전화 장비를 짓는 그의 회사에서 매력을 발견했다.<hpage>나는 그녀를 존경했고 그녀의 호의를 얻었다.그의 깃털은 내 외투를 채우고 이 높은 얼음을 견딜 수 있도록 도와주었다.<page>소중한 것을 주는 것은 당신이 받을 강력한 선물입니다.그녀는 그녀의 운명을 그에게 준 것 같다.<page>나는 그녀가 우리의 저주받은 군주에 대해 그렇게 강력하게 말할 것이라고 기대하지 않았지만, 그녀는 또한 상황의 빈곤과 피할 수없는 더 심각한 변화를 느꼈을 것입니다.

original_en_text: Ahh. Old One. Your kind should know it’s rude to expose me such. Unmasked, the task becomes heavy. <hpage>I had the desire to hear you lucid, Maker, though you may protest.<page>Aye. Well its no great shock to have you visit. I’ve felt, and heard, the effects of your... altercation with the pale mother... The fate for these caverns seems grim.<page>I’ll take it things have taken a turn more complicated? Or was this the aftermath anticipated all along?<hpage>In our meeting, a mortal blow was dealt, but the monarch’s desperate death throes now threaten to take this whole kingdom with her.<page>Ha! I’m not surprised! It’s always the way, aye? Your ancient kind, vying for dominion, and us mortal bugs squashed unseen underneath.<hpage>It was freedom I sought, Maker, for myself and for you mortal few. Naive perhaps, but this is not the fate I wished to come.
original_zh_text: 啊呀，古老者，你们这一族最清楚，不戴面甲交谈太失礼了。<hpage>我就是想和清醒的你聊聊，别见怪。<page>好吧。不过我倒是不奇怪你会来。我感觉到、听到了你和苍白女王争斗……不过看来情况不太妙。<page>我猜事情变得复杂了？还是说你早料到会这样？<hpage>我给了她致命一击，可她临死挣扎要让整个王国陪葬。<page>哈！一点都不意外！你们古族争权夺利，我们小虫子活该被碾碎。<hpage>我想要自由，匠师。既为了我也为了你们。或许是有些天真，但这不是我要的结局。
translated_text: The old thing! A man like you must know how rude it would be to expose me.When the veil is torn, the work becomes difficult.<hpage>You may protest, but I want to hear your clear voice, Creator.<page>It is not surprising that you are here. I feel and feel their influence. The fight with the pale mother - the fate of these caves seems heavy.<page>Do you think it 's getting more complicated? Or is it the expected result?<hpage>We were dealt a fatal blow during the meeting, but the desperate mourning of the monarch 's death now threatens the entire kingdom.<page>Ooo! I'm not surprised! It has always been, right? What? While their ancient species compete for supremacy, our human insects are being crushed out of sight.<hpage>Creator, I ask for freedom for you and for you. It may seem naive, but this is not the fate I wanted.
secondary_translated_text: 낡은 물건!너 같은 사람은 나를 폭로하는 것이 얼마나 무례한 일인지 알겠구나. 베일이 찢어지면 일이 어려워진다.<hpage>당신은 항의할 수 있지만, 나는 당신의 맑은 목소리를 듣고 싶습니다, 창조주여.<page>네가 여기 있는 것은 놀랄 일이 아니다.그들의 영향력을 느끼고 느끼고 있다.창백한 어머니와의 싸움 - 이 동굴의 운명은 무거운 것 같습니다.<page>더 복잡해졌다고 생각하십니까?아니면 예상된 결과인가?<hpage>우리는 회의에서 치명적인 타격을 받았지만, 군주의 죽음에 대한 절망적인 애도는 이제 왕국 전체를 위협하고 있습니다.<page>오오!난 놀라지 않아!그건 항상 그랬죠, 그렇죠?뭐야?그들의 고대 종들이 우위를 놓고 경쟁하는 동안, 우리의 인간 곤충들은 시야에서 분쇄되고 있습니다.<hpage>창조자여, 나는 당신과 당신을 위해 자유를 요청합니다.순진하게 보일지 모르지만, 이것은 내가 원하는 운명이 아니다.

original_en_text: Late! Late you are! And already a mask. Already a face. It is for those without that I must carve.

original_en_text: A fine face, yours. Not of my work. Not of this kingdom’s craft. Not now at least.<page>But the deeper form. Distant relationship. Some form of Pharloom and our old, legged, stewards. <page>Now! To work. To work! The masks are needed.
original_zh_text: 你这张脸不错。不是我的手艺，也不是纺络的手艺。至少现在不是。<page>但更深处，有渊源。和古时候那些多足管事的一样。<page>好了！干活！干活！需要更多面甲！
translated_text: Your face is beautiful. It 's not my job, it 's not the art of the kingdom. At least for now,<page>In a deeper sense.Long-distance relationships.Long-legged housewives with our old Fal.<page>Now! Time to Work! I need a mask.

original_en_text: <hpage>You have the sight, Maker. Tell me what you see in me?<page>Your mask... It reads clear enough, Old One. Watcher, hunter, monarch even, though you may reject that station.<page>A complex visage, perhaps, yet still to my sight it looks unresolved.<hpage>If you see a transitional state, it is one I have accepted. My mask has remained defined through lifetimes uncounted.<page>Aye. Rigid I’m sure, but your kind rarely develop evenly, and the lifetime of bugs are poor measure for one like you.<page>Could be there’s more growth awaiting you yet...
original_zh_text: <hpage>匠师好眼力。在我身上看到什么了？<page>你的面甲……上面清清楚楚。守望者，猎手，甚至君主——就算你不认最后这个。<page>挺复杂的一张脸，但在我看来还没定型。<hpage>如果是过渡状态，那我早已接受。这面甲已陪我度过了不知多少辈子的时间。<page>是啊。不过你们古族生长发育不合常理，我们虫子的几辈子可没法衡量你的年纪。<page>说不定你还能再长大呢……
translated_text: <hpage>I have a vision, Creator, what do you see in me?<page>You see the mask clearly, old man, even a guard, a hunter, a king, you can reject this place.<page>It can be a difficult face, but in my opinion, it is not yet decided.<hpage>If you look at the changes, then these are the changes that I 've embraced. And the mask stays in shape for a lifetime.<page>Of course, it 's hard, but people like you rarely develop evenly, and for people like you, worm life is worse.<page>Maybe you 're waiting for your growth.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>나는 환상을 가지고 있습니다, 창조주여, 당신은 내 안에 무엇을 보십니까?<page>마스크를 잘 봐요, 노인, 경비원, 사냥꾼, 왕이라도 이 곳을 거부할 수 있어요.<page>그것은 어려운 얼굴이 될 수 있지만, 내 의견으로는, 그것은 아직 결정되지 않았습니다.<hpage>당신이 변화를 보면, 이것은 내가 받아들인 변화입니다.그리고 마스크는 평생 동안 모양을 유지합니다.<page>물론, 그것은 어렵지만, 당신 같은 사람들은 거의 균등하게 발전하지 않으며, 당신 같은 사람들에게는 벌레의 삶이 더 나빠집니다.<page>아마도 당신은 당신의 성장을 기다리고 있습니다.

original_en_text: Phew. You’re lookin’ a bit raw there, miss. I’m thinkin’ it’ll take more than my nectar to fix you up.<hpage>A parasite of your land has twisted itself into my shell. Its writhing is causing some discomfort.<hpage>If not for my unique constitution, I suspect it would have already consumed me entirely.<page>Well, don’t be bringing such dangerous things in here! Head to the top of the moors. There’s an old doctor up there hiding in her bell.<page>Her remedies are said to often hurt more’n they help, but given your state, I’d say it’s worth the risk.
original_zh_text: 嚯，您看着不太对劲啊，小姐。光靠我的蜜露，可治不了您这毛病。<hpage>我的甲壳里钻入了寄生物，它的蠕动使我不太舒服。<hpage>若不是体质特殊，我可能早被啃噬干净了。<page>啊，别把这种危险的玩意带到我这来！赶紧去沼泽的顶部，那里有一位老医生！她躲在一口钟里。<page>虽说她开的药往往比疾病本身的危害还大，但您这状况值得赌一把。
