original_zh_text: <page>还惦记着陈年蜜露？<page>别看我现在出的价高，之前路过的阔绰顾客给得更多呢！
translated_text: <page>Do you want Sam to come back?<page>My costs may seem high, but I can assure you that some of the best mistakes made in the past have yielded more rewards.
secondary_translated_text: <page>샘이 돌아오길 원하니?<page>내 비용은 높게 보일 수 있지만, 과거에 저지른 가장 좋은 실수 중 일부는 더 많은 보상을 제공했다고 확신 할 수 있습니다.

original_en_text: Any chance you’d reconsider dealing with my blasted craw problem? I’d offer fair reward for your efforts.
original_zh_text: 真不打算帮我收拾房顶上的麻烦？酬劳保证让您满意。
translated_text: Think about my inconvenient question. I will reward you for your efforts.
secondary_translated_text: 나의 불편한 질문을 생각해봐.나는 너의 노력에 대해 너에게 보상할 것이다.

original_en_text: Traveller, I’m not wanting to impose, but I’ve a wish that one of your able sort could likely grant.<hpage>I’ve my own task to attend, good sir, but I’ll hear you out.<page>It’s those blasted craws atop here. My roof is fast becoming their cosy nest! Now they’ve grown so bold they’re starting to attack pilgrims as they pass.<hpage>Would you simply have them slain? If so, your sturdy shell seems more than up to that task?<page>If only it were so simple. Kill the ones above, and more just keep coming. It’s the warmth of this home you see. Draws ‘em right in.<page>I’m looking for a long-term solution. A scarecraw! I’ll build the biggest there’s ever been, so fearsome it’ll keep those craws away for good!
original_zh_text: 旅行者，本不该劳烦您，但有件事非得您这样的利落角色才能办。<hpage>虽然我还有自己的事要去做，但请说吧，先生。<page>您看到房顶上那群腐囊虫了吗？它们快把我这儿当成自己的窝了！最近胆子越来越肥，已经开始攻击过路的朝圣者了。<hpage>你是想直接把它们杀光？看你这身强健的躯壳，办这事应该不费劲吧？<page>要这么简单就好了。杀完一茬又来一茬，全怪我这酒馆太暖和，招虫子。<page>得想个一劳永逸的办法——扎个巨型稻草人！保准吓得它们再不敢靠近！
translated_text: Traveler, I don't want to force others, but I would like you to understand this.<hpage>I have my own job, but I will listen.<page>The crabs have fallen. Soon my roof will be your shelter. They have become brave and began to attack the passing pilgrims.<hpage>Do you want to kill them? If so, is a stable shell enough to accomplish this task?<page>I wish it was that simple. If you kill one from above, there will be many more. Look at the warmth of this house! Direct attraction.<page>I am looking for a long term solution. Shake it. I 'll do the best I 've ever done, It 's so horrible that I 'll stay away from the crab forever!
secondary_translated_text: 여행자님, 저는 다른 사람들에게 강요하고 싶지 않지만, 이 점을 이해해주길 바랍니다.<hpage>나는 내 일이 있지만, 나는 그것을 들을 것이다.<page>게들이 쓰러졌다.곧 내 지붕이 너의 피난처가 될 거야.그들은 용감해졌고 지나가는 순례자들을 공격하기 시작했다.<hpage>그들을 죽이고 싶니?만약 그렇다면, 안정적인 쉘이 이 작업을 수행하기에 충분한가?<page>나는 그것이 그렇게 간단했으면 좋겠다.위에서 한 명을 죽이면 더 많은 사람들이 있을 것이다.이 집의 따뜻함을 보세요!직접적인 매력을 얻다.<page>장기적인 해결책을 찾고 있습니다.흔들어봐. 내가 지금까지 해왔던 최선을 다해. 너무 끔찍해서 영원히 게로부터 멀어질 거야!

original_en_text: Tis a blessed bit of luck to find this place, eh, sister?<page>The climb’s proved harder than even my best guessin’, but there’s still some vigour left in these old limbs. Doubly so, now I have a belly full of nectar!
original_zh_text: 能找着这酒馆，真算撞大运了！<page>这段攀登比我预想的还要艰难，但我这副老甲壳里仍然残存着些许活力。如今，狠狠灌上几盏蜜露，更是精神倍增！
translated_text: You are lucky to have found this place, sister.<page>It was more difficult, but the former participants still have their vitality. "
secondary_translated_text: 이 곳을 찾은 건 행운이야, 누나.<page>더 어려웠지만 이전 참가자들은 여전히 활력을 가지고 있습니다. "

original_en_text: Care for a drink, traveller? My nectar’s got a kick that’ll warm your shell in these sodden climes.
original_zh_text: 旅行者，来盏蜜露暖暖身子？这地方湿气重，而我的蜜露最能驱寒。
translated_text: How about a drink, friends? Honey will help keep you warm as much as possible.
secondary_translated_text: 술 한잔 어때, 친구들?꿀은 가능한 한 따뜻하게 유지하는 데 도움이됩니다.

original_en_text: Hoy... sister! I’m sat here all bent and bedraggled, but you look fresh as the day you was hatched!<page>How do you fare so well in these drenched and dangerous lands? Maybe you got a secret you could share?<hpage>None that would offer easy aid, good bug. Whatever luck or savvy brought you this far, may it continue on your journey.
original_zh_text: 嘿……小姐！我这破甲壳疼得我直不起腰，你的倒鲜亮得像是刚破卵而出！<page>在这种鬼地方你怎么保养的？有啥秘诀能透露不？<hpage>没有什么秘诀，在这种地方只能靠自己，无论靠的是运气还是智慧。
translated_text: Hello, Sister! I sit here dirty, but you look as fresh as the day you were destroyed! "<page>What do you do in this humid and dangerous place? Maybe they have a secret.<hpage>No one can help you easily, which is a good mistake.No matter how lucky or understanding you are, I hope you continue your journey.
secondary_translated_text: 안녕하세요, 언니!나는 여기 더러워서 앉아 있지만, 너는 네가 파괴된 날처럼 신선해 보인다! "<page>이 습하고 위험한 곳에서 당신은 무엇을 합니까?아마도 그들은 비밀을 가지고 있을 것이다.<hpage>아무도 당신을 쉽게 도울 수 없습니다, 그것은 좋은 실수입니다. 당신이 얼마나 운이 좋거나 이해하더라도, 나는 당신이 당신의 여행을 계속하기를 바랍니다.

original_en_text: <hpage>For now, bartender, I cannot spare so many rosaries.<page>Suit yourself. Maybe you’d rather a pour of the cheap stuff? Give your shell a kick before you head out into our blighted lands.
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，眼下我拿不出这么多念珠。<page>没关系，那来盏便宜货？出发前给自己壮壮胆。
translated_text: <hpage>"Barrier, I can't take off so many rosaries.<page>Do you want a cheap drink? Before entering the affected area, remove your helmet.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>"장벽, 나는 그렇게 많은 로자리를 벗을 수 없다.<page>싼 음료수를 원하십니까?감염된 지역에 들어가기 전에 헬멧을 벗으십시오.

original_en_text: <hpage>My travels took me through a town beside your moors, in a vein of old bells. Its residents are bound upon a vicious thread.<page>Ahh. So Pharloom’s curse has strung’em tight. A frightful thing. Word’d long gone silent from over their way.<hpage>I suggest you pass warning to your patrons, bartender. If they’re travelling the bellside paths, best they give that place wide berth.<page>Aye. I’ll let’em know, traveller, though in these cursed times, does any safe path still exist?
original_zh_text: <hpage>我路过了一个位于古老钟脉里的小镇，就在这片沼泽旁边，那里的居民全被凶恶的丝线缠绕着。<page>啊……纺络的诅咒把那儿的虫子紧紧束缚，可怕得很。那镇上很久就没有音讯传出来过了。<hpage>酒保先生，我建议你提醒客人们，若是要走钟脉边的小道，务必离那地方远点。<page>没问题，旅行者。不过话说回来，如今这世道哪还有安全的路哟。
translated_text: <hpage>My journey passed through a village near the desert, where an ancient bell hung.<page>Pharaoh 's curse bound them just as strongly. It 's terrible. The news is silent.<hpage>I recommend that you tell your customers about this, bartender.If you are walking down the street next to the clock tower, it is best to stay away from this area.<page>Yes, I inform you, despite these cursed times, is there a safe route for travelers?
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>나의 여행은 고대 종이 걸려있는 사막 근처의 마을을 통과했습니다.<page>파라오의 저주도 그들을 강하게 묶었다.정말 끔찍하다.뉴스는 침묵한다.<hpage>바텐더에게 이 점에 대해 고객님께 알려주세요. 만약 시계탑 옆 거리를 걸어다니는다면 이 지역에서 멀리 떨어져 있는 것이 좋습니다.<page>네, 제가 알려 드리겠습니다. 이 저주받은 시간에도 불구하고 여행자들에게 안전한 경로가 있습니까?

original_en_text: Best be visiting that doctor right quick, miss! She’s up there, at the top of the moors, over toward the bellvein.<page>Her methods might be suspect, but you’re lookin’ sorely in need of service.
original_zh_text: 小姐，您最好赶紧去看医生！就在沼泽顶部的钟脉附近。<page>虽然她的治疗方法很是邪乎，但您这身子骨可拖不起。
translated_text: It is best to go to the doctor quickly! He was high up in the desert, going to the ring of bells.<page>You may have road problems, but you need a lot of maintenance.
secondary_translated_text: 빨리 의사에게 가는 것이 좋습니다!그는 사막의 높은 곳에 있었고, 종소리까지 가려고 했다.<page>도로에 문제가있을 수도 있지만 많은 유지 보수가 필요합니다.

original_en_text: Might have taken me a beat to build the courage, but I can feel it, closer now... the Citadel calling me up.
original_zh_text: 我可能得多喝点才能鼓足勇气，继续上路了。但我能感觉到，圣堡离我更近了……它在顶上呼唤我呢。
translated_text: Maybe it 's a hard blow to be brave, but now the castle I feel closest to is calling me.
secondary_translated_text: 용기 있는 건 힘든 타격이었을지도 모르지만, 지금 내가 가장 가까운 성이 나를 부르고 있다.

original_en_text: <hpage>Here is the Ragpelt, sir. I hope the amount is sufficient for your work.<page>Aye. This should be enough. Once I find a quiet moment, I’ll get straight to building that mighty scarecraw.<page>With a little luck, my roof should be clear of those pests when next you pass by. Thank you kindly, traveller!
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，这些是你要的破毛皮。希望足够帮你制作稻草人。<page>够了够了！等我腾出手就去扎稻草人。<page>运气好的话，待你下次路过时，房顶应该已经清静了。衷心感谢你，旅者！
translated_text: <hpage>That's Ragfeldt! I hope you have enough money for work.<page>When I find a minute of silence, I will immediately make this mighty heel.<page>If you are lucky, next time you pass by my roof there will be no parasites.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>그건 Ragfeldt!나는 네가 일하기에 충분한 돈이 있었으면 좋겠다.<page>1 분간의 침묵을 찾으면, 나는 즉시 이 강력한 발꿈치를 만들 것이다.<page>운이 좋으면 다음에 내 지붕을 지나가면 기생충이 없을 것이다.

original_en_text: If you’re collecting Ragpelt from the crawbugs, those young’ns above here’ll be slim pickings. It’s the mature craws you want, over by the watermound. They’ll drop the stuff a-plenty.<page>Course, you’ll need to do some pointed persuading if you’re planning to separate rag from bug...
original_zh_text: 要收集腐囊虫的破毛皮，房顶那些小崽子可不够用。去水丘旁边找成年腐囊虫，它们身上有更多的货。<page>当然，你得用点“尖锐”的手段，才能让它们乖乖交出毛皮……
translated_text: If you are collecting crab sand shells, then the carcasses mentioned above will be different options.This is the mature crab you want, right next to a water hill throwing a heap.<page>Of course, if you 're thinking about the difference between trash and insects, you 'll need some specific conviction.
secondary_translated_text: 게 모래 껍질을 수집하는 경우, 위에서 언급 한 시체는 다른 옵션이 될 것입니다. 이것은 당신이 원하는 성숙한 게, 물 언덕 옆에서 더미를 던지고 있습니다.<page>물론 쓰레기와 곤충의 차이점에 대해 생각한다면 특정 신념이 필요합니다.

original_en_text: You’re back, miss! Heard a little commotion below. I trust everything went... erm, smoothly?<hpage><hpage>Sir, your cellar seems to have an ant problem. I assume, in sending me down, it merely slipped your mind to mention?<page>Ah... Oh yes! Well, with your weapon, and talent, and what... I’m sure they didn’t pose a problem? Ahem.<page>And why! I see you’ve collected your prize, so we’ve both come out well from the trade!<page>Enjoy your nectar, miss. No simple pilgrim will ever taste a drop so fine.
original_zh_text: 小姐，您回来啦！底下动静不小……没出什么岔子吧？<hpage><hpage>先生，你家地窖闹蚂蚁，怎么不提前知会？<page>哎！您这身手……小小蚂蚁肯定不在话下嘛！是吧？<page>啊哈！我看您也得到了战利品，这笔交易对咱们双方都算得上圆满！<page>小姐，好好享受这瓶蜜露吧。这滋味普通的朝圣者可尝不着。
translated_text: You're home, girl. You could hear the riots there. I think it's over, right? Agreed?<hpage><hpage>There is a problem with ants in your basement. Did you forget to tell me when they did?<page>¡Oh, yeah! Oh yeah! Use your weapons, talents, etc. Q. Was there really no problem? Coughing.<page>Why? I think I won the prize, so I 'm fine.<page>Enjoy the drinks. You can't taste a better drop.
secondary_translated_text: 집에 왔어, 소녀.그곳에서 폭동소리를 들을 수 있었다.내 생각엔 다 끝났어, 그렇지?동의했나?<hpage><hpage>당신의 지하실에 개미가 문제가 있습니다.그들이 할 때 나한테 말 잊었니?<page>오, 그래! Oh yeah!무기, 재능 등을 사용하십시오.정말 문제가 없었나요?기침하다.<page>왜요?내가 상을 받았다고 생각하니, 나는 괜찮아.<page>음료를 즐기세요.더 좋은 맛은 없습니다.

original_en_text: Ahh. Fair enough, traveller. You’ve clearly got your own tasks to be on with. I’ll manage, no doubt.
original_zh_text: 唉，理解理解。你毕竟有要事在身，我再想想办法吧。
translated_text: That 's right, traveler, of course, you have a homework assignment. I will, of course, take care of it.
secondary_translated_text: 그렇군요, 여행자님, 물론 숙제도 있어요.물론, 나는 그것을 돌볼 것이다.

original_en_text: As payment goes, I’ve got something I think you’d make good use of. A spare crafting kit.<page>I’d been holding onto it for someone else, but they’ve been gone long enough now, I know they won’t be returning.
original_zh_text: 酬劳的话，我这有个东西，您应该能用得上——一个多余的制作匣。<page>本来这是要留给别人的，但那位怕是已经回不来了。
translated_text: While the payments are happening, I think there are some that you can take advantage of.<page>I have already booked for others but I know they won't come back because they haven't been here long enough.
secondary_translated_text: 지불이 진행되는 동안, 나는 당신이 활용할 수있는 몇 가지 있다고 생각합니다.<page>나는 이미 다른 사람들을 위해 예약했지만, 나는 그들이 여기에 충분히 오래 머물지 않았기 때문에 다시 오지 않을 것이라는 것을 알고있다.

original_en_text: <hpage>Thank you sir. This is a worthy trade for my work. My tools shall attain an even sharper edge.
original_zh_text: <hpage>多谢先生。这东西对我很有帮助，我的工具将更加锋锐。
translated_text: <hpage>Thank you, this is a lot for my work. The tools have sharper ribs.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>감사합니다, 이것은 내 일에 대한 많은 것입니다.도구들은 갈비뼈가 더 날카롭다.

original_en_text: My sore shell will cease tormenting me once I reach the Citadel. It’s sung that all ails are healed just as soon as we step beyond the Grand Gate...
original_zh_text: 现在疼就疼点吧，等我到达圣堡，这一切都不是问题了。据说所有的痛苦都会在迈入巨扉圣门后烟消云散……
translated_text: When I came to the castle, the pain no longer bothered me, although it is said that when we pass through this door, all diseases will be cured.
secondary_translated_text: 내가 성에 도착했을 때, 고통은 더 이상 나를 괴롭히지 않았다, 비록 우리가이 문을 통과하면 모든 질병이 치유 될 것이라고 말했다.

original_en_text: Aye. A fair trade. The aged stuff’s down at the bottom of the cellar.<page>I’ll trust you to collect only the vessel you’re owed. I’d be grabbing it myself, but it’s become a hard climb for my stiffened shell.
original_zh_text: 好嘞，成交。陈酿在地窖最底层。<page>我这副甲壳现在僵硬了不少，不方便上上下下的。劳烦您自个儿去取。我相信您是不会多拿的，对吧？
translated_text: It 's an honest deal, the old ones are in the bottom of the basement.<page>We hope you get the boat you deserve. I took it myself, but it 's more difficult because of my hard shell.
secondary_translated_text: 그건 정직한 거래야, 낡은 것들은 지하실 밑에 있다.<page>우리는 당신이 마땅히 받아야 할 배를 얻기를 바랍니다.내가 직접 가져갔는데, 내 껍질이 딱딱해서 더 어려웠다.

original_en_text: S’only those few stronger pilgrims that survive to reach my home now... Pharloom’s curse claims the rest. Poor sods, left to wander.<page>I do sometimes get to wondering... Is it the dregs of their own mind in there keepin’em walking, or something else entirely...?
original_zh_text: 如今能来到我这儿的，大多是足够强大的朝圣者……剩下的都被纺络的诅咒害成游魂了。<page>我有时候会想……是他们自己残存的意识在支撑行走呢，还是别的什么鬼东西在作祟……？
translated_text: Only a few mighty pilgrims survived and came to my house. The curse of the judgment took the rest. The poor man was left behind.<page>Is this shit of their thinking making them walk, or is it something else entirely?
secondary_translated_text: 오직 몇 명의 강력한 순례자들만이 살아남아 내 집에 왔다.심판의 저주가 나머지는 가져갔다.불쌍한 사람은 뒤에 남겨졌다.<page>이 똥이 그들을 걷게 만드는 생각입니까, 아니면 완전히 다른 것입니까?

original_en_text: Bellhart, over the moors, a great town I’ve heard it once was, heart of the path’n all, right smack in the middle of these midlands.<page>Now it’s all a’crumble... And that brittle vein of bells is crawling with nasties. Ain’t no place left in Pharloom that can fairly claim to offer safety.
original_zh_text: 这片沼泽上方的钟心镇，当年可是个了不得的地方。位于整个中部地区的腹地，被称为朝圣之路的“心脏”。<page>如今全垮了……那儿的钟脉里爬满脏东西。纺络早没安全地界啦。
translated_text: I have heard that Berhardt in the desert was once a wonderful city. The street center was in the middle of these centers.<page>The fragile veins of the clock, where everything has now collapsed, are covered with worms.There is no place in Pharaoh where I can claim that I am safe.
secondary_translated_text: 사막에 있는 베르하르트는 한때 멋진 도시였다고 들었다.그 중심가들은 그 중심가들 가운데에 있었다.<page>모든 것이 무너진 시계의 연약한 혈관들은 벌레로 뒤덮여 있다. 파라오 안에 내가 안전하다고 주장할 수 있는 곳은 없다.

original_en_text: You visited them pens up above here, miss? Horrid place, once all about growing meat or some such. Meant to keep us moorbugs livin’, and working, its told...<page>That damned place’s long gone to the Haunting. And now the meat’s running feral and free.
original_zh_text: 小姐，去过上头那个养殖场没？可怕的地方。早先是搞正经蟑螂肉养殖的——为了喂饱我们这些沼泽虫，好让我们认真工作……<page>那鬼地方早被丝咒侵占了。现在，养的蟑螂全都跑出来撒野。
translated_text: Did you see the closure above? The most terrible thing is meat.We, the worms of the wetlands, have learned that we can live and work.<page>This hell has disappeared in the place of ghosts. The flesh is free and wild.
secondary_translated_text: 위쪽에서 닫는 것을 보셨나요?가장 무서운 것은 고기입니다. 우리는 습지의 벌레가 살고 일할 수 있다는 것을 배웠습니다.<page>이 지옥은 유령의 장소에서 사라졌습니다.살은 자유롭고 야생적입니다.

original_en_text: Welcome back, traveller. How’d you get along with collecting the Ragpelt from those mangy crawbugs? Their squawking and crooing up there is starting to wear mightily on my patrons!
original_zh_text: 旅行者，你回来啦？破毛皮收集得怎么样？屋顶上叽叽喳喳吵个没完，我的老顾客们都要跑光了！
translated_text: Welcome home, fellow traveller! What does it mean to collect gravel from a dirty crab? Their cries and sighs began to have a strong impact on our customers!
secondary_translated_text: 집으로 오신 것을 환영합니다, 동료 여행자!더러운 게에서 자갈을 모으는 것은 무엇을 의미합니까?그들의 울음과 한숨은 우리의 고객들에게 강한 영향을 미치기 시작했다!

translated_text: To buy wine?

original_en_text: Hmm, holding on to them, eh? I won’t ask why, but I’d sure appreciate it if you reconsider.
original_zh_text: 嗯……不打算交给我？虽然不知道原因，但求您发发善心，再考虑考虑。
translated_text: I don't know why, but I hope you 'll think again.
secondary_translated_text: 왜 그런지 모르겠지만, 다시 생각해 보길 바래.

original_en_text: Planning to grab that Vintage Nectar? You passed a fair bundle of rosaries for the bottle, so I figured you’ll be eager to see it yours.<page>The old stuff’s down there, at the bottom of the cellar. I’ll keep the trap open for you, just be swift.
original_zh_text: 准备去取陈年蜜露了吗？您可为它付了不少念珠，我想您肯定也急着将它收入囊中。<page>陈酿在地窖的底层，地窖门给您开着，麻烦您手脚麻利点。
translated_text: Are you taking this honey? I think I like to look at the bottles because I 've dressed up on Mount Rosary, and I 'm going to buy bottles.<page>The old man was in the basement. I will open a trap for you and act quickly. "
secondary_translated_text: 너는 이 꿀을 가져갈거야?로자리 산에서 옷을 입었기 때문에 병을 보는 것이 좋다고 생각하고 병을 사려고 한다.<page>그 노인은 지하실에 있었다.내가 너를 위해 함정을 열고 빨리 행동할 것이다. "

original_en_text: Harh! Well met, traveller. Lookin’ for a drink, or a rest, or both?<hpage>Fair greetings, good bug. The warmth of your hearth is welcome upon these wet plains.<page>Aye. It’s a damp climb through these parts. Used to be just pilgrims trekkin’ my way, but odd times these are, and you ain’t even the strangest shell wandering about.<page>A rowdy old warrior stopped through not long back, caused quite a scene, and now a young lass’s taken up lodging in my top room.<page>The lass mentioned she’s on the lookout for sharp types like yourself. Maybe pay her a visit, if you haven’t already?
original_zh_text: 哈！贵客临门。想来盏蜜露，还是歇个脚，或者两样都要？<hpage>这地方真是不错。这湿漉漉的平原上，最缺你这里暖烘烘的炉火。<page>是啊，这地界爬上来可不容易。早先只有朝圣者路过，如今世道古怪，连您这副稀罕甲壳都到处晃悠。<page>前阵子有个老战士在我这儿闹腾得欢，这几天顶层客房又住进个小姑娘。<page>那姑娘正想找您这样的利落角色，有空不妨上楼瞧瞧？
translated_text: Ooo! Good morning, fellow traveler. Drink, drink or both.<hpage>You are a good beetle. In these wet plains, the warmth of the fireplace is welcome.<page>Yes, it 's a wet climb in these areas. Once you were just a pilgrim on my way, but now, oddly enough, you 're not the strangest shell.<page>Some time ago a noisy veteran stopped to make a noise, and now a little girl is sleeping in my room upstairs.<page>She said she is looking for someone as sensitive as her.If you haven't seen him yet, can you visit him?
secondary_translated_text: 오오!안녕하세요, 여행자 여러분.마시기, 마시기, 또는 둘 다.<hpage>너는 좋은 벌레야.이 습한 평야에서는 벽난로의 따뜻함이 환영합니다.<page>네, 이 지역에서는 젖은 등반입니다.한때는 내 길을 가는 순례자였지만, 이상하게도 지금은 가장 이상한 껍질이 아니다.<page>얼마 전에 시끄러운 참전 용사가 멈추고 시끄러움을 일으켰고, 지금은 어린 소녀가 위층 내 방에서 자고 있습니다.<page>그녀는 자신처럼 민감한 사람을 찾고 있다고 말했다. 아직 만나지 못하셨다면, 그를 방문해 볼 수 있을까요?

original_en_text: Excellent, excellent! Let’s give those mangy craws the fright of their lives! Hah!<page>All I need is some Ragpelt from the crawbugs themselves. Hunt ‘em down, collect their pelts, and bring me back a heap of the stuff. I’ll do the rest!
original_zh_text: 好极了！让那群臭腐囊虫见识见识，什么叫吓破胆！哈！<page>我需要腐囊虫身上的破毛皮作为材料。劳烦您宰些腐囊虫，取一些它们的破毛皮来。剩下的交给我！
translated_text: Bravo! Bravo! Bravo! Bravo! Bravo! Bravo! We give a terrible life to those who suffer from scabies! Ooooo!<page>I need my own lobster. Find them, collect skins and bring me lots of things. "I 'll do the rest!
secondary_translated_text: Bravo! Bravo! Bravo! Bravo! Bravo! Bravo! "우리는 악성으로 고통받는 사람들에게 끔찍한 삶을 준다! "오오오!<page>나만의 랍스터가 필요해.그들을 찾아서, 스킨을 수집하고, 나에게 많은 것을 가져 오십시오. "나도 나머지는 다 할게!

original_en_text: The sooner you’ve collected that Ragpelt, the better. I can’t have those pests killing more potential guests.<page>Business is slow enough already, and clearing corpses ain’t no fun at all.
original_zh_text: 赶紧把破毛皮弄来吧，越快越好。不能再让它们杀害我的潜在客户们了。<page>本来生意就不算好，收拾虫尸还费劲！
translated_text: The sooner the garbage is collected, the better.These pests do not kill potential hosts, but they can not.<page>It 's very slow, and it 's not fun to remove the bodies.
secondary_translated_text: 쓰레기가 빨리 수집 될수록 더 좋습니다. 이 해충은 잠재적 인 숙주를 죽이지 않지만 할 수 없습니다.<page>너무 느리고 시체를 제거하는 것은 재미없다.

original_en_text: Wantin’ for a drink, traveller? Might soon be the end for all’o us, so no need to go easy on the nectar.
original_zh_text: 旅行者，要来喝一盏吗？反正大伙都快完蛋了，今朝有蜜今朝醉噢。
translated_text: How about a drink, friends? There is no need to relax too much in the honey, because the end for all of us could come soon.
secondary_translated_text: 술 한잔 어때, 친구들?우리 모두의 끝이 곧 올 수 있기 때문에 꿀에 너무 많이 휴식을 취할 필요가 없습니다.

original_en_text: <hpage>Barkeep, I have seen your request on the bell town’s wishwall. What assistance are you seeking?<page>Ah! Perfect! You’re the able sort that’ll make short work of the task.<page>The problem is those blasted craws atop here. My roof is fast becoming their cosy nest! Now they’ve grown so bold they’re starting to attack pilgrims as they pass.<hpage>Would you simply have me slay them? Your sturdy shell seems more than up to that task.<page>If only it were so simple. Kill the ones above and more just keep coming. It’s the warmth of this home you see. Draws ‘em right in.<page>I’m looking for a long-term solution. A scarecraw! I’ll build the biggest there’s ever been, so fearsome it’ll keep those craws away for good!<page>All I need is some Ragpelt from the crawbugs themselves. Hunt ‘em down, collect their pelts, and bring me back a heap of the stuff. I’ll do the rest!
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，我看见钟心镇祈愿墙上有你的委托。所为何事？<page>啊！太好了！可算找着行家了！<page>您看到房顶上那群腐囊虫了吗？它们快把我这儿当成自己的窝了！最近胆子越来越肥，已经开始攻击过路的朝圣者了。<hpage>你是想直接把它们杀光？看你这身强健的甲壳，办这事应该不费劲吧？<page>要这么简单就好了。杀完一茬又来一茬，全怪我这酒馆太暖和，招虫子。<page>得想个一劳永逸的办法——扎个巨型稻草人！保准吓得它们再不敢靠近！<page>我需要腐囊虫身上的破毛皮作为材料。劳烦您宰些腐囊虫，取一些它们的破毛皮来。剩下的交给我！
translated_text: <hpage>Bartender, I saw your order on Beltown's wishes wall.What help are you looking for?<page>¡Oh, yeah! Oh, yes! Ideally! You are the type of person who does things quickly.<page>The problem is that there are crabs. Soon my roof will be your shelter. They have become brave and began to attack passing pilgrims.<hpage>Will you let me kill you? Its sturdy shell seems to be working fine.<page>I wish it was that simple. If you kill one from above, there will be many more. Look at the warmth of this house! Direct attraction.<page>I am looking for a long term solution. Shake it. I 'll do the best I 've ever done, It 's so horrible that I 'll stay away from the crab forever!<page>I need my own lobster. Find them, collect skins and bring me lots of things. "I 'll do the rest!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>바텐더, 벨타운의 소원 벽에서 주문하신 것을 봤어요. 어떤 도움을 요청하시나요?<page>오, 그래!오, 네!이상적으로!당신은 일을 빨리 하는 타입입니다.<page>문제는 게들이 있다는 것이다.곧 내 지붕이 너의 피난처가 될 거야.그들은 용감해졌고 지나가는 순례자들을 공격하기 시작했다.<hpage>내가 널 죽일 수 있게 해줄래?그것의 튼튼한 껍질은 잘 작동하는 것 같다.<page>나는 그것이 그렇게 간단했으면 좋겠다.위에서 한 명을 죽이면 더 많은 사람들이 있을 것이다.이 집의 따뜻함을 보세요!직접적인 매력을 얻다.<page>장기적인 해결책을 찾고 있습니다.흔들어봐. 내가 지금까지 해왔던 최선을 다해. 너무 끔찍해서 영원히 게로부터 멀어질 거야!<page>나만의 랍스터가 필요해.그들을 찾아서, 스킨을 수집하고, 나에게 많은 것을 가져 오십시오. "나도 나머지는 다 할게!

translated_text: Inability to equip tools

original_en_text: Spear-phial containing Plasmium.<br><br>Injecting the liquid allows one to gain health beyond their natural limits.
original_zh_text: 装载生质液的注射瓶。<br><br>注入液体可突破自然极限恢复生命。
translated_text: A plastic bottle.<br><br>Injectable liquids bring health beyond nature.
secondary_translated_text: 플라스틱 병.<br><br>주사 가능한 액체는 자연을 넘어 건강을 가져옵니다.

original_en_text: Brace of surgical pins from the Whiteward. Used to forcefully insert Silk deep inside a bug’s shell. <br><br>Increases the speed of binding.
original_zh_text: 白愈厅的外科针组，用于将灵丝强制注入甲壳深层。<br><br>加快缚丝速度。
translated_text: A white needle holder is used to force the insertion of the silk deep into the insect 's shell.<br><br>Increased connection speed.
secondary_translated_text: 흰색 바늘 홀더를 사용하여 실크를 곤충의 껍질에 깊이 삽입합니다.<br><br>연결 속도 향상.

original_en_text: Transform Tools while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 在长椅休息时转换工具。
translated_text: Replace tools when they are on the table.
secondary_translated_text: 도구가 테이블 위에 있을 때 교체합니다.

original_en_text: Hooked tool for the forceful retrieval of loot from bugs and husks.<br><br>Harpoon into foes to steal rosaries and shell shards, while causing additional damage.
original_zh_text: 从虫尸强行夺取战利品的钩具。<br><br>刺入敌人窃取念珠与甲壳碎片并造成额外伤害。
translated_text: They are used to forcibly extract prey from insects and shells.<br><br>Copel pierces enemies, flying out roses and shrapnel and inflicting additional damage.
secondary_translated_text: 그들은 곤충과 껍질에서 먹이를 강제로 추출하는 데 사용됩니다.<br><br>코펠은 적을 뚫고 장미와 파편을 날려 추가 피해를 입힙니다.

original_en_text: Vicious bracelet worn by those who believe they have not been duly punished.<br><br>Increases damage taken, but also increases damage dealt by the needle.
original_zh_text: 自认刑罚不足者佩戴的刑器。<br><br>增加承受伤害，同时提升织针伤害。
translated_text: And those who think they will not be punished put themselves on the bracelet of evil.<br><br>This not only increased the damage, but also increased the damage caused by the needle.
secondary_translated_text: "그들 스스로가 형벌을 받지 않을 것이라고 생각하는 자들은 악의 팔찌에 자신을 넣는다. "<br><br>이로 인해 피해가 증가했을 뿐만 아니라 바늘에 의한 피해도 증가했습니다.

translated_text: Machinery equipment
Mirror of Nails
They expand
Canon of Roses

original_en_text: Stalk prey and attack with lethal strikes.
translated_text: They hunted their prey and committed deadly attacks.
secondary_translated_text: 그들은 먹이를 사냥하고 치명적인 공격을 저질렀다.

translated_text: The Screw

original_en_text: Equip Tools while resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 在长椅休息时装备工具。
translated_text: When you are on the bench, prepare yourself with tools.
secondary_translated_text: 벤치에 앉을 때, 도구로 자신을 준비하십시오.

translated_text: The Wanderers
Signs in icons
and transform them.

original_en_text: Flexible belt of serrated metal teeth, able to affixed to the hem of a cloak.<br><br>Flaring the cloak will spin the blades, damaging surrounding enemies.
original_zh_text: 可固定于披风边缘的锯齿金属带。<br><br>挥动披风会旋转利刃伤害周围敌人。
translated_text: A flexible strap made of sawed metal teeth can be attached to the edge of the jacket.<br><br>Opening the mantle allows you to rotate the blade, dealing damage to nearby enemies.
secondary_translated_text: 재킷의 가장자리에 톱니로 만든 유연한 스트랩을 부착할 수 있습니다.<br><br>망토를 열면 칼날을 회전시켜 근처의 적에게 피해를 입힐 수 있습니다.

original_en_text: Short pins designed to be scattered along the ground.<br><br>The sharp points will pierce any enemy who steps upon them.
original_zh_text: 设计用于撒布地面的短钉。<br><br>尖锐钉头会刺伤踩踏的敌人。
translated_text: A short needle designed to travel on the ground.<br><br>A sharp point will pierce the enemy who tramples on it.
secondary_translated_text: 지상에서 이동하도록 설계된 짧은 바늘.<br><br>날카로운 점이 그것을 밟는 적을 뚫을 것이다.

translated_text: Machine for Multi Staple

original_en_text: Twin theatrical tools of a vainglorious bug.<br><br>When binding, emits a searing blast that damages surrounding enemies.
original_zh_text: 虚荣虫的双生戏剧道具。<br><br>当缚丝时释放灼热冲击伤害周围敌人
translated_text: Vanity is a double dramatic instrument of evil.<br><br>When attacking, it produces a burst of fire that deals damage to the surrounding enemies.
secondary_translated_text: 허영심은 악의 이중적인 극적인 도구이다.<br><br>공격할 때 주변 적에게 피해를 주는 불꽃을 일으킨다.

translated_text: Look at the Peak.
Choose Christie.

original_en_text: Stalk prey and attack with lethal strikes. Build focus with successive strikes.
original_zh_text: 潜行猎杀，致命打击。连续攻击可积蓄专注。
translated_text: They hunted down their prey and carried out deadly attacks. Priorities for continuing strikes
secondary_translated_text: 그들은 먹이를 사냥하고 치명적인 공격을 수행했다.계속되는 파업에 대한 우선순위

translated_text: Shell is sharp.
Eggs from a flea.
The vessel of tension and
Strengthening Influence.
Until the clutch.

original_en_text: Spiral weapon fashioned from a hardened conchspire.<br><br>Thrown at an angle, it can ricochet and catch prey off guard.
original_zh_text: 硬化螺角打造的螺旋武器。<br><br>倾斜投掷可回弹突袭目标。
translated_text: The spiral gun is made from a hardened end of the shell.<br><br>Throwing at a certain angle allows them to jump and catch prey that is not yet ready.
secondary_translated_text: 나선형 총은 껍질의 단단한 끝으로 만들어졌다.<br><br>특정 각도에서 던지는 것은 그들이 점프하고 아직 준비되지 않은 먹이를 잡을 수있게합니다.

translated_text: Filamine voltage

original_en_text: Playthings carved from magnetic material.<br><br>Used in simple games and believed to bring luck to the bearer.
original_zh_text: 磁性材料雕刻的赌具。<br><br>用于简单游戏，据说能为持有者带来好运。
translated_text: The toys are made of magnetic materials.<br><br>It is believed that in simple games it brings luck to its owner.
secondary_translated_text: 장난감은 자성 재료로 만들어졌다.<br><br>간단한 게임에서 그것은 소유자에게 행운을 가져다주는 것으로 믿어지고 있습니다.

translated_text: Overloading.

original_en_text: Weighted pin and haft, formed to pierce tough shells.
original_zh_text: 加重的穿刺长针，用于穿透坚硬甲壳。
translated_text: Use a heavy needle and a handle to tear through the hard shell.
secondary_translated_text: 무거운 바늘과 손잡이를 사용하여 단단한 껍질을 찢습니다.

translated_text: They are using.

original_en_text: Light throwing tool, designed for rapid attacks.
original_zh_text: 轻型投掷武器，适合快速连击。
translated_text: A lightweight launcher tool specializing in fast attacks.
secondary_translated_text: 빠른 공격을 전문으로하는 가벼운 launcher 도구.

original_en_text: Empty spear-phial for injecting Plasmium.<br><br>Acquire more Plasmium to restore the tool.
original_zh_text: 空的生质液注射瓶。<br><br>需获取更多生质液补充。

original_en_text: Shattered flask which once contained an invigorating beverage.<br><br>Acquire more Flea Brew to restore the tool.

translated_text: Cylindrical shaft

original_en_text: Spin the needle as a screw, shredding foes. Spend Silk to rapidly craft new tools.

translated_text: They turn the needle like a screw to crush the enemy. Flor Silk is rapidly creating new tools.
secondary_translated_text: 그들은 나사처럼 바늘을 돌려 적을 분쇄한다. Flor Silk 는 새로운 도구를 빠르게 만들고 있습니다.

translated_text: The crystals of memory.

original_en_text: Flat, layered weapon, crafted to be thrown in a set.

secondary_translated_text: 잘 설계된 다층 평총은 한 세트에 배치될 수 있다.

translated_text: Skylight - The Sky (blue)

original_en_text: The Citadel is calling us, sister! We stand so close. We need only the blessing of those bells to see the Grand Gate open.<hpage>I will awaken the bells, pilgrim. With luck, you will not be waiting long.
original_zh_text: 圣堡在召唤，姊妹！我们只有一步之遥了。只需群钟赐福，巨扉圣门定将开启。<hpage>我会敲响那些巨钟。幸运的话，你们无需久候。
translated_text: Sister, the castle is calling for you! We were so close together. To open the door, you need the blessing of the bell.<hpage>"Pilgrim, I want to awaken the bell. If you are lucky, you will not have to wait too long.
secondary_translated_text: 언니, 성이 널 부르고 있어!우리는 너무 가까이 있었다.문을 열려면 종의 축복이 필요합니다.<hpage>"여보, 나는 종을 깨우고 싶다.운이 좋다면, 오래 기다릴 필요가 없습니다.

original_en_text: Only the holy bells of the great path shall open the way!<page>We beg you, traveller, see the bells awoken, that we may cross this final threshold.
original_zh_text: 只有朝圣途中的圣钟可开启此门！<page>恳求您，旅行者。令众钟苏醒，我们方可越过这最终的门槛。
translated_text: Only the holy bells of the streets can open the way.<page>Ring the bell, traveler, so that we may cross this last threshold. "
secondary_translated_text: 오직 거리의 거룩한 종소만이 길을 열어줄 수 있다.<page>여행자여, 종을 울리세요, 그러면 우리가 이 마지막 문턱을 넘을 수 있습니다. "

original_en_text: Ahhh... the gate! The bells have awoken! All along the path. Now we need only music to see them attuned! <hpage>I have recently learnt the art of producing song by strumming Silk, though I confess it is a skill deserving of more practice.<page>Oh! Ohh! Have no doubt, sister! Play sincerely. Any music is sweet enough! Play for us, and surely the bells will resound! Play, and we will sing!
original_zh_text: 啊……巨门！圣钟皆已苏醒！眼下我们只需奏响音乐，使其共鸣！<hpage>我最近习得以灵丝拨弦成曲的技艺，但仍有些生疏。<page>噢！无需顾虑，姊妹！至诚则灵，凡乐皆美！为我们奏响音乐，圣钟必将回应！演奏吧，我们将为你歌唱！
translated_text: ¡Oh, yeah! The door! The bell ring! In the process, now you can see your adjustments in the music!<hpage>I recently learned how to touch silk and compose, but I think it 's a skill that deserves more practice.<page>Oh! Oh! Oh! Oh! Yes, I did, but the music is so sweet! Play with us and the bells will ring! Let's play and sing!
secondary_translated_text: 오, 그래!문이!벨이 울린다!그 과정에서, 이제 당신은 음악에서 당신의 조정을 볼 수 있습니다!<hpage>나는 최근에 실크를 만지고 작곡하는 법을 배웠지만, 더 연습해야 할 기술이라고 생각한다.<page>오! 오!오! 오!오! 오!오! 오!그래, 그래, 하지만 음악이 너무 달콤해!우리와 함께 놀고 종들이 울릴 것이다!우리 놀고 노래하자!

original_en_text: Ahhh... the Grand Gate! The bells have awoken! <page>We beg you, sister. Play or sing, and we shall follow. Call out to the bells of the path and see the gate open!
original_zh_text: 啊……巨扉圣门！圣钟皆已苏醒！<page>恳求您，姊妹。奏乐咏唱，我们定将跟随你。呼唤圣途钟声，开启此门！
translated_text: ¡Oh, yeah! The door! The bell ring!<page>- Please, sister. Play, drink, and go on. I rang the doorbell outside and saw the door open.
secondary_translated_text: 오, 그래!문이!벨 벨이 울린다!<page>- 제발 언니.놀고 마시며 계속 가다. 밖에서 초인종을 울렸는데 문이 열리는 것을 보았다.

original_en_text: We beg you, sister. Delay no further! Play for us. Call out to the bells of the path and see the Grand Gate open!
original_zh_text: 恳求您，姊妹。勿再拖延！为我们奏乐，呼唤圣途钟声，开启巨扉圣门！
translated_text: - Please, sister, don't be late! Call us at the door and see how the door opens. "
secondary_translated_text: - 누나, 제발 늦지 마!문에 우리를 불러서 문이 어떻게 열리는지 보세요. "

original_en_text: The gate... the gate! O, the Grand Gate to the Citadel stands before us!<page>We are so close! O mighty ones beyond the gate, we beg you! Open the way and let we poor, insignificant little pilgrims crawl into the light...<hpage>I see no gatekeepers to heed your plea, pilgrim, though I too seek entry to the Citadel. Have you heard of a means to open this gateway?<page>Ahh... Weapons blunt it not. No holes for keys. ‘Tis the bells, they say! The holy bells upon the path that open the way!
original_zh_text: 巨门啊……巨门！通往圣堡的巨扉圣门近在眼前！<page>咫尺之遥！门后的尊者啊，求您垂怜！开启通路，容我等卑微朝圣者遁入圣光……<hpage>看来没有守门者回应答你的祈愿。我也想进入圣堡，你可知道开门的办法？<page>唉……兵刃伤不了分毫，也不见锁孔。只有朝圣途中的圣钟可开启此门！
translated_text: The door, the door, is in front of us.<page>This is so close! Open the way of light, poor pilgrims! "<hpage>I also wanted to enter the castle, but I could not see the guard who obeyed the requests of the pilgrims.<page>¡Oh, yeah! You don't have to worry about guns. There's no keyhole. "The bell rings! "Holy Bell on its way, opening the way for you!
secondary_translated_text: 문, 문이 우리 앞에 있습니다.<page>이건 너무 가까이!빛의 길을 열어라, 불쌍한 순례자들아! "<hpage>나도 성에 들어가고 싶었지만 순례자들의 요청에 순종하는 경비원을 볼 수 없었습니다.<page>오, 그래!당신은 총에 대해 걱정할 필요가 없습니다.자물쇠 구멍이 없어요. "벨이 울린다! "성령의 벨이 길을 열고 당신을 위해 길을 열어줍니다!

original_en_text: <hpage>I have passed several such bells, pilgrim. I know how to see them woken. Tell me what you know of their locations, and I shall seek those that still remain silent.<page>Sister? This is a mighty service you willingly perform! What a marvellous gift you would grant to your fellows. <page>Eagerly, I shall tell you of the shrines and their locations, as we have heard them spoken...
original_zh_text: <hpage>朝圣者，我途中遇到过多座此类巨钟，也知晓唤醒方法。请告知余下的位置，我这就去寻找未鸣之钟。<page>姊妹？这是何等伟大的侍奉！您对同伴的馈赠真是慷慨！<page>我会悉数告知神殿方位，将我们听闻的消息原封不动地告诉你……
translated_text: <hpage>"Pilgrim, I have already crossed some of these bells. I see you waking up. Tell us what you know about your position. "I am looking for those who are silent.<page>his sisters? This is a great service that you can offer as a volunteer.What a wonderful gift you give your partner!<page>As we have heard, I am going to give a detailed account of the temple and its location.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>"여보, 저는 이미 이 종들 중 일부를 통과했습니다.나는 네가 깨어나는 것을 보았다.당신이 당신의 위치에 대해 알고있는 것을 우리에게 말하십시오. "나는 침묵하는 자들을 찾고 있다.<page>그의 여동생들?이것은 당신이 자원 봉사자로 제공 할 수있는 훌륭한 서비스입니다. 당신이 당신의 파트너에게주는 멋진 선물입니다!<page>우리가 들은 바와 같이, 나는 성전과 그 위치에 대해 상세히 설명할 것이다.

original_en_text: The gate... the gate! O, the Grand Gate to the Citadel stands before us!<page>We are so close! O mighty ones beyond the gate, we beg you! Open the way and let we poor, insignificant little pilgrims crawl into the light...<hpage>I see no gatekeepers to heed your plea, pilgrim, though I too would benefit from its opening. Have you heard of a means to pass through?<page>Ahh... Weapons blunt it not. No holes for keys. ‘Tis the bells, they say! The holy bells upon the path that open the way!
original_zh_text: 巨门啊……巨门！圣堡巨扉圣门近在眼前！<page>门后的尊者啊，求您垂怜！开启通路，容我等卑微朝圣者遁入圣光……<hpage>看来没有守门者回应你的祈愿。但开启这道门对我也有好处，你可知道开门的办法？<page>唉……兵刃伤不了分毫，也不见锁孔。只有朝圣途中的圣钟可开启此门！
translated_text: The door, the door, is in front of us.<page>This is so close! Open the way of light, poor pilgrims! "<hpage>Pilgrim, I have not seen the guard listen to your request, but I will also take advantage of your openness.<page>¡Oh, yeah! You don't have to worry about guns. There's no keyhole. "The bell rings! "The Holy Bell is on its way, opening the way for you!
secondary_translated_text: 문, 문이 우리 앞에 있습니다.<page>이건 너무 가까이!빛의 길을 열어라, 불쌍한 순례자들아! "<hpage>순례자, 나는 경비원이 당신의 요청에 귀를 기울이는 것을 보지 못했지만, 나는 또한 당신의 개방성을 활용할 것입니다.<page>오, 그래!당신은 총에 대해 걱정할 필요가 없습니다.자물쇠 구멍이 없어요. "벨이 울린다! "성령의 종은 길을 열고 있다!

original_en_text: <hpage>On my journey up, I passed many large bells housed in old shrines. Each I have struck awake, yet still this gate stays closed. What other task must be done to see us pass beyond?<page>The bells are rung? Then this sacred threshold may now be crossed, for the final task is simple! Only music, played fair and true. Music shall attune the bells, and see the gate descend.<page>It must be you to lead us, sister! You, who brought this blessing! Play or sing, and we shall follow.
original_zh_text: <hpage>上行途中，我已敲响诸多钟殿内的巨钟，但此门仍然紧闭。还需要怎样的仪式吗？<page>巨钟皆已鸣响？那这神圣门槛便可跨越！最终仪式简单，唯有真诚演奏的音乐，方能使钟声共鸣，引导大门降下。<page>必须由你来引领我们，姊妹！是你带来了这份恩典。演奏或歌唱吧，我们定将跟随你。
translated_text: <hpage>When we climbed the mountain, there were many sounds of ancient temple bells. I wake up, but the door is locked. What problems need to be solved to overcome them?<page>Are these bells? The ultimate task is so simple that this sacred threshold has already been crossed! The music is played honestly and fairly. I saw the sound of the concert bell and the door fell.<page>Sister, you lead us. You are the one who brings this blessing! Play, drink, and keep going.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>우리가 산에 올라갈 때, 고대 사원 종소리가 많이 들렸다.나는 깨어났지만 문이 잠겨 있었다.이러한 문제를 극복하기 위해 어떤 문제를 해결해야 합니까?<page>이게 종이야?궁극적 인 임무는 너무 간단하여 이미이 신성한 문턱을 넘었습니다!음악은 공정하고 정직하게 연주된다.콘서트 종소리를 보고 문이 무너졌다.<page>언니, 우리를 인도해 주시오.이 축복을 주는 사람은 바로 당신입니다!놀고, 마시고, 계속 가세요.

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, I have communed with the shrine above. Your learnings are unique, techniques born of cogwork hearts. Their mastery will require some commitment on my part.<page>Bug-Red, you are the first organic shell to fuse our memories. S-s-s-such behaviour, my line would have believed improbable-impossible. <page>Still, your broad arsenal did suggest strong affinity with the m-m-m-mechanical craft, enough to allow access to our thought-store.<hpage>Yours is an impressive skill, Master. I am grateful for the insight.
original_zh_text: <hpage>大师，我已拜访上方圣像。你们的知识独特，源自机枢之心。需要我专注投入才能掌握。<page>红姑娘是首个融合我等记忆的血肉之躯。这种行为，按我族逻辑本应不-不-不可行。<page>不过您精通各式武具，确实与机械造诣契-契-合，因此决定开放思维秘藏。<hpage>你们的技艺令我叹服。对这份知识，我感激不尽。
translated_text: <hpage>Teacher, I have already accepted the sanctuary above. His teaching is unique and is a technique derived from cognitive thinking. And its domination requires my commitment.<page>Baghdad, you are the first organic shell that integrates our memory. My people believe that such an act is impossible. "<page>Nevertheless, their rich arsenal demonstrates sufficient proximity for mechanics to fit into our ideological arsenal.<hpage>Teacher, your abilities are really impressive. Thank you for your intuition.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>스승님, 저는 이미 위의 성소를 받아들였습니다.그의 가르침은 독특하며 인지적 사고에서 파생 된 기술입니다.그리고 그것의 지배는 나의 헌신이 필요하다.<page>바그다드, 당신은 우리의 기억을 통합하는 최초의 유기적 껍질입니다.우리 국민들은 그런 행동이 불가능하다고 믿는다. "<page>그럼에도 불구하고, 그들의 풍부한 무기고는 기계학이 우리의 이데올로기 무기고에 맞게 충분한 근접성을 보여줍니다.<hpage>선생님, 당신의 능력은 정말 인상적인데요.당신의 직감에 감사해요.

translated_text: I've already said... Confession.

original_en_text: A fine artefact you carry there, Bug-Red. That broken tool, it is Weaver-make? <hpage>I believe so, Master. A relic of their old workshop, lost in fetid caves beyond this Citadel.<hpage>The parts suggest a weapon of thread, one I would attempt to repair myself, had I endless time.<page>An Architect’s work owes much to the art of the f-f-first children. They set expert standard for the tools and talents of Pharloom eternal.<page>If you desire-demand, I can remake the tool, though my own mind-directives may produce u-u-u-nique result.
original_zh_text: 红姑娘，你身上有件特殊遗物。这残器，是织者造物？<hpage>应该是。织者的旧工坊遗物，在圣堡外的腐臭洞窟里发现的。<hpage>看这构造应该是丝刃兵器。若不是时间有限，我倒想尝试修复。<page>建筑师技艺大多继承自初代织者子嗣。他们为永恒圣堡的器-器-具设下典范。<page>如果您有要求，我可以将它重铸，但成品恐怕会带有我的独-独-独特烙印。
translated_text: A beautiful relic you brought there, the red worm. Is it a bad tool made of fabric?<hpage>These are the remains of his former laboratory, which vanished in the smell of the caves outside the castle.<hpage>These pieces are like wire pens and I would like to fix them myself if I had time.<page>Much of the architect 's work is related to the art of his first children. They set the standard of expertise for the tools and talents that have survived the times of Farlum.<page>You can also recreate the tool if you want, but my mental teams produce unique results.
secondary_translated_text: 네가 가져온 아름다운 유물, 붉은 벌레.천으로 만든 나쁜 도구인가요?<hpage>이것은 성 밖의 동굴의 냄새 속에서 사라진 그의 이전 실험실의 잔재입니다.<hpage>이 조각들은 와이어 펜과 같아서 시간이 있다면 직접 고치고 싶다.<page>건축가의 작품의 대부분은 그의 첫 자녀의 예술과 관련이 있습니다.그들은 Farlum 의 시대를 살아남은 도구와 재능에 대한 전문 지식의 표준을 설정했습니다.<page>원하는 경우 도구를 다시 만들 수도 있지만, 내 정신 팀은 독특한 결과를 만듭니다.

original_en_text: An intricate implement of Pharloom’s first children. I can restore-repair the w-w-weapon, though it will bear some trace of my identity-idiom.
original_zh_text: 初代子嗣的精巧造物。我可修-修-复此武具，但会留下我的工造印记。
translated_text: I can repair this weapon, but there are traces of my identity.
secondary_translated_text: 이 무기는 수리할 수 있지만 내 정체성의 흔적이 있다.

original_en_text: Bug-Red. Do you ask-need our service? We shall create, as is our d-d-directive. To serve, for Pharloom eternal.
original_zh_text: 红姑娘。需要服-服-服务？我将创造，如指-指-指令所示。为永恒圣堡。
translated_text: This is a bug network service. Do you need it? He believes in the same thing as the D-D directive. To the Pharaoh - immortal.
secondary_translated_text: 이것은 버그 네트워크 서비스입니다. This is a bug network service.필요해요?그는 D - D 지침과 같은 것을 믿는다.파라오에게 불멸의

original_en_text: Speak now. Thy confession will be heard.
original_zh_text: 说吧。你的忏悔将被聆听。
translated_text: Speak now, and your petition will be heard.
secondary_translated_text: 지금 말하라, 그러면 너의 청원이 들릴 것이다.

original_en_text: Hrrr. Hrrrrrrr. Them sounds you make. Of holy sort. When me hear such sounds, me remember of home. Me remember of be little.<page>It make it painful hard to work, such remembers. Me must keep working. Please, friend. Do not make them sounds no more.
original_zh_text: 唔。唔唔唔唔。你弄的响动。像圣歌。让咱想起老家。想起小时候。<page>这些回忆让干活揪心。咱得继续干。朋友，求你别弄这些声了。<page>求你了……别再……
translated_text: Um, uh... The sound you create is sacred.When I hear that sound, I remember my home.I remember my youth.<page>This has made the work painful. I have to keep working. Go ahead, my friend. Please don't make a noise.
secondary_translated_text: 음, 음...당신이 만든 소리는 신성합니다. 그 소리를 들을 때, 나는 나의 집을 기억합니다. 나는 나의 젊음을 기억합니다.<page>이것은 일을 고통스럽게 만들었다.나는 계속 일을 해야 한다.빨리 가, 친구야.제발 소음을 내지 말아주세요.

original_en_text: My s-s-service to you, Bug-Red... As it concludes, I must speak-confess. Long now I have felt my rotors slow their s-s-spin. My limbs lift weak. An ending is felt, coming, sudden-certain...welcome.<hpage>Whatever fading you feel has not shown in your craft, Master. You have provided tools of immaculate make.<hpage>What will follow if you pass? Would another take your place? <page>One cannot. The skill to construct an Architect... That was taken by t-t-time. I am the last-final. The core remains to sustain the song, but no more Architects to tend-toil or build anew. <page>S-s-strange... ‘For Pharloom eternal,’ states the d-d-directive-cage. But how can eternity sustain without an Architect to serve? This seems e-e-error. An end? An error... welcome?
original_zh_text: 为红姑娘效-效-力的时光……临别前必须坦-坦-白。我的齿轮渐-渐缓，臂膀无力。终结将至，突然但确-确-定……真好。<hpage>即便如此，大师的技艺也并未退步。您造的器具堪称完美。<hpage>您逝去后会怎么样，有后继者接任？<page>没有。锻造建筑师的技艺……早已失-失-失传。我是最后一位。核心尚能使圣歌存续，但再无工匠维缮新建。<page>荒-荒-谬……”为永恒圣堡”的指-指-令仍在。但无工匠何谈永恒？错-错-误？终局？错谬……真好？
translated_text: I am here for you, Red Book.Finally, I confess this.For a long time I felt that the speed of rotation of the propeller is decreasing.He can not raise his arms and legs.When the end sits and approaches, review it suddenly and carefully.<hpage>Master, no matter how discolored you feel, it doesn't reflect your abilities.<hpage>What will happen if that happens? Will someone replace it?<page>The heart is still in the maintenance of the songs, but we no longer need an architect to maintain or restore it.<page>Interestingly, "For the immortality of the pharaoh", - says in a bilateral cage.But, "How do you survive without the services of an architect? That seems to be wrong.Akab? This is a mistake.Welcome?
secondary_translated_text: 나는 당신을 위해 여기에있다, 붉은 책. 마지막으로, 나는 이것을 고백한다. 오랫동안 나는 프로펠러의 회전 속도가 감소하고 있다고 느꼈다. 그는 팔과 다리를 올릴 수 없다. 끝이 앉고 접근 할 때, 갑자기 신중하게 검토한다.<hpage>스승님, 아무리 변색하더라도, 그건 당신의 능력을 반영하지 않습니다.<hpage>만약 그런 일이 일어나면 어떻게 될 것인가?누가 그것을 대체 할 것인가?<page>심장은 여전히 노래의 유지 보수에 있지만, 우리는 더 이상 그것을 유지하거나 복원하기 위해 건축가가 필요하지 않습니다.<page>흥미롭게도, "파라오의 불멸을 위해 ", - 양자 케이지에서 말한다. 하지만, "건축가의 서비스없이 어떻게 살아남을 수 있습니까?잘못된 것 같군요. 아카이브?실수입니다. 환영합니다.

original_en_text: Hrr. Hrrrrr. Who is there? Me can not... can not clear see....<hpage>At ease, large one. I am no danger to you.<page>Hrrrrr? Hrrrr! Me see you now! So clean, so lively... Surely you did come from above! Me time has come at last! Me work is done. You come to bring me up! Up, up! Hrrr!<hpage>You mistake me. I am no resident of the Citadel. I am a stranger here, though no foe to you.<page>Hrrr. Hrrrrrrrrr. S-stranger? Me grave mistaken. Forgive me, thems above, for me unworthy hope! Of course, me work is not done! Harder, harder! Me must work harder!
original_zh_text: 唔。唔唔唔。谁？咱看不清……看不清……<hpage>别慌，大块头。我不是你的敌人。<page>唔唔？唔唔！看清你了！这么干净鲜活……肯定是从上层来的！咱终于等到！咱完工了！你是来接咱上去的！上去！唔唔！<hpage>你误会了，我不是圣堡居民，只是旅者。但也不是你的敌人。<page>唔。唔唔唔唔。旅……旅者？咱大错特错。宽恕咱吧，上边的大人们！咱痴心妄想！咱当然还没完工！加把劲！咱得加把劲！
translated_text: Ha? Who's there? I'm not... I don't see him.<hpage>- Don't worry, Grandpa. I'm not a danger to you.<page>What's it? What is it? Ooo! I just saw this! Very clean and active. You should come up. "At last our time has come! My job is over, you 're here to help me grow! Stand Up! Stand Up! Ooooo!<hpage>They misunderstood me and not the people of the castle. I am not your enemy, but I am a stranger here.<page>O, O, O I made a serious mistake. Sorry, it gives me hope that this is useless! Of course, my job is not finished! Go ahead, go ahead, go ahead! I have to work more!
secondary_translated_text: 네?누구야?난...나는 그를 보지 않는다.<hpage>- 걱정마, 할아버지.나는 당신에게 위험하지 않습니다.<page>뭐예요?뭐야?오오!방금 이걸 봤어!매우 깨끗하고 활동적입니다.너는 올라와야 한다. "마침내 우리의 때가 왔다!내 직업은 끝났어, 너는 나를 성장시키기 위해 여기 있어!일어나!일어나!오오오!<hpage>그들은 성의 사람들이 아니라 나를 오해했다.나는 너의 적이 아니지만, 나는 여기 낯선 사람이다.<page>오오오죄송합니다, 이것은 쓸모없는 것으로 기대합니다!물론, 내 일은 끝나지 않았다!어서, 어서, 어서!나는 더 일해야 한다!

original_en_text: Bug-Red. Do you ask-need our services, even n-now? Our duty is l-l-long, but we shall create for you, if you require it...
original_zh_text: 红姑娘。此刻仍需要服-服-服务？职责已尽，但如果您需要，仍可制-制造……
translated_text: This is a bug network service. Do you need it right now? Our responsibilities are long, but we create when we need them.
secondary_translated_text: 이것은 버그 네트워크 서비스입니다. This is a bug network service.지금 당장 필요해요?우리의 책임은 길지만, 우리는 그것을 필요로 할 때 창조합니다.

original_en_text: If Bug-Red could prove their aptitude with our implements, and others like, I would offer my key, to grant access to the chapel-store above.
original_zh_text: 如果红姑娘能证-证-明精通我等器械，我将献上钥匙，用以开启上方圣堂库房。
translated_text: If Bug-Krasu manages to demonstrate his skills with our instruments, as well as with others, I will give him my keys and give him access to the church shop above.
secondary_translated_text: 만약 Bug - Krasu 가 다른 사람들과 마찬가지로 우리의 악기로 그의 기술을 보여줄 수 있다면, 나는 그에게 나의 열쇠를주고 위의 교회 가게에 접근 할 수 있도록 할 것입니다.

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, I seek a melody held by your line, one part of a sequence and key to ascending above the Citadel. Can you teach it to me?<page>Our melody? I r-r-recall! Yes! There was melody, once, but its sound... that I possess no longer...<page>T-t-t-too long I have worked. From my mind-vault, the imprint has f-f-faded. With many things it is like this... remembrance, dimmed...<page>But you m-m-may hear it, still. At the height of our core, there is means-s-s-system, near complete... Constructs old-built to sound our song. They need only be set to functional form.
original_zh_text: <hpage>大师，我想要你这一族保管的旋律，那是登顶圣堡的钥匙。你可愿意传授？<page>我们的旋律？确-确-曾存在！但是声纹……已遗失……<page>长-长-久劳役使我记忆缺损。许多往事……都已模糊……<page>但您仍可-可-可以聆听。核心顶端有一奏鸣构造，几近完成……启动即可重现圣歌。
translated_text: <hpage>Master, I am looking for the melody that your line carries, which is part of the sequence and the key to the ascent into the castle.<page>The melody? Remember! Ah, yes! Ah, yes! There was a melody, but there was a sound. I don't have it anymore.<page>The work is too long.Deep in my heart, this sign disappears.There are so many things like this memory, darkness.<page>But you can feel that on top of our core there is an almost complete media system. We built an old house to sing our songs. You just need to install it functionally.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>마스터, 저는 당신의 선이 전달하는 멜로디를 찾고 있습니다. 그것은 시퀀스의 일부이며 성으로 상승하는 열쇠입니다.<page>멜로디는?기억해!아, 네!아, 네!멜로디는 있었지만 소리는 있었다.나는 더 이상 그것을 가지고 있지 않다.<page>작품이 너무 길고 내 마음속 깊은 곳에서 이 표지판이 사라져버렸어 이 추억과 같은 것들이 너무 많고 어둠이<page>하지만 여러분들은 우리의 핵심 위에 거의 완전한 미디어 시스템이 있다는 것을 느낄 수 있습니다.우리는 노래를 부르기 위해 오래된 집을 지었다.당신은 단지 그것을 기능적으로 설치해야합니다.

original_en_text: Are you still to c-c-climb our grand core, Bug-Red? Within you may marvel at the work of Architects, my own, and all those passed b-b-before.<hpage>My path takes me in many directions, Master, but in due course, I will ascend the core and claim the melody atop it.
original_zh_text: 您仍要攀-攀-登伟大核心？路上可见历代建筑师的神工创造，包括我的拙作。<hpage>我有许多地方要去，但若是需要，我会登顶获取旋律。
translated_text: Are you still climbing to the big core, Baghdad? Inside, you can be amazed by the work of architects, my architects and all the architects who have gone through the past.<hpage>Teacher, my path leads me in many directions, but at the right time I reach the core and take up the melody above the core.
secondary_translated_text: 아직도 큰 핵심으로 올라가고 있는 거야, 바그다드?내부에서, 당신은 건축가, 나의 건축가 및 과거를 통과 한 모든 건축가들의 작품에 놀라게 될 수 있습니다.<hpage>선생님, 저의 길은 저를 여러 방향으로 인도하지만, 적절한 때에 저는 핵심에 도달하고 그 위에 있는 멜로디를 취합니다.

original_en_text: <hpage>May I ask what you know of the Citadel above you, sir? You go to much effort to reach it.<page>Hrrrrrrrr! The Citadel! Most miracle of a place, bright and holy! Fresh water for all, much as can drink! Air so clean, can see the great rooves above! <page>When me thinks of Citadel above, me works hardest of all! Hrrrrrrrrr!
original_zh_text: <hpage>请问你对头顶的圣堡了解多少？为了上去这么煞费苦心。<page>唔唔唔唔！圣堡！神迹之地！亮堂圣洁！清水管够！空气清新能望见穹顶！<page>想着圣堡，咱就干得最卖力！唔唔唔唔！
translated_text: <hpage>Do you know how much you know about the castle? He has put a lot of effort into achieving this.<page>Ha ha ha! The castle! The most sacred place is bright and holy! Drink as much fresh water as you can. The air is cold, and you can see the roof.<page>Looking at the castle from above, I am working hard! Oh, yes! Oh, yes!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>당신은 성에 대해 얼마나 알고 있는지 아십니까?그는 이것을 이루기 위해 많은 노력을 기울였다.<page>하하!성이!가장 거룩한 곳은 밝고 거룩한 곳이다!가능한 한 많은 신선한 물을 마셔라.날씨가 추워서 지붕이 보인다.<page>위쪽에서 성을 바라보고, 열심히 일하고 있어요!오, 네!오, 네!

original_en_text: You have confessed a sin most grave and must by works cleanse yourself.<page>Return to your task and work off-cycle, neither eating nor supping until new-cycle begins.<page>By the grace of Pharloom eternal, may you never tire. Toil, and be forgiven.
original_zh_text: 你已供认重罪，须以苦役净化。<page>返回岗位持续劳作，禁食禁饮直至新周期始。<page>承永恒纺络之恩，愿你永不疲惫。劳作，方得救赎。
translated_text: You must confess your worst sins and cleanse them by your actions.<page>Do not return to your non-cyclical tasks and work, and eat or eat until a new cycle begins.<page>We thank God for His eternal mercy and we will not tire.
secondary_translated_text: 당신은 당신의 최악의 죄를 고백하고 당신의 행동으로 그것들을 깨끗하게 해야 한다.<page>비주기적인 작업과 작업으로 돌아가지 말고, 새로운 주기가 시작될 때까지 먹거나 먹지 마십시오.<page>우리는 영원한 자비에 대해 하나님께 감사하며 피곤하지 않을 것입니다.

original_en_text: Hrr. Hrrrrr! Good, me friend, good! When us works together, is more holy! Is more work done!<page>Together, lets us work raw hard ‘til thems above see how worthy us is!
original_zh_text: 唔。唔唔唔！好，朋友，好！咱一起干，更虔诚！活干得更快！<page>来！咱们一起拼命干，让上边看看咱多卖力！
translated_text: Oh, oh, oh! When we work together, we become more holy. I still have work to do!<page>We work together until people at the top understand what we value!
secondary_translated_text: 오 오, 오, 오!우리가 함께 일할 때, 우리는 더 거룩해집니다.나는 아직도 할 일이 있다!<page>우리는 최고층의 사람들이 우리가 가치있는 것을 이해할 때까지 함께 일합니다!

original_en_text: <page>What’s this, Bug-Red? Even down here, I d-d-did detect its working... Have you climbed our c-c-core, and woken the voices of my l-l-line?<hpage>I have maker. Clearly it was a climb never intended for regular bugs, and fair fortune that the skills gifted within your lands allowed my ascent.<hpage>The melody, and the voices... both are fine things heard and witnessed. Even in this fading moment, their artistry shines through.<page>Impressive-industrious... eternal... You have seen a glimpse, Bug-Red, of us-s-s, how once we were. The minds of Architects inspired. What majesty we did create...
original_zh_text: <page>怎么回事，红姑娘？即便身处此地，我也感-感-感知到它的运转……莫非你已攀上我们的核-核-核心，唤醒了我族先辈的歌声？  <hpage>正是如此，大师。这段攀登本非寻常虫类所能企及，所幸这片土地赋予的技艺助我登上了顶端。  <hpage>那旋律与歌声……皆是值得聆听见证的瑰宝。即便在此衰微之际，其中匠心仍熠熠生辉。  <page>勤勉卓绝……永垂不朽……红姑娘，你已见证我族-族-族昔日的荣光。建筑师们迸发的智慧，我们曾创造的伟业何等壮丽……
translated_text: <page>What is the red letter? You entered our C-C - Core and awakened my voice from the L-L - Line?<hpage>Fortunately, his terrain-specific skills allow me to climb.<hpage>The melody, the sound. They both look and beautiful. Even at this moment his art shines.<page>Impressive hard work. Forever and forever. You have seen us, the red worm, what we are. Inspiration architects the greatness that we create.
secondary_translated_text: <page>빨간 글자는 무엇입니까?당신은 우리의 C - C - 코어에 들어가서 L - L - Line 에서 내 목소리를 깨웠습니까?<hpage>다행히도, 그의 지형 특수한 기술은 내가 등반할 수 있게 해준다.<hpage>멜로디, 소리.둘 다 아름답고 아름답게 보입니다.이 순간에도 그의 예술이 빛납니다.<page>인상적인 노력.영원히, 영원히.당신은 우리, 붉은 벌레, 우리가 무엇인지 보았습니다.영감은 우리가 창조하는 위대함을 건축한다.

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, you seem the lone maker left in this ruined Citadel. Are you my enemy? The other constructs of this place did object aggressively to my presence. <page>Bug-Red? I am a m-m-maker. Yes. Enemy. No. I am an Architect. Only an Architect. To build-automate, it is our nature-directive-c-c-c-cage.<page>Why are you here, Bug-Red? The time is late. Do you seek-need service of an Architect? You are weave-type, yes, a first child. Rare-e-e-extinct? Or not it does so seem.<hpage>You see it true, Master. I bear the lineage of Weaver, along with other strands, equally strange.<page>Then on your r-r-request, Bug-Red, as directive demands, for Pharloom’s first children, a-a-a-and our kingdom-eternal, I shall c-c-craft.
original_zh_text: <hpage>阁下，你似乎是圣堡最后的工匠，但是要与我为敌么？这里的构造体对我很有敌意。<page>红衣虫？我是制-制-造者。敌人。不是。建筑师。只是建筑师。建造-自动化，并非选择。是本性-指-指-指令牢笼。<page>您为何在此，是寻-寻求建筑师协助？您有织者血脉，是，初代子嗣。稀-稀-稀有种？但又似乎不是。<hpage>你眼光很独到，我确实有织者血脉，但只有一半。<page>那依红姑娘要-要-要求，遵循指令，为纺络初代子嗣，为永恒圣堡，我将效劳。为您制-制-造。
translated_text: <hpage>Master, it seems that you are the sole creator of this ruined castle. Are you my enemy? The other buildings in this place strongly oppose my presence.<page>The red tiles? I am an architect, I am an architect. In the case of automation, this is a natural sequence - c-c - c.<page>What do you do here? Is it too late to ask for help from the Red Mistakes Architect? You are the boy in the shirt, yes, the first child. Rare and extinct. Or it seems so.<hpage>"Master, look at this! There was a woman 's blood in my body, and other blood, and something strange. "<page>Then, at your request, see me, Red, as you have been instructed, I will make C-C - C the first son of Farnham, our eternal kingdom.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>주인님, 이 황폐한 성의 유일한 창조자인 것 같습니다.당신은 나의 적입니까?이 곳의 다른 건물들은 나의 존재에 강력히 반대한다.<page>빨간 타일?저는 건축가입니다, 저는 건축가입니다.자동화의 경우, 이것은 자연적인 시퀀스 - c - c - c 입니다.<page>여기서 뭐 하는 거야?붉은 실수 건축가에게 도움을 요청하기에는 너무 늦었습니까?당신은 셔츠를 입은 소년입니다, 예, 첫 번째 아이입니다.희귀하고 멸종된 것.또는 그렇게 보인다.<hpage>"선생님, 이것 좀 봐요!내 몸에는 여자의 피와 다른 피와 이상한 무언가가 있었다. "<page>그러면, 당신의 요청에 따라, 레드, 당신이 지시받은 대로, 나는 C - C - C 를 우리의 영원한 왕국인 파넘의 장남으로 만들 것이다.

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, you seem the lone maker left in this Citadel. Are you my enemy? The other constructs of this place object aggressively to my presence. <page>Bug-Red? I am a m-m-maker. Yes. Enemy. No. I am an Architect. Only an Architect. To build-automate is not choice. It is our nature-directive-c-c-c-cage. <page>You are weave-type, yes, a first child. Rare-e-e-extinct? Or not it does so seem.<hpage>You see it true, Master. I bear the lineage of Weavers, along with other strands, equally strange.<page>Then on your r-r-request, Bug-Red, as directive demands, for Pharloom’s first children, a-a-a-and our kingdom-eternal, I shall serve. I shall c-c-craft.
original_zh_text: <hpage>阁下，你似乎是圣堡最后的工匠，但是要与我为敌么？这里的构造体对我很有敌意。<page>红衣虫？我是制-制-造者。敌人。不是。建筑师。只是建筑师。建造-自动化，并非选择。是本性-指-指-指令牢笼。<page>您有织者血脉，是，初代子嗣。稀-稀-稀有种？但又似乎不是。<hpage>你眼光很独到，我确实有织者血脉，但只有一半。<page>那依红姑娘要-要-要求，遵循指令，为纺络初代子嗣，为永恒圣堡，我将效劳。为您制-制-造。
translated_text: <hpage>"Teacher, it seems that you are the only creator of this castle." The other buildings in this place were strongly opposed to my presence. "<page>The red tiles? I am an architect, I am an architect, and automation is not an option. This is our natural order - c-c - c.<page>You are the boy in the shirt, yes, the first child. Rare and extinct. Or it seems so.<hpage>"Master, look at this. There was a woman 's blood in my body, and other blood and something strange. "<page>Therefore, Baghdad, at your request, I serve the firstborn of the Pharaoh, our eternal kingdom. I know that it is C-C - C, I cannot do it. I cannot do it. C - -
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>"선생님, 이 성의 유일한 창작자인 것 같습니다. "이곳의 다른 건물들은 내 존재에 강력히 반대했다. "<page>빨간 타일?저는 건축가이고, 건축가이고, 자동화는 선택사항이 아닙니다.이것은 우리의 자연적인 순서입니다 - c - c - c.<page>당신은 셔츠를 입은 소년입니다, 예, 첫 번째 아이입니다.희귀하고 멸종된 것.또는 그렇게 보인다.<hpage>"선생님, 이것 좀 봐요.내 몸에는 여자의 피와 다른 피와 이상한 것이 있었다. "<page>그러므로 바그다드여, 당신의 요청에 따라 저는 파라오의 맏아들, 우리의 영원한 왕국을 섬기겠습니다. C - C - C 라는 걸 알아, 못해. 못해. C - -

translated_text: Architects of 12 Generations

original_en_text: Hrrrrrrr. The harder me work, the sooner it come. Thems above, them watch us, always. Work hard, work hard, and us will go up. Hrrrr.<hpage>Sir, I fear you are long forgotten by your masters. Should you not rest? The burden this toil is placing on your shell is plain to see.<page>Hrrrrr? Hrrrrrr. You speaks strange. Me can not rest. Us works, and Citadel breathes, and thems above do sing, and all is right.<page>And when us works enough, thems see it... Hrrr... thems see it, and us gets us holy reward...
original_zh_text: 唔唔唔。越使劲干，就越早离开。上边的大人们看着咱呢。使劲干，使劲干，就能上去。唔唔。<hpage>先生，恐怕你早被主人遗忘了。为何不休息？这苦役正在摧残你的甲壳。<page>唔唔？唔唔唔。你说怪话。咱不能歇。咱干活，圣堡呼吸，上边唱歌，这才对劲。<page>等咱干够活，大人们会看见……唔唔……会看见，就给咱圣赐……
translated_text: The harder you work, the faster you work, the faster you get there.They focus on the above topics.Effort, effort, we stand up.Ahh-huh.<hpage>I forgot my teacher. Are you resting? The weight of his shell is obvious.<page>What's it? What is it? We were at work, the castle was breathing, the subjects upstairs were really singing, and everything was going well.<page>If you work hard enough, you will see.Hmm.If you see it, you will receive a divine reward.
secondary_translated_text: 열심히 일할수록 빨리 일하면 빨리 도착할 수 있습니다. 그들은 위의 주제에 초점을 맞추고 있습니다. 노력, 노력, 우리는 일어서고 있습니다.<hpage>나는 선생님을 잊었다.쉬는 거야?그의 껍질의 무게는 명백하다.<page>뭐예요?뭐야?우리는 일을 하고 있었고, 성은 숨을 쉬고 있었고, 위층의 피험자들은 정말로 노래를 부르고 있었고, 모든 것이 잘 진행되고있었습니다.<page>충분히 열심히 일하면 보게 될 것이다. 응. 보게 되면 신의 보상을 받을 것이다.

original_en_text: Tools of my craft. They could be used to improve your own. Make harder, sharper.
original_zh_text: 我的工具。可以用于改进您自己的。更硬，更利。
translated_text: I have my own art tools. It can be used for personal improvement. Make it stronger and stronger.
secondary_translated_text: 나는 내 자신의 예술 도구가있다.그것은 개인 개선을 위해 사용될 수 있습니다.더욱 강해지고 더욱 강해지게 하라.

original_en_text: A flexible shell-prosthetic. It would enhance a weave-type’s flexibility, allowing evasive options.
original_zh_text: 柔性甲壳义肢。能提升织者机动性，便于闪避。
translated_text: Flexible artificial body. Increases the flexibility of the type of fabric, allowing for evasion options.
secondary_translated_text: 유연한 인공 몸체.회피 옵션을 허용하는 직물 유형에 대한 유연성을 향상시킵니다.

original_en_text: You... ... sin... ... cleanse....<page>Return... ... work... ... begins....<page>... Pharloom... ... never... ... forgiven.
original_zh_text: 你……罪……净化....<page>返回……劳作……周期始....<page>...纺络……永不……救赎。
translated_text: You are a... You are a... No, e. Right,<page>I'm back... I am working... I am working... He starts.<page>... The Pharaoh has never... Forgive me, please.
secondary_translated_text: 당신은...넌...아니, e.맞아요,<page>내가 돌아왔어...나는 일하고 있다...나는 일하고있다...그가 시작했어요.<page>...파라오는 결코 ...용서해 주세요.

original_en_text: You have affinity for such radial blades? I can b-b-build upon the idea-knowledge. Make them retract. Make them force-store.
original_zh_text: 您偏爱这类机轮刃？我可基-基-据此改良。加回收装置。强化储能。
translated_text: Are you interested in radioactive material? I have based my knowledge on this idea.Please return this.Put them in a mandatory deposit.
secondary_translated_text: 방사성 물질에 관심이 있으세요?이 아이디어에 대한 나의 지식을 바탕으로 한 것이다. 이것을 돌려주십시오. 그것들을 의무 보증금에 넣으십시오.

original_en_text: Acquire {0} more tools to prove aptitude.
original_zh_text: 再收集{0}件工具以证明资质。
translated_text: Acquisition of this.{0}Tools for demonstrating competence.

original_en_text: Hrrrrrr. Me can not say much more, friend. Thems is watching. Us must keep working.
original_zh_text: 唔唔唔唔。咱不能多说了，朋友。上边看着呢。咱得接着干。
translated_text: Ladies and gentlemen, I cannot say more. This matter is under observation. You should continue to work.
secondary_translated_text: 신사 숙녀 여러분, 더 말할 수 없습니다.이 일은 관찰중이다.너는 계속 일해야 한다.

original_en_text: A locked gate bearing the symbol of an Architect.
original_zh_text: 一扇锁住的门，刻有建筑师徽记。
translated_text: A closed door with the architect 's signature.

original_en_text: Raw materials, for creation. Carry them with you always, that y-y-you may be prepared.
original_zh_text: 原材料，随身携带。有-有备无患。
translated_text: Creative raw materials - always take them with you to be ready.
secondary_translated_text: 창의적인 원료 - 항상 준비하기 위해 그들과 함께 가져 가십시오.

original_en_text: Acquire 1 more tool to prove aptitude.
original_zh_text: 再收集1件工具以证明资质。
translated_text: Buy another tool to demonstrate your skills.
secondary_translated_text: 당신의 기술을 보여주기 위해 다른 도구를 구입하십시오.

original_en_text: Those pieces of a h-h-heart-core you carry upon you, how did you acquire-recover an artefact so rare?<hpage>They were scattered about the Citadel, each seemingly laid with purpose. Someone wished the thing dismantled, but showed respect enough to see it stored safe.<page>That heart is an inspired form, conceived by the first of my line for a knight of cog and blade.<page>In it, I see my predecessor’s talent, immense, now lost-forgotten. I could never create-copy a work s-s-so fine.<hpage>And the knight that once bore the heart? Tell me of them.<page>A gleaming order, cogwork sentinels, so impressive-majestic in function they were charged-b-b-bound to the highest holy duty.<page>Long before the c-c-creation of the core, the sentinels ventured, even beyond these walls, to see all bugs brought-forced safe to serve the Citadel.<page>If the h-h-h-heart were restored within the sentinel’s shell, would it give thanks for the awakening? Or would it grieve those lands now l-l-lost?<hpage>In time, maker, I may find out...
original_zh_text: 您携带的心-心-脏残片，您是怎么找到如此珍贵造物的？<hpage>它们散落在圣堡各处，似乎是被刻意安置。虽然被拆解，却有妥善保管。<page>这心脏构造精妙，出自我的先辈之手，为机枢骑士所铸造。<page>我能在其中看到先辈才华，如今却已失-失-传。我无法复刻这份神工。<hpage>那曾经承载这颗心的骑士？我想了解详情。<page>光辉教团，机枢戍卫。他们曾经威仪赫赫，掌管圣职。<page>远在核心铸-铸-造之前，戍卫就远征墙外，强掳众虫效忠圣堡。<page>如果将此心-心-脏重新装入戍卫甲中，它会为苏醒而感激？还是为圣堡衰颓哀伤？<hpage>假以时日，大师，或许我能知晓……
translated_text: How do you recover the nuclear fragments you carry with you?<hpage>They were scattered around the castle, and it seemed that they were all lying.Someone wanted it, but showed enough respect to keep it safe.<page>"Heart " was the inspiration for my first series of ideas for Gear and Blade Knight.<page>There I saw the talent of my great, now forgotten predecessor. I can not reproduce such a beautiful picture.<hpage>"The gentleman who took care of you told me.<page>The brilliant knight, the guardian of the dog 's teeth, performed a very impressive and worthy function and was endowed with the highest sacred duty.<page>Long before the construction of the core, the guards were in danger, and even beyond these walls all the insects were forced to work safely for the castle.<page>When the heart returns to its guard shell, are you grateful for the awakening? Does this mean that the earth is lost?<hpage>In time, we will find our Creator.
secondary_translated_text: 당신이 가지고있는 핵 파편을 어떻게 복구합니까?<hpage>그들은 성 주위에 흩어져 있었고, 그들은 모두 거짓말을하고있는 것처럼 보였습니다. 누군가가 그것을 원했지만, 그것을 안전하게 유지하기 위해 충분한 존경심을 보여주었습니다.<page>"하트" 는 기어와 블레이드 나이트에 대한 나의 첫 번째 아이디어 시리즈에 영감을주었습니다.<page>거기서 나는 나의 위대한, 지금은 잊혀진 전임자의 재능을 보았다.나는 이렇게 아름다운 그림을 재현할 수 없다.<hpage>"당신을 돌보는 사람이 내게 말했다.<page>개 이빨의 수호자였던 영리한 기사는 매우 인상적이고 가치있는 기능을 수행했으며 가장 높은 신성한 의무를 부여받았습니다.<page>핵심이 건설되기 오래 전에 경비원은 위험에 처해 있었고, 심지어이 벽을 넘어서는 모든 곤충은 성을 위해 안전하게 일해야했습니다.<page>마음이 경호 껍질로 돌아 왔을 때, 깨어난 것에 대해 감사합니까?이것이 지구가 사라졌다는 뜻인가요?<hpage>시간이 지나면 우리는 우리의 창조주를 발견하게 될 것입니다.

original_en_text: This band of metal teeth, sharp and light-fine. It could be woven within your red outer layer? A hidden weapon.
original_zh_text: 金属齿环，轻便锐利。可编入您的红色披风？作为暗器。
translated_text: Metal bracelets are sharp and light. Does it come out of the red? The Shadow
secondary_translated_text: 금속 팔찌는 날카롭고 가볍습니다.그것은 빨간색에서 나오나요?그림자 The Shadow

original_en_text: <page=S>You seem displeased, Old One. We only did as you asked, yes? The snare is sprung, the creature consumed.<hpage>You bound it to that void!<page=S>Don’t play daft. You should well know our family’s fixations. Surely you had a hunch?<page=B>How else could we hope to trap one of your pale kin? Or see her consumed with such insatiable efficiency?<hpage>Then you have miscalculated, gravely. The white knight, she fell with the mother...<page=M>Oh ho... The quakes, yes? We have felt their force, even here. So the mother resists the dark... to save the child?<hpage>That is my guess. I must descend to the void below, and see clear that truth for myself.<page=M>Ohhhh. How… unfortunate. All of Pharloom will fall to her flailing.<hpage>So it may, but I will not watch idle while it crumbles.
original_zh_text: <page=S>古老者，您似乎不太高兴？我们不过照您吩咐行事罢了。陷阱已发，猎物入彀。<hpage>你们把它和虚空捆在了一起！<page=S>别装傻了。您该清楚我们家族对力量百无禁忌，难道没料到这步？<page=B>不然怎困得住您那苍白同族？又怎教她贪婪吞噬得这般彻底？<hpage>那你们可大错特错了，那苍白骑士也随其母亲一同坠落了……<page=M>哦嚯嚯……是说那些震颤？即便在这里也能感知到。所以是母亲正抵抗黑暗……为了救孩子？<hpage>我是这么猜想的。但必须亲自下去深渊，看清真相。<page=M>哎呀呀……这可……不妙。整个纺络都要被她垂死挣扎掀翻。<hpage>或许吧，但我不会坐视王国崩塌。
translated_text: <page=S>You look miserable, old man, you do what you're told, right? What? The traps come out and the creature is absorbed.<hpage>You put it in the emptiness!<page=S>We need to learn more about how our families work. Do you really have an intuition?<page=B>How can we connect with our brilliant parents? Or will we be consumed with such greedy efficiency?<hpage>You have made a serious mistake in your calculations.The knight in white has fallen with his mother.<page=M>It was an earthquake, right? Really? I feel this power too. Thus, mothers resist the darkness to save their children.<hpage>That's my hypothesis. I must go to heaven and see the truth.<page=M>Oh, what? Why not? The whole Pharaoh was in his hands.<hpage>This may be true, but I 'm not going to stay out of it.
secondary_translated_text: <page=S>넌 비참해 보이니, 늙은이, 넌 명령대로 해, 그렇지?뭐야?덫이 나오고 생물이 흡수됩니다.<hpage>너는 그것을 공허함에 넣었다!<page=S>우리는 우리 가족이 어떻게 일하는지에 대해 더 많이 배울 필요가 있습니다.당신은 정말로 직감이 있습니까?<page=B>우리는 어떻게 우리의 훌륭한 부모와 연결할 수 있습니까?아니면 우리는 그토록 탐욕스러운 효율성으로 소비될 것인가?<hpage>너는 계산에 심각한 실수를 저질렀다. 하얀 옷을 입은 기사는 그의 어머니와 함께 쓰러졌다.<page=M>지진이었지, 그렇죠?진짜?저도 그 힘을 느낀다.그러므로 어머니들은 자기 자녀들을 구하기 위해 어둠에 저항한다.<hpage>그건 내 가설이다.나는 천국에 가서 진실을 보게 될 것이다.<page=M>오, 뭐야?왜 안 돼요?파라오의 모든 것이 그의 손 안에 있었다.<hpage>이것은 사실일지도 모르지만, 나는 그것에서 벗어나지 않을 것이다.

original_en_text: This lump here is well heavy, and shiny too, so it’s surely worth somethin’!
original_zh_text: 这块沉甸甸的，还闪着光，肯定值点钱儿！
translated_text: Here, this part is heavy and bright, so it 's really worth it!
secondary_translated_text: 여기, 이 부분은 무겁고 밝은, 그래서 그것은 정말 가치가있다!

original_en_text: Desperate times make for desperate customers, heh heh! So let’s get to tradin’, eh?
original_zh_text: 世道混乱，方便宰客！嘿嘿！赶紧的！
translated_text: A desperate moment makes a desperate client.Do you want to start a deal?
secondary_translated_text: 절박한 순간은 절박한 고객을 만든다. 거래를 시작하고 싶니?

original_en_text: Again... Huu... Huu. Truly incredible!<page>Was it the course? Did I lose focus? Or are you simply the bug I have waited so long for? Her of such skill that my wish could, at last, be granted?<page>Another reward must be given for your speed, nimble bug. One deserved in full!
original_zh_text: 又输了……呼……真不可思议！<page>是我分心了？还是你太强？我的心愿终于有机会实现了吗？<page>我得再送你个奖励，你应得的！
translated_text: Once again... Appeals. Calling.It's incredible!<page>Is it a race? Have you lost your concentration? Could this be the BAP we 've been waiting for? Your skills are very high, right? Will my wish finally be fulfilled? "<page>You should offer an extra reward for mistakes of speed and agility, the man deserves it!
secondary_translated_text: 다시 한번...항소하다. Calling. It 's incredible!<page>경주인가요?집중력을 잃었나요?이것이 우리가 기다리고있는 BAP 일 수 있습니까?당신의 실력은 매우 높죠?나의 소원이 마침내 이루어질 수 있을까? "<page>당신은 속도와 민첩성의 실수에 대한 추가 보상을 제공해야합니다, 남자는 그것을받을 자격이 있습니다!

original_en_text: Have you heard, miss grown-up? Beyond the moss, in the crumbled caverns filled with worms, much change is happening, different to the horrid, stretching dark outside.<page>What brings such bright and bold transformation? Is it a beast? Or a bug unseen? How wondrous it would be to discover them, hidden away in some deep corner!<page>You must go searching, miss grown-up! You and that sharp, sharp blade. Think of the strange and succulent shell waiting to be added to your journal?
original_zh_text: 大姐姐听说了吗？苔原深处满是蠕虫的崩塌洞窟里，正在发生剧变，与外界的恐怖黑灾截然不同。<page> 是什么带来这种鲜明蜕变？是巨兽？还是未知虫类？要是能知道它们是什么，藏在哪里，该多奇妙呀！<page> 你一定要去探索，大姐姐！带上你那锋利的针刃，给记录册里多添上几份奇异的甲壳记录！
translated_text: Do you hear me, your majesty? Beyond the moss, in a ravaged and insect-infested cave, many changes are taking place, unlike the terrifying darkness that spreads.<page>What is the reason for such bold and bold change? Is it a monster? Is it an invisible mistake? How wonderful it would be if we could find it hidden in a deep corner!<page>"Your Majesty, look! You and your knife! Think of a strange, juicy shell that is waiting to be added to your diary.
secondary_translated_text: 제 말 들려요, 전하?이끼를 넘어, 황폐화되고 곤충이 감염된 동굴에서, 확산되는 무서운 어둠과는 달리 많은 변화가 일어나고 있습니다.<page>왜 이렇게 대담하고 대담한 변화가 있었을까?그건 괴물인가요?눈에 보이지 않는 실수인가?우리가 그것을 깊은 구석에 숨겨 놓을 수 있다면 얼마나 멋진 일입니까!<page>"전하, 보세요!너랑 네 칼!당신의 일기에 추가되기를 기다리고있는 이상하고 즙이 많은 껍질을 생각해보십시오.

original_en_text: Now, isn’t this a wondrous place! Golden bells, for weary shells! Ha ha ha!<hpage>This settlement offers safety now, little pilgrim. Perhaps you should make a home here?<hpage>You’ve done well to make it this far, and the roads ahead will only be more dangerous.<page>Oh, dangerous they surely are! But I will gladly tread any path that holds wonders as magnificent as this, red maiden!
original_zh_text: 这地方太妙了！金钟给累瘫的虫子报时！哈哈哈！<hpage>小朝圣者，此处暂时安全，为何不在此安家？<hpage>走到这里实属不易，前方只会更加凶险。<page>凶险又如何！能见到这般奇景，刀山火海我也愿前往！
translated_text: Isn't that a wonderful place? The bell rings in tired shells. Ha ha ha!<hpage>This reconciliation guarantees the safety of the young pilgrims. Is it necessary to install it here?<hpage>At this stage, the road ahead will only become more dangerous.<page>They are REALLY dangerous! - But I can go on the way to such a great miracle, Miss Red!
secondary_translated_text: 그곳은 정말 멋진 곳 아니죠?피곤한 껍질 속에서 종소리가 울린다.하하!<hpage>이 화해는 젊은 순례자들의 안전을 보장합니다.여기에 설치해야 하나요?<hpage>이 단계에서 앞으로의 길은 더욱 위험해질 뿐이다.<page>그들은 정말로 위험합니다! - 하지만 나는 그토록 위대한 기적을 향해 갈 수 있어, 레드 양!

original_en_text: <hpage>You have keen sight for my skill, bug, but my childhood has long since passed. What has happened here? I see signs of battle all around.
original_zh_text: <hpage>你的眼力不错，我确是一名战士，但早已称不上是孩子。这是怎么回事？到处是打斗痕迹。
translated_text: <hpage>You know my abilities, Bug, but my childhood is over. There were signs of struggle everywhere.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>넌 내 능력을 알잖아, 버그, 하지만 내 어린 시절은 끝났어.곳곳에 투쟁의 징후가 있었다.

translated_text: <hpage>...

original_en_text: <hpage>The time is close, Shakra. The cost was grave, and the challenge steep, but I have claimed a power that can put end to this disaster. <page>Gendaa... This is good, Hornet Wielding Needle, essential. My own strength has near reached its limit, and the dark husks continue their assault unceasing.<page>Take your final action, and let us all see the end of this.
original_zh_text: <hpage>时机到了。虽然代价惨重，但我找到了终结灾祸的方法。<page>哏嗒……太好了，小姑娘。我正好快撑不住了，黑虫的攻势永不停歇。<page>放手去干吧，让我们一起见证结局。
translated_text: <hpage>The time is approaching, Shakur. The cost is enormous, the problems are enormous, but I have the power to put an end to this disaster.<page>Up to now... Bumblebee balances the needle. Its power reaches its limit, and Darkshell continues to attack.<page>Let 's take the last step and see the end of it all.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>시간이 다가오고 있어, 샤쿠르.비용은 거대하고, 문제는 거대하지만, 나는 이 재앙을 막을 수 있는 힘을 가지고 있다.<page>지금까지는... Bumblebee 는 바늘의 균형을 유지합니다.그 힘은 한계에 도달했고, 다크쉘은 계속해서 공격을 가졌다.<page>마지막 단계를 밟아 이 모든 것의 끝을 보자.

original_en_text: Your achievements in the games are inspiring! In time, I may have to challenge those impressive scores...
original_zh_text: 你创下的记录真令我激动！改天我要挑战看看！
translated_text: Success in the game is encouraging. Over time, you 'll have to challenge this impressive result.
secondary_translated_text: 게임에서의 성공은 고무적입니다.시간이 지남에 따라, 당신은이 인상적인 결과에 도전해야합니다.

original_en_text: <hpage>Good luck on your quest Garmond. If you hope to claim justice for your fellows passed, I suspect you’ve some challenge yet ahead.<page>Aye! Zaza and I’ll fight to cavern’s end if it need be, for the bugs held in our hearts, and our honour as knights!
original_zh_text: <hpage>祝你们好运，要找圣堡讨公道可不容易。<page>为了心中的记忆，为了骑士的荣耀！就算要杀遍每处洞穴我们也在所不惜！
translated_text: <hpage>If you are seeking justice for your dead compatriots, I think you are still facing some problems.<page>Ah, yeah! Ah, yes! If necessary, Zaza and I will fight to the end of the cave, fighting for the heartworm and the honor of knighthood.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>죽은 동포들을 위해 정의를 추구한다면, 나는 당신이 여전히 몇 가지 문제에 직면하고 있다고 생각한다.<page>아, 그래!아, 네!필요하다면 자자와 나는 동굴 끝까지 싸우고 심장 벌레와 기사 자격의 명예를 위해 싸울 것입니다.

original_en_text: Ahh, can you feel it too? The thralls of the Citadel are gathered close, in overwhelming numbers!<page>Together though, the three of us would be more overwhelming still! Would you allow us to fight by your side, brave sister?
original_zh_text: 啊哈，感觉到了吗？圣堡的傀儡在集结，非常多！<page>咱们三个联手，肯定不可阻挡！要一起战斗吗，勇敢的姐妹？
translated_text: Do you feel it too? The castle slaves are gathering in masses!<page>When all three come together, it 's even more stunning! "Good sister, will you let me fight you? "
secondary_translated_text: 너도 느껴지니?성의 노예들이 군중으로 모인다!<page>세 사람이 함께 모이면 더욱 신기합니다! "좋은 언니, 내가 싸우게 해 줄래? " "

original_en_text: Well, well! See what happens to nasty bully-bugs when they come after poor old Grindle? That’s a well-deserved end, we reckon.<page>We heard this old Sitty-dell was nice and quiet and burstin’ with goodies. So what’s happened, eh? Why’s it crawlin’ with bullies and busybodies?<hpage>The creature that haunts this place is stirring, little thief. The Citadel’s caste now roam the halls. You would do well to leave soon, if you mean to survive.<page>What what? You bein’ mirthful? We’re stayin’ here ‘til we’re done pilfering! You should be the one leavin’ if you’re so afeared!
original_zh_text: 啧啧！瞧瞧那些欺负格林德尔恶霸虫是什么下场？真是活该！<page>都说圣堡既清净，宝贝又多，怎么全是打手？<hpage>掌控此地的怪物正在苏醒，圣堡的守卫四处游荡，想活命就快逃吧，小毛贼。<page>怕什么！起码得等偷够本再说！你要是害怕了，那就自己逃吧！
translated_text: What happens when this vision of evil reaches poor Grindell? I think it's an appropriate ending.<page>I heard that this old Citydale is beautiful, quiet and full of beautiful things. Why is this place so full of bandits and noisy people?<hpage>The creatures that torment this place are revived, thieves.Castle-castle now wanders the hallway.If you want to live, it is best to start as soon as possible.<page>What's it? Are you laughing? I 'll stay until the flight is over, if you 're afraid, come on!
secondary_translated_text: 이 악의 비전이 불쌍한 그린델에게 도달했을 때 무슨 일이 일어날까요?나는 그것이 적절한 결말이라고 생각한다.<page>나는 이 오래된 시티데일이 아름답고 조용하며 아름다운 물건들로 가득 차 있다고 들었다.이 곳은 왜 이렇게 강도와 시끄러운 사람들로 가득 차 있습니까?<hpage>이 장소를 괴롭히는 생물은 부활, 도둑. 성 성은 지금 복도를 방황. 당신이 살고 싶다면, 그것은 가능한 한 빨리 시작하는 것이 좋습니다.<page>뭐예요?웃는 거야?나는 비행기가 끝날 때까지 머물거야, 만약 네가 두려워한다면, 빨리!

original_en_text: High up, above the caverns all of crust, Nuu has been told of a hole, filled with writhing things, all zipping and zapping.<page>But so sad! Nuu cannot herself see it. The lands quake and rattle. The savage threads stretch. The dangers are too much.<page>It must be you, miss grown-up, older, stiffer, a shell less precious. Seek the cave, and the things within. How else will the journal be complete?
original_zh_text: 努努听说，在布满硬壳的洞窟高处，有个满是扭动生物的洞穴，噼啪作响。<page> 但好可惜！努努不能去看。大地震动，凶暴丝线蔓延，太危险了。<page> 必须靠你了，大姐姐，你甲壳厚实，经验丰富。去探查那个洞穴吧！不然记录册怎么完整呢？
translated_text: There, Noah was informed that in each cave there was a hole in the crust, full of twisted things.<page>But that's sad! No one could see Noah. The earth trembles and trembles, the traces of barbarism continue. The danger is far too great.<page>You are a newspaper, ladies and gentlemen.You are old, you work hard, and your cover is useless.Open for yourself the caves and what they contain.How did it end?
secondary_translated_text: 그곳에서 노아는 각 동굴에 지각에 구멍이 있었고, 뒤틀어진 물건들로 가득 차 있었다는 소식을 들었습니다.<page>하지만 그건 슬프다!아무도 노아를 볼 수 없었다.땅은 떨고 떨며, 야만주의 흔적은 계속된다.위험은 너무 커요.<page>신사 숙녀 여러분, 여러분은 신문입니다. 여러분은 늙고, 열심히 일하고, 표지는 쓸모없습니다. 동굴과 그 안에 들어있는 것을 스스로에게 열어보십시오. 어떻게 끝났습니까?

original_en_text: Ahh miss grown-up, Nuu hoped you would return here. For clever Nuu can track well where you have been, she sees your cut-marks and sniffs out your fragrant trail!<page>And look where the trail has led sweet Nuu! A thick wriggler lived in this nest, rumbling and crackling in the darkness.<page>Its sour juices still line these rocky insides, and patient Nuu will gather it all up!<hpage>There is much to learn in these crusted highlands Nuu, but much danger as well. Indulge your curiosity if you must, but keep your senses trained on the darkness.
original_zh_text: 大姐姐！努努跟着你的刀痕和体香找到这啦！<page>这个巢穴住着条乱扭的胖家伙，在黑暗里咔咔响！<page>岩壁上还粘着它的酸液，努努要全部收集！<hpage>这里虽然知识多，但也很危险，别只顾着好奇，也要小心黑暗中的动静。
translated_text: "Lord, please come back here. SmartNuu can track where you are.Look at the knife and smell it.<page>That 's where you got your beautiful nude. Inside the nest lived a giant crocodile, which snorted in the dark.<page>The stones are still full of bitter taste, and patient Nui is picking them up!<hpage>In the hardcore environment of Nu, there is a lot to learn, but there are also many dangers. Fill your curiosity as needed and train your senses in the dark.
secondary_translated_text: "주님, 여기로 돌아오세요.
