original_en_text: Avoiding their ambush is a good test of my senses, and my ability to rapidly retaliate.
original_zh_text: 规避其伏击是对感知力的考验，快速反击能力同样关键。
translated_text: Avoiding an ambush was a good test of my feelings and my ability to fight fast.
secondary_translated_text: 매복을 피하는 것은 내 감정과 빠른 전투 능력을 시험하는 좋은 시험이었습니다.

original_en_text: To quell the mother’s rage, and see this kingdom saved, I will claim her back. This one... the dark shall not take.
original_zh_text: 为了平息苍白之母的暴怒、拯救这个王国，我必夺回这个孩子的本心——绝不容许虚空将她吞噬。
translated_text: To appease my mother 's anger and save the kingdom, I have returned her.
secondary_translated_text: 나는 어머니의 분노를 달래고 왕국을 살리기 위해 어머니를 돌려주었다.

translated_text: Frigate Flights
The Lost Race

original_en_text: Cogwork knight of Pharloom, once protector of its pilgrims, and master of the scissor blade.
original_zh_text: 曾护卫朝圣者的机械骑士，如今双刃剪成为致命凶器。
translated_text: The armed Knights of the Fall were guardians of pilgrims and spice shops.
secondary_translated_text: 무장한 가을 기사들은 순례자와 향신료 가게의 수호자였다.

original_en_text: <page>No. Not their enemy, and their prisoner not through malice. I am Eva, a thing... difficult to describe, a child of Weavers, yet not quite their kin...<hpage>How strange. That description could fit me as well as yourself. <page>Child of Weavers?... And not? I can detect your Weaver strain, yet you are different from them, and from me, a shifting, blended thing? What are you creature?<page>Step closer, lady, that my senses would better understand your nature.
original_zh_text: <page>不是，也并非因为罪行囚禁。我叫伊娃，是……有点复杂，是织者后裔但又不完全是……<hpage>真奇妙。这番描述同样适用于我。<page>你也是织者后裔？……但又不是？我能感知你的织者血统，但你既不同于他们，也不同于我，一个流动的混合体？你究竟是什么？<page>请靠近些，女士，方便我感知你的本质。
translated_text: <page>Neither his enemies nor his prisoners - difficult to explain - are Weaver 's children, but not his parents at all.<hpage>That 's weird. This explanation is perfect for you.<page>Children of Textiles. Invc? I can find your Vega options, but... Are you different from them, are you different from me, are you constantly evolving and mixing? What creatures are you?<page>Come closer, and my feelings will understand it better. "
secondary_translated_text: <page>그의 적도 그의 죄수도 - 설명하기 어렵지만 - 위버의 자녀는 아니지만 그의 부모는 전혀 아닙니다.<hpage>정말 이상하군요.이 설명은 당신에게 완벽합니다.<page>Textiles 의 아이들Invc?베가 옵션은 찾을 수 있지만...당신은 그들과 다르다, 당신은 나와 다르다, 당신은 끊임없이 진화하고 혼합하고 있습니까?당신은 어떤 생물입니까?<page>더 가까이 다가오면 내 감정이 더 잘 이해될 것이다. "

original_en_text: Lady, still my senses resound. You seem so far beyond the bounds of a bug.<page>Permit me to gaze again upon your nature, that I may offer clarity.
original_zh_text: 女士，我的感知再度震颤。您已远远超过凡虫界限。<page>请允许我再次深入感知，才好仔细说明
translated_text: My feelings have always resonated with me. You seem to have gone beyond your mistake.<page>Look again at your nature, and I can give you the final answer.
secondary_translated_text: 내 감정은 항상 나에게 공감해. 너는 너의 잘못을 넘어선 것 같다.<page>당신의 본성을 다시 한번 살펴보면, 나는 당신에게 최종 답을 줄 수 있습니다.

original_en_text: Lady? So you live, still. This is good... I had felt the conflict commence, pale hearts ablaze, and the sudden well of darkness after.<hpage>I am sorry, Eva. I had hoped to slay the monarch, and was near achieving that goal, but the situation has become... complicated. Now, all of Pharloom threatens to fall.<page>But I can sense it in you, lady. You have not yielded to despair, so some hope must still remain?<hpage>...Slim hope, I suspect. But true, there may yet be a way through this disaster. I shall pursue that goal with whatever strength remains.<page>Then allow me to continue to aid you as I can... Mine might be a small contribution, but I shall provide it eagerly.
original_zh_text: 女士？你还活着，真是太好了……我早已感受到冲突的爆发，苍白之心熊熊燃烧，而后是突如其来的黑暗深渊。<hpage>抱歉，伊娃。我本希望斩杀君主，几乎就要达成目标，但情况变得……复杂了。如今整个纺络都濒临倾覆。<page>但我能从你身上感受到，女士。你仍未屈服于绝望，是否意味着尚存一线希望？<hpage>……希望渺茫。但确实，或许仍有办法化解这场灾难。我将用残存之力追寻这个目标。<page>那么请允许我继续尽力协助你……虽只是微薄之力，但我必倾心奉献。
translated_text: The Mrs? That 's why you 're alive. Everything 's okay, everything 's okay. I felt a conflict, a pale heart burning, and suddenly a deep abyss of darkness began.<hpage>Sorry, Eva, I was hoping to kill the monarch, but the situation... Things are getting more and more complicated, and now the entire Farham is in danger of collapsing.<page>I am very sorry, lady. Is there hope if we do not give up despair?<hpage>... Perhaps my hope is weak. Perhaps there is a way to overcome this disaster. I will do my best to achieve this goal.<page>I will continue to do everything in my power to help. My contribution may be small, but I will serve him zealously.
secondary_translated_text: 그 부인?그게 네가 살아 있는 이유야.모든 것이 괜찮아, 모든 것이 괜찮아.나는 갈등을 느꼈고, 창백한 마음이 불타고, 갑자기 깊은 어둠의 심연이 시작되었습니다.<hpage>미안해, 에바, 나는 군주를 죽이려고 했는데, 상황이...상황은 점점 더 복잡해지고 있으며, 이제 파햄 전체가 붕괴될 위험에 처해 있습니다.<page>정말 죄송해요, 아가씨.우리가 절망에 빠지지 않으면 희망이 있습니까?<hpage>...아마도 나의 희망은 약하다.아마도 이 재앙을 극복할 방법이 있을 것이다.나는 이 목표를 달성하기 위해 최선을 다할 것이다.<page>나는 계속 도울 수 있는 모든 것을 할 것이다.나의 공헌은 작을지 모르지만, 나는 그분을 열심히 섬기겠습니다.

original_en_text: Incredible... Your nature is so unlike a mortal bug’s. Yours is malleable, transitory. It is a marvelous thing, worth my long life to behold.<page>With what power I possess, I may still be able to aid you further.
original_zh_text: 不可思议……你的本质异于凡虫。流动，嬗变，真是奇妙，是我前所未见的存在。<page>以我的力量，或许可以助你更上一层。
translated_text: It 's incredible how ... His nature is very different from the nature of a human worm.Your is small and plastic.Something worth looking at in my life.<page>If I had the strength, I could help you more.
secondary_translated_text: 관련 리뷰: It 's incredible how...그의 본성은 인간 벌레의 본성과 매우 다르다. 당신의 것은 작고 플라스틱입니다. 내 인생에서 볼 가치가있는 것입니다.<page>내가 힘이 있었다면, 나는 너를 더 도울 수 있었다.

original_en_text: <hpage>Eva, I am seeking a tool, told to be somewhere in this structure. It is a snare device of Weaver make. Do you know of it?<page>I may, lady. Search over from here, on side where the moss meets the nest. There, my mothers built their tools, all traps and bindings. Small things, but tests for larger forms.<page>I still remember their thoughts as they worked, their desperation, and their hunger. Another hopeless attempt to wrest their freedom. All ended in failure, of course.
original_zh_text: <hpage>伊娃，我在寻找织者制造的陷阱装置。你知道在哪么？<page>有点印象。您可以去青苔与巢穴交界处搜寻，母亲们曾在那制造工具。虽是些小玩意，却是为了更大的图谋。<page>我还记得她们制作时的思绪，那份绝望与饥渴，又一次争夺自由的徒劳尝试。当然，终归失败。
translated_text: <hpage>Eva, I 'm looking for a tool that, as they say, is somewhere in that structure.<page>- Look here at the intersection of beetles and nests where mothers have made tools, traps, and constraints: small problems, but they are experienced in big ways.<page>I still remember the thought of his work, despair and hunger. This is a futile attempt to deprive him of his freedom. Naturally, all of this ends in failure.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>에바, 나는 그들이 말하는 것처럼, 그 구조 어딘가에 있는 도구를 찾고 있습니다.<page>- 여기 딱정벌레와 둥지의 교차점을 살펴보십시오. 어머니들이 도구, 함정 및 제약을 만들었습니다. 작은 문제이지만 큰 방식으로 경험됩니다.<page>나는 여전히 그의 일, 절망과 굶주림에 대한 생각을 기억한다.이것은 그의 자유를 박탈하려는 헛된 시도였다.물론 이 모든 것이 실패로 끝납니다.

original_en_text: Ain’t you come a long way, bellringer! Granting wishes, saving bugs, even rousing my sullen family to act!<page>The snare is set above, our power bound along its thread. To your sight it may seem a crude thing, but there’s fair strength to it... enough to quell a god.<hpage>You and your family have done me well, sir. I shall prove your faith in the meeting ahead.<page>Aye. Bring your best, bellringer. Call forth our great pale god. Cut her weak, then drive the beast down atop the snare.<page>Contact made will stir the snare alight, but only your needle’s song will awaken the spell in full. When that moment arrives, you’ll see it clear.
original_zh_text: 敲钟者，你这一路可够折腾！祈愿、救虫，连我那些沉默的同族都让你说动了！<page>陷阱已在上方布好，我们的力量都缠在丝线上。看着简陋，但威力足够……连神都能制住。<hpage>你们一族对我多次相助，我必将不负所托。<page>那就好，敲钟者，拿出真本事。把那苍白之神引出来，先削弱她，再逼到陷阱上方。<page>触碰陷阱就会激活丝线，但只有你的织针之乐能彻底唤醒术式。时机一到，你自然明白。
translated_text: You have come a long way, Bellinger. Make your wishes come true, avoid mistakes, and wake up your unhappy family to take action!<page>It is a trap, and our strength is connected to it. It may seem rude to you, but it has considerable power.<hpage>You and your family have been very kind to me. We will demonstrate our confidence in the upcoming meetings.<page>Bring forth the best of you, Belinger. Call upon the great God. Reduce your strength and lead the beast into a trap.<page>The trap is activated by touch, but only the tip of the needle will fully awaken the spell.
secondary_translated_text: 넌 아주 먼 길을 왔어, 벨린저.당신의 소원을 실현하고, 실수를 피하고, 불행한 가족을 깨우어 행동을 취하십시오!<page>그것은 함정이며, 우리의 힘은 그것에 연결되어 있습니다. 당신에게 무례하게 보일지 모르지만, 그것은 상당한 힘을 가지고 있습니다.<hpage>당신과 당신의 가족은 저에게 매우 친절하게 대해 왔으며, 우리는 다가오는 집회에서 자신감을 나타낼 것입니다.<page>"최고의 성품이 되라, 베링거.위대한 하나님께 기도하라.당신의 힘을 줄이고 짐승을 함정에 빠뜨리십시오.<page>덫은 터치로 활성화되지만 바늘의 끝만이 주문을 완전히 깨울 수 있습니다.

original_en_text: <page>Lady, please. Permit me to look upon your nature, that I may offer clarity...
original_zh_text: <page>女士，请允许我深入感知，才好仔细说明……
translated_text: <page>Madam, please. Let me study its nature to clarify.
secondary_translated_text: <page>부인, 부탁드립니다.명확히 하기 위해 그것의 본질을 연구하겠습니다.

original_en_text: Incredible... Your nature is so unlike a mortal bug’s. Yours is malleable, transitory. It is a marvelous thing, worth my long life to behold.<page>If in your travels you are able to further evolve, return to me. With what power I possess, I may be able to aid you further.<hpage>Thank you, Eva. If my nature expands as you say, I shall return.
original_zh_text: 不可思议……你的本质异于凡虫。流动，嬗变，真是奇妙，是我前所未见的存在。<page>如果旅途中你再度进化，请回来找我。以我的力量，或许可以助你更上一层。<hpage>多谢，伊娃。若我本质确实再度进化，我会回来找你。
translated_text: It 's incredible how ... His nature is quite different from human.Your is small and plastic.It is a remarkable phenomenon that deserves to be impressed in my long life.<page>If you can make progress on your path, come back to me, with my strength, I can help you.<hpage>Thank you, Eva. If my nature expands as you say, I will come back.
secondary_translated_text: 관련 리뷰: It 's incredible how...그의 본성은 인간과는 매우 다르다. 당신의 작은 가소성. 그것은 내 오랜 생애 동안 감명을받을 가치가있는 놀라운 현상입니다.<page>만일 너희가 너희의 길에서 진전할 수 있다면, 내게로 돌아오라, 나의 힘으로 내가 너희를 도울 수 있다.<hpage>고마워요, 에바.내 본성이 당신 말대로 확장되면, 나는 돌아올 것이다.

original_en_text: <hpage>I have known your kind before, sir. Yours is a tribe that works and trades in power, and I am about to extinguish its prime source.<hpage>Once this is done, will you truly delight in a land so bereft?<page>Aye, well... My family’s marks are all over that trap. And we’ve spent a hard age avoiding the gaze of our god.<page>If we earned it now, after such open opposition... that’s a bleak conclusion none of us’d care for.<page>Now! My job’s done. S’time your grand business began! We’ll be wishin’ victory to you, bellringer, for all our sakes!
original_zh_text: <hpage>我曾见过你的同族。你们一族专门兜售力量，而我正要掐灭这力量的源头。<hpage>事成之后，这力量真空的世界真能让你们感到高兴？<page>哈……陷阱上现在全是家族徽记，我们也躲那苍白之神半辈子了。<page>要是现在因为公然反抗栽了……这种憋屈结局谁受得了？<page>好了！我活儿干完了。该你大显身手了！敲钟者，你可一定要赢啊，都指望着你呢！
translated_text: <hpage>Your tribe is a tribe full of work and negotiations for power, and I am trying to eliminate the root cause of this.<hpage>When it ends, will you be truly happy on earth, losing someone you loved? "<page>The house of our home is in a trap; it is hard to escape God 's eyes.<page>If we win now, after the opposition of the whole people, then it is a sad conclusion that no one cares about.<page>Now! It 's time to start your amazing career. All of us, ring the bell, we wish you victory!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>너희 부족은 권력을 위해 일과 협상으로 가득 찬 부족이며, 나는 이것의 근본 원인을 제거하려고 노력한다.<hpage>그것이 끝날 때, 당신은 당신이 사랑하는 사람을 잃어 버린 땅에서 진정으로 행복 할 것입니까? "<page>우리 집의 집은 덫에 빠졌으니 하나님의 눈에서 벗어나기 어렵다.<page>만약 우리가 지금 이겼다면, 국민 전체의 반대 후에, 그것은 아무도 신경쓰지 않는 슬픈 결론이다.<page>지금!이제 당신의 놀라운 경력을 시작할 시간입니다.우리 모두, 종을 울리고, 우리는 당신들의 승리를 기원합니다!

original_en_text: <hpage>You see one’s nature, Eva? It is a skill far beyond bugs.<page>One not without cost. My sight perceives a bug only through the imprint upon their soul. <hpage>You speak of their crest? That signifier of a bug’s essence and their invisible yoke born through a lifetime.<page>Crest? Yes, the old Weaver term. A simple word to attempt description of something so profound.<page>But wait. Your own nature... Is it?...<page>Lady, permit me to look deeper still, that I may offer clarity...
original_zh_text: <hpage>伊娃，你能洞见本质？这等技艺远超虫类。<page>自然是有代价的。我需透过灵魂印记窥视生灵。<hpage>你是指纹章？那象征虫民全部存在与无形枷锁的标记？<page>纹章？对，织者用的古称，试图以简单词汇描述深邃之物。<page>等等，你的本质……莫非……<page>女士，请允许我深入感知，才好仔细说明……
translated_text: <hpage>Have you ever seen the human nature? It is an ability that goes beyond mistakes.<page>My eyes can only perceive the traces of the insect 's soul.<hpage>Are you in Winnipeg? Symbol of the essence of the insect and the invisible chains born in life.<page>Christie? It 's an old term in Weaver. I can express something like that in one word.<page>You wait for your nature. I really had...<page>I can give you a deeper understanding and clearer information.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>당신은 인간의 본성을 본 적이 있습니까?실수는 실수를 넘어서는 능력이다.<page>내 눈은 곤충의 영혼의 흔적만 감지할 수 있다.<hpage>Winnipeg 에 계신가요?곤충의 본질과 삶에서 태어난 보이지 않는 사슬을 상징합니다.<page>크리스티?그것은 Weaver 에서 오래된 용어입니다.나는 한 단어로 그런 것을 표현할 수 있다.<page>당신은 당신의 본성을 기다리고 있습니다.진짜...<page>나는 당신에게 더 깊은 이해와 더 명확한 정보를 줄 수 있습니다.

translated_text: « Views?

original_en_text: Lady, Pharloom’s time grows short. If you are able to further expand your nature, I urge you return to me.<page>Any power I possess, I shall grant it for your aid.<hpage>My thanks, Eva. If my nature expands as you say, I shall return.
original_zh_text: 女士，纺络时日无多。若你能进一步突破自身极限，请务必回到我身边。<page>我拥有的任何力量，都将为你所用。<hpage>感激不尽，伊娃。若真如你所言突破极限，我定会回来。
translated_text: If you can further expand your nature, which has shortened your time in the Faroe Islands, I suggest you come back to me.<page>Whatever strengths you have, I will use them to help you.<hpage>Thank you, Eva. If my nature expands as you say, I will come back.
secondary_translated_text: 페로 제도에서의 시간을 단축시킨 본성을 더욱 넓힐 수 있다면, 나에게 돌아 오라고 제안합니다.<page>네가 가진 강점이 무엇이든, 나는 너를 돕기 위해 그것을 사용할 것이다.<hpage>고마워요, 에바.내 본성이 당신 말대로 확장되면, 나는 돌아올 것이다.

translated_text: Eve's place.

original_en_text: Stay back, twisted leech! Even lodged within another’s shell, your ravenous nature shines clear.<page>You shall not defoul this chamber, nor claim my soul. Begone!
original_zh_text: 退后，扭曲的寄生物！即便寄居他者躯壳也藏不住贪婪本性。<page>休想玷污此地，更别妄图吞噬我的灵魂。滚开！
translated_text: Come back, the bow is broken! Even in the shells of others, the greedy nature shines brightly.<page>You can't take this room, you can't take your soul. Run!
secondary_translated_text: 돌아와, 활이 부러졌어!다른 사람의 껍질 속에서도 탐욕스러운 본성이 밝게 빛납니다.<page>이 방을 빼앗을 수 없고, 당신의 영혼을 빼앗을 수 없다.달아나!

original_en_text: Lady... Incredible... Your nature is so unlike a mortal bugs. Yours is malleable, transitory. It is a marvelous thing. Worth my long life to behold.<page>Unbound one, though we know each other little, permit me to ask a selfish request.<hpage>Your talent has provided a great benefit, Eva. What is it you desire of me?<page>Only to have my own soul, my own memories, bound within your shell... As you have done with those others throughout these lands.<page>I would not define as a crest within you, but my small strength may still grant a final boon.<hpage>You ask to be subsumed? Know your mind would cease to be, in any independent sense.<page>To be united with one unbound... This is the kind of escape I once prayed for, though the weight of ages had almost made me forget.<page>Lady, would you grant me this request?
original_zh_text: 女士……不可思议……你的本质异于凡虫。流动，嬗变，真是奇妙，是我前所未见的存在。<page>无羁者啊，虽然相交尚浅，但我仍想提出一个自私请求。<hpage>你帮了我很多，伊娃。你想要什么？<page>请您将我的灵魂与记忆缚于您的壳中，就像您其他生物所做的那样。<page>虽然称不上是纹章，但或许能为您献上最后一份微薄馈赠。<hpage>你想被我吞噬？你要知道，那意味着独立意识将不复存在。<page>我明白，但自愿如此。能与无羁者合而为一……是我昔日渴求的解脱，尽管岁月让我几乎遗忘。<page>亲爱的女士，您愿意成全我吗？
translated_text: Sra. ... It 's incredible how ... Their nature is very different from the nature of insects.Your is small and plastic.It is a very big thing.I am very grateful for my long life.<page>Free peoples, we put forward selfish demands that we do not know well.<hpage>Eva, her talent has brought us great advantages.What do you want from me?<page>I am attached to your shell to have my soul, my memory, as you have done with the rest of the earth.<page>I did not designate it as the emblem of your soul, but my little power can still bring you supreme blessings.<hpage>Would you like to join? Know that your mind no longer exists in an independent sense, and that you are not in the same place.<page>Working with unhindered people is a refuge that I prayed for, though I have almost forgotten it under the weight of time.<page>Will you agree to this request, ma 'am? " "
secondary_translated_text: 부인. ...관련 리뷰: It 's incredible how...그들의 본성은 곤충의 본성과 매우 다르다. 당신의 작은 플라스틱. 그것은 매우 큰 것. 나는 나의 긴 삶에 매우 감사한다.<page>자유인민들아, 우리는 우리가 잘 모르는 이기적인 요구를 제기한다.<hpage>에바, 그녀의 재능은 우리에게 큰 이점을 가져다 주었다. 나한테서 무엇을 원하는가?<page>나는 당신 껍질에 붙어 있어 당신께서 나머지 지구에 하셨던 것처럼 내 영혼과 기억을 가지고 있습니다.<page>나는 그것을 너희 영혼의 상징으로 지정하지 않았지만, 나의 작은 힘은 여전히 너희에게 가장 큰 축복을 가져다 줄 수 있다.<hpage>참여하시겠습니까?당신의 마음은 더 이상 독립적 인 의미에서 존재하지 않으며, 당신이 같은 장소에 있지 않다는 것을 알고 있습니다.<page>방해받지 않는 사람들과 함께 일하는 것은 내가 기도했던 피난처이지만, 시간의 무게 아래 그것을 거의 잊어 버렸습니다.<page>이 요청에 동의하시겠습니까, 부인? " "

original_en_text: Lady, you are a multitude within a single shell. A being truly unbound. To aid your growth has proved a grand task, even for one as limited as me.<page>As my last act, permit me to ask a final, selfish request.<hpage>Your talents have provided great benefit, Eva. What is it you desire of me?<page>Only to have my own soul, my own memories, bound within your shell... As you have done with those others throughout these lands.<page>I would not define as a crest within you, but my small strength may still grant a final boon.<hpage>You ask to be subsumed? Know your mind would cease to be, in any independent sense.<page>I know. And still I seek it, gladly. To be united with one unbound... This is the kind of escape I once prayed for, though the weight of ages had almost made me forget.<page>Dear Lady, would you grant me this request?
original_zh_text: 女士，您这具躯壳中存在万千可能，是真正无拘无束的存在。能助您成长，是我的荣幸。<page>最后，请允许我提出自私的请求。<hpage>你帮了我很多，伊娃。你想要什么？<page>请您将我的灵魂与记忆缚于您的壳中，就像您其他生物所做的那样。<page>虽然称不上是纹章，但或许能为您献上最后一份微薄馈赠。<hpage>你想被我吞噬？你要知道，那意味着独立意识将不复存在。<page>我明白，但自愿如此。能与无羁者合而为一……是我昔日渴求的解脱，尽管岁月让我几乎遗忘。<page>亲爱的女士，您愿意成全我吗？
translated_text: There are a lot of people in the shell of truly free people helping you grow, it can be a difficult task for a limited person like me.<page>In conclusion, I wish.<hpage>Eve, your talent has brought you great advantages. What are you asking me?<page>I am attached to your shell to have my soul, my memory, as you have done with the rest of the earth.<page>I did not designate it as the emblem of your soul, but my little power can still bring you supreme blessings.<hpage>Would you like to join? Know that your mind no longer exists in an independent sense, and that you are not in the same place.<page>It was an escape he prayed for, although he was almost forgotten by the weight of time.<page>My dear friend, do you agree with this request?
secondary_translated_text: 당신이 성장하는 것을 돕는 진정한 자유로운 사람들의 껍질에 많은 사람들이 있으며, 나 같은 제한된 사람에게는 어려운 일이 될 수 있습니다.<page>결론적으로, 나는 희망한다.<hpage>이브, 당신의 재능은 당신에게 큰 장점을 가져다주었습니다.나한테 뭘 물어봐요?<page>나는 당신 껍질에 붙어 있어 당신께서 나머지 지구에 하셨던 것처럼 내 영혼과 기억을 가지고 있습니다.<page>나는 그것을 너희 영혼의 상징으로 지정하지 않았지만, 나의 작은 힘은 여전히 너희에게 가장 큰 축복을 가져다 줄 수 있다.<hpage>참여하시겠습니까?당신의 마음은 더 이상 독립적 인 의미에서 존재하지 않으며, 당신이 같은 장소에 있지 않다는 것을 알고 있습니다.<page>그가 기도한 탈출은 시간이 지남에 따라 거의 잊혀졌지만, 그것은 그가 기도한 탈출이었다.<page>친애하는 친구여, 이 요청에 동의하십니까?

original_en_text: Who’s there? Has someone come to free me? Or are you here to bring my end? <hpage>I am Hornet, prisoner, only a traveller and not here to slay you.<hpage>What cause sees you caged in these ruins of Weavers past? Were you their enemy?
original_zh_text: 谁在那儿？是来解救我的？还是来取我性命的？<hpage>我名为大黄蜂，只是一名旅者，无意取你性命。<hpage>你为何被囚于织者遗迹？你曾是他们的敌人？
translated_text: Who's there? Has anyone come to help? Or will you finish me? "<hpage>I am a mess, a prisoner, a mere traveler, and I have not come to kill you. "<hpage>What trapped you in the ruins of Weavers? You are your enemy?
secondary_translated_text: 누구야?누가 도와줬어요?아니면 날 끝낼거야? "<hpage>나는 엉망이고, 죄수이고, 단순한 여행자이며, 너희를 죽이러 온 것이 아니다. "<hpage>무엇이 당신을 웨이버의 폐허에 갇혔습니까?당신은 당신의 적인가요?

original_en_text: Lady, my senses resound. You have grown further beyond the bounds of a bug.<page>Permit me to gaze again upon your nature, that I may offer clarity.
original_zh_text: 女士，我的感知在震颤。你已远超凡虫界限。<page>请允许我再次深入感知，才好仔细说明……
translated_text: Your growth is crossing the wrong line.<page>Look again at your nature, and I can give you the final answer.
secondary_translated_text: 당신의 성장은 잘못된 선을 넘고 있다.<page>당신의 본성을 다시 한번 살펴보면, 나는 당신에게 최종 답을 줄 수 있습니다.

original_en_text: <hpage>How did you come to be sealed here, Eva? <page>Lady, you mistake. What seems a cage is as much my shell as the form inside.<page>I was born within this space. To leave would be my death, an uninspired end, though one I’ve sometimes wished would come.<page>I am unique, you see. My mothers shared the curse of their tribe, to conceive a child is a painful, near impossible task. <hpage>I know the curse well, Eva, for I am also its victim, and spawn of one who managed to overcome its limits. <hpage>Are you too an attempt to defy that cruel constraint?<page>A flawed attempt. A life spun from rune and shell, sustained only by its cage. My thoughts may mimic a Weavers, but my senses are my own.<page>Over time, that difference brought only distance between us.
original_zh_text: <hpage>伊娃，你为何会被困在这里？<page>女士误会了。这囚笼也是我的躯壳，与其中的形体并无差异。<page>我诞生于这里，离开意味着消亡，虽然有时也渴求这平淡结局。<page>我很特殊，母亲们承受着族群诅咒，生育子嗣近乎不可能。<hpage>我很了解这诅咒，伊娃。因为我也是受害者，更是突破禁忌的产物。<hpage>想必你也是对抗这残酷枷锁的尝试？<page>是失败的尝试。符文与甲壳铸就的生命，只能靠囚笼维系。我虽能模仿织者，但终究不是织者。<page>久而久之，这份差异使我们渐行渐远。
translated_text: <hpage>Eve, How did you get here?<page>What looks like a cell is my shell, my inner form.<page>The beginning is my death, a little exciting ending, but sometimes I hope that it will come.<page>I'm unique, right? See? My mother swore that, like her tribe, pregnancy was a painful, almost impossible task.<hpage>"Eve, I know this curse, for I too am a victim, and I am the descendant of a man who has transgressed his limits.<hpage>Will she be able to withstand this harsh restriction?<page>A life made of runes and shells can only be preserved in a cage.My mind can mimic the fabric, but my emotions are my own.<page>Over time, these differences only bring us closer.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>이브, 어떻게 여기까지 왔어?<page>세포처럼 보이는 것은 내 껍질, 내 내 내적 형태입니다.<page>시작은 내 죽음, 조금 흥분 끝, 하지만 가끔 나는 그것이 올 수 있기를 바랍니다.<page>저는 독특해요, 맞죠?봐요?어머니는 그녀의 부족과 마찬가지로 임신은 고통스럽고 거의 불가능한 일이었다고 맹세했습니다.<hpage>"이브여, 나는 저주를 알고 있는데, 나 역시 희생자이며, 나는 자신의 한계를 넘어서는 사람의 후손이기 때문이다.<hpage>과연 그녀는 이 가혹한 제한을 견딜 수 있을까?<page>룬과 껍질로 만들어진 생명은 오직 우리 안에서 보존될 수 있다. 내 마음은 그 직물을 모방할 수 있지만 내 감정은 내 것이다.<page>시간이 지나면 이러한 차이점은 우리를 더 가깝게 만듭니다.

original_en_text: By your grace, I am at last broken from my fate.<hpage>Gladly I accept your union, Eva. No longer shall you suffer eternity alone.
original_zh_text: 蒙您恩典，我终于能挣脱宿命。<hpage>我欣然接受与你的联结，伊娃。你不必再承受永恒的孤寂。
translated_text: Thanks to you, I have finally escaped my fate.<hpage>I 'm happy to be married to Eve. You can't live alone forever
secondary_translated_text: 당신 덕에 저는 드디어 운명을 벗어났습니다.<hpage>나는 이브와 결혼하게 되어 매우 행복하다.영원히 혼자 살 수는 없네

original_en_text: Come no closer! I sense the forbidden blood coursing through you, that which grows and reshapes the world in its own vulgar image.<page>Whether it was imbibed willingly or not, none shall be allowed into this chamber while so afflicted. Begone!
original_zh_text: 站住！我能感知到你体内流淌的禁忌之血，那以粗鄙之形生长并重塑世界的秽物。<page>无论你是否自愿沾染此血，凡受其侵蚀者皆不得踏入这里。速速离开！
translated_text: RUN! You can feel the blood of the taboo flowing through your body, growing into a vulgar image and rebuilding the world.<page>Whether it is desirable or not, no one can enter this room in this time of agony. Run!
secondary_translated_text: 달아나!금기의 피가 몸을 통해 흐르고 저속한 이미지로 성장하고 세상을 재건하는 것을 느낄 수 있습니다.<page>바람직하든 그렇지 않든, 이 고통의 시간에 아무도 이 방에 들어올 수 없다.달아나!

original_en_text: Lady, if in your travels you are able to further expand your nature, return to me. With what power I possess, I may be able to aid you further.<hpage>If my nature expands as you say, Eva, I shall return.
original_zh_text: 女士，如果你的本质再度进化，请回来找我。以我的力量，或许能助你更上一层。<hpage>若我本质确实再度进化，我会回来找你。
translated_text: Woman, if you can expand your nature in your journey, please come back to me. With my strength, I can help you even more.<hpage>Eve, when my nature expands, as you say, I will return.
secondary_translated_text: 여인여, 여정에서 본성을 넓힐 수 있다면 내게로 돌아오라. 내 힘으로 더욱 너를 도울 수 있을 것이다.<hpage>이브야, 내 본성이 확장되면, 네가 말한 것처럼, 나는 돌아올 것이다.

original_en_text: Lady, would you think again upon my last request? To be bound amidst your shimmering soul?<page>I understand it is a selfish thing to ask, and I will hold no ill will if you reject.
original_zh_text: 女士，可愿重新考虑我的请求？让我融入你璀璨魂灵？<page>我明白这是个自私的请求，若您拒绝我也绝无怨言。
translated_text: Can I revise my last request? Trapped in your bright soul?<page>I understand that this is a selfish thing, and there is nothing wrong with your denial.
secondary_translated_text: 마지막 요청을 수정할 수 있나요?당신의 밝은 영혼 속에 갇혀 있습니까?<page>나는 이것이 이기적인 일이라는 것을 이해하며, 당신이 부정하는 것은 아무 잘못이 없다는 것을 이해합니다.

original_en_text: <hpage>I am sorry, Eva. I cannot grant you this. At least, not yet.<hpage>Yours is a mind strong and strange. That union could prove dangerous to my identity.<page>I understand, Lady. I will be here, if ever you reconsider.
original_zh_text: <hpage>抱歉，伊娃。我不能答应你，至少现在不行。<hpage>你的心智强大而奇异，联结恐怕会危及我的存在。<page>我明白，女士。希望您能改变心意，我会永远在此等候。
translated_text: <hpage>Sorry, Eva, but I can't guarantee it. Or at least not yet.<hpage>Her mind is strong and strange. This combination is a danger to my personality.<page>- I understand, ma 'am. If you're thinking about it, I'm here.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>미안해, 에바, 하지만 난 그것을 보장할 수 없어. 적어도 아직은.<hpage>그녀의 정신은 강하고 이상하다.이 조합은 내 성격에 위험하다.<page>- 이해합니다, 부인.당신이 그것에 대해 생각하고 있다면, 나는 여기에있다.

original_en_text: Thank you for playing the demo.
original_zh_text: 试玩版体验结束，感谢您的游玩！
translated_text: Thank you for the presentation.

original_en_text: They see your peace, woven of faith and toil,
original_zh_text: 赞美你以信仰与劳役编织的片刻安宁，
translated_text: Peace is the fabric of your faith and hard work,
In the third act.

original_zh_text: 强烈建议使用游戏手柄

Actions 1.

original_en_text: They forget your heart, bound in slumber and servitude,
original_zh_text: 谁又记得你沉睡于桎梏中的野兽之心？
translated_text: They are doomed to forget their hearts, sleep and become slaves.
secondary_translated_text: 그들은 그들의 마음을 잊고, 잠을 자고, 노예가 될 운명입니다.

original_en_text: They see your beauty, so frail and fine,
original_zh_text: 虫豸皆敬仰你纤弱的神迹之美，
translated_text: They see her beauty, so fragile and beautiful.
secondary_translated_text: 그들은 그녀의 아름다움, 너무 연약하고 아름답다는 것을 보았다.

translated_text: The Pharmacy
The abyss

original_en_text: When you wake they shall see your truth,
original_zh_text: 待你醒来，挣裂千丝缠茧——
translated_text: When you wake up, you will see the truth.
secondary_translated_text: 깨어났을 때 진실을 보게 될 것이다.

original_en_text: A beast’s nature bare to all.
translated_text: The nature of the beast is naked to all.
A house with closed hours.
The construction tools?

original_en_text: Lift your voices. Know our grace.
translated_text: Lift up your voice, that you may know our grace.
secondary_translated_text: 당신의 목소리를 높여 우리의 은총을 알게 하소서.

original_en_text: Bug born of Pharloom. You have been chosen.<br> May our Citadel’s holy gilding harden your soft shell.<page>Stand eternal as our arbiter, that no bug bearing sin shall step within our sacred halls.
original_zh_text: 纺络的虫民，你们已被选中，<br>愿圣堡的鎏金淬硬你们的软壳。<page>作为审判官永远伫立，使罪孽之徒永不得踏入圣殿。
translated_text: This is a battery born in Faro. You have been chosen.<br>Let the golden sanctity of our castle cover its tender shell.<page>Like our eternal arbiters, an evil insect will not trample on our sacred temple.
secondary_translated_text: 이것은 파로에서 태어난 배터리입니다.당신은 이미 선택되었습니다.<br>우리 성의 황금 성스러운 성은 그 부드러운 껍질을 덮게 하십시오.<page>우리의 영원한 중재자처럼, 악한 곤충도 우리의 거룩한 성전을 짓밟지 않을 것입니다.

original_en_text: A rune-scroll depicting void given form.
original_zh_text: 描绘虚空化形的符文卷轴
translated_text: A scroll of rune that represents emptiness

original_en_text: Sisters, spiders, watch these waters flow,<br>Cleansing, Binding, as Silk from shell,<br>Memories of our kingdom calm.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，蛛族，观此净水长流。<br>涤荡，缠缚，如壳中抽丝，<br>抚平王国的记忆褶皱。
translated_text: "Brothers, spiders, look at the water.<br>pure and bound, like silk extracted from a shell.<br>The memories of our kingdom are calm.
secondary_translated_text: "형제들아, 거미들아, 물을 보라.<br>껍질에서 추출된 실크처럼 순수하고 묶여 있다.<br>우리 왕국의 추억은 평온하다.

original_en_text: At the seventh bell toll, send:<br>Thirty measures, four beats Smokerock,<br>Eight beats Sweetsmelt,<br>Mark of fealty, all workers.<page>At the ninth bell toll, send:<br>Twenty measures, two beats Smokerock,<br>Seven beats Sweetsmelt,<br>Mark of fealty, all workers.<page>
original_zh_text: 七钟响时运送：<br>三十节又四奏烟岩，<br>及八奏甜熔渣。<br>全体劳工需示忠诚。<page>九钟响时运送：<br>二十节又两奏烟岩，<br>及七奏甜熔渣。<br>全体劳工需示忠诚。<page>
translated_text: The 7th Strike:<br>Four of the thirty broke the smoke block.<br>He hit eight people.<br>It is a symbol of loyalty for all employees.<page>The Ninth Strike.<br>Two of the 20 measures broke Smlock.<br>Seven people won the sweet potato.<br>It is a symbol of the loyalty of all employees.<page>
secondary_translated_text: 7 번째 파업:<br>30 명 중 4 명이 연기 막대를 깨뜨렸다.<br>그는 8 명을 때렸다.<br>그것은 모든 직원들에게 충성도의 상징이다.<page>아홉 번째 스트라이크<br>20 가지 조치 중 두 가지가 Smlock 을 깨뜨렸습니다.<br>7 명이 고구마 우승을 차지했다.<br>그것은 모든 직원들의 충성심의 상징이다.<page>

translated_text: Audience map
Map of his life
Map of the Underground
secondary_translated_text: 지하 지도 Map of the Underground

original_en_text: When three fonts weep, our sacred shrine shall rise.
original_zh_text: 三眼泪泉涌流，圣坛自当升起。
translated_text: When they had spoken these three words, the holy temple stood up.
secondary_translated_text: 그들이 이 세 말을 했을 때, 거룩한 성전이 일어섰다.

original_en_text: Damned are we! The lingered few bound still to suffer. Cursed thrice by Pharloom, to wait, to watch, to cry our anguish.<page>No more! We say! No more! We cry! We all have wailed and wept. Fair Pharloom’s fall has come at last. Its end we now accept.
original_zh_text: 万众受难！幸存者仍受折磨。纺络三度诅咒加身——苦候，守望，哀哭不休，<page>到此为止！我在此宣言！到此为止！我在此高呼！我们已流尽血泪。荣光纺络终将陨落，我们应接受终局。
translated_text: Д е с т ь м е! Three times cursed for the fall, we waited, we saw, wept for our sufferings.<page>Nothing more! Let's Talk! No more! I was crying! We were all screaming and crying. Fair Farm has finally collapsed. Now we accept that end.
secondary_translated_text: 죽어라!세 번은 타락에 대한 저주를 받았지만, 우리는 기다렸고, 보았으며, 우리의 고통을 위해 울었습니다.<page>더 이상 아무것도 없다! Let 's Talk!더 이상!나는 울고 있었다!우리는 모두 비명을 지르고 울었다.드디어 ' 농장 ' 이 무너졌다.이제 우리는 그 결말을 받아들입니다.

original_en_text: Litany of the Worker<br>May we catch the dregs and never tire,<br>May we clean the dregs and never hunger,<br>May we spool the dregs and never falter.
original_zh_text: 劳工祷词<br>愿我们滤渣不倦。<br>愿我们清秽不饥。<br>愿我们纺线不怠。
translated_text: Employees Continue to Read<br>We never get tired of dirt.<br>Remove dirt and never go hungry.<br>We used to roll the dirt and never drank.
secondary_translated_text: 직원들은 계속 읽습니다.<br>우리는 결코 더러운 것에 지치지 않는다.<br>더러운 것을 제거하고 결코 배고프지 마십시오.<br>우리는 먼지를 굴러 먹었고 결코 술을 마시지 않았다.

original_en_text: Oath of the Whiteward<br>While song must be sung, none may falter.<br>Infirmity. Sickness. Death.<br>All are banished from our Citadel.
original_zh_text: 白愈厅誓言<br>歌不可辍，虫不可怠。<br>孱弱、病痛、死亡——皆逐出圣堡。
translated_text: The White Oath.<br>The song should be sung, but no one is worried.<br>Death due to illness.<br>All of them were driven out of the castle.
secondary_translated_text: 하얀 맹세<br>노래가 부르면 되겠지만 아무도 걱정하지 않는다.<br>병으로 인한 죽음.<br>그들은 모두 성에서 쫓겨났다.

original_en_text: Penitent, Fourth of the Fourth.<br>Guilty of the sins of infirmity, sickness.<br>Penance by swallowing.<br>Absolution granted after death.<page>Penitent, Twelfth of the First.<br>Guilty of an unnamed sin.<br>Penance by casting.<br>Absolution not granted.
original_zh_text: 罪者，第四组第四号。<br>犯孱弱、病痛之罪。<br>处以吞刑。<br>死后得赦。<page>罪人，第一组第十二号。<br>犯未名之罪。<br>处以流放。<br>不予赦免。
translated_text: The Confession, 4.<br>from weakness and illness.<br>Spit out.<br>Forgiveness after death.<page>The Confession, 12.<br>An unknown crime has been committed.<br>I swear I am guilty.<br>Without forgiveness.
secondary_translated_text: 고백, 4.<br>약함과 질병으로부터.<br>뱉어라.<br>죽음 이후의 용서.<page>고백, 12.<br>알려지지 않은 범죄가 저질러졌다.<br>맹세코 나는 죄가 있다.<br>용서를 받지 않고

original_en_text: Penitent, Eighth of the Twelfth.<br>Guilty of the sin of irreverence.<br>Penance by chaining.<br>Absolution granted after death.<page>Penitent, Second of the Fourth.<br>Guilty of the sin of dissonance.<br>Penance by silencing.<br>Absolution granted after death.
original_zh_text: 罪者，第十二组第八号。<br>犯不敬之罪。<br>处以锁刑。<br>死后得赦。<page>罪者，第四组第二号。<br>犯杂音之罪。<br>处以禁言。<br>死后得赦。
translated_text: Confession on December 8<br>The sin of disrespect for others.<br>Explain it in prison.<br>Forgiveness after death.<page>"Confessions, " Volume 4.<br>I have expressed my disagreement.<br>A quiet confession.<br>Forgiveness after death.
secondary_translated_text: 12 월 8 일 고백<br>남에 대한 무례의 죄.<br>감옥에서 설명해 주세요.<br>죽음 이후의 용서.<page>"Confessions ", Volume 4.<br>나는 이미 나의 의견에 동의하지 않음을 표했다.<br>조용히 고백하다.<br>죽음 이후의 용서.

original_en_text: Remains of a Muckroach crushed by falling rock.
original_zh_text: 蟑螂被落石碾压后的残渣。
translated_text: The body of the beetle was crushed by a falling stone.

original_en_text: Anguished Aura<br>Eight masks hard, swirled soul enraged.<br>Twelve aknids flat, all juices strained.<page>Six pilgrims living, hung long to drain.
original_zh_text: 苦痛灵氛<br>八具硬质旋魂怒面。<br>十二只阿克尼，榨尽汁液。<page>六名活祭朝圣者，悬吊沥干。
translated_text: He will suffer.<br>8 Masks are hard, and the soul is angry.<br>Collect 12 acne nuts and filter all the juice.<page>Six pilgrims are still alive, awaiting aspiration.
secondary_translated_text: 그는 고통을 겪을 것이다.<br>8 가면은 단단하고 영혼은 분노합니다.<br>12 개의 여드름 견과류를 수집하고 모든 주스를 여과합니다.<page>여섯 명의 순례자가 아직 살아 있고, 열망을 기다리고 있다.

original_en_text: A white lock bearing a surgical symbol.
original_zh_text: 带有外科标志的苍白锁具。
translated_text: White Key with Surgical Mark
Symbols represent most of the tissue.
Item chart
The Whisper Vault

original_en_text: Their shells are ours. Their souls are ours.<br>Our hate is forever.
original_zh_text: 他们的躯壳是我们的，他们的灵魂是我们的。<br>我们的恨意永世不灭。
translated_text: Their souls are ours, and their shells are ours.<br>Hatred is eternal.
secondary_translated_text: 그들의 영혼은 우리의 것이고, 그들의 껍질은 우리의 것이다.<br>미움은 영원하다.

original_en_text: Containment fails. Memory lost. Excise outer. Maintain inner.<br>Shellwood stasis sustained - Remember.<br>Marrowlands stasis critical - Remember.<br>Verdanian environment exceeded - Destined to forget.
original_zh_text: 封存溃败。记忆遗失。切除外区。维持内区。<br>甲木林封存稳定——须铭记。<br>髓骨地封存危急——须铭记。<br>翠庭生态失控——注定遗忘。
translated_text: Avoid failures.Loss of memory.Remove outside.Remains inside the house<br>The stagnation of the shell and trees continues.<br>Serious arrest of the bone marrow - remember.<br>In addition to the impressive atmosphere - doomed to forget.
secondary_translated_text: 실패를 피하십시오. 기억력 상실. 외부에서 제거하십시오. 집 안에 남아 있습니다.<br>껍질과 나무의 침체 상태는 계속되고 있다.<br>골수의 심각한 체포 - 기억하십시오.<br>인상적인 분위기를 제외하고 - 잊을 운명입니다.

original_en_text: Here is established, by holy consent of the Conductors,<br>The Memorium of Pharloom.<br><br>What Is Remembered Is Never Lost.
original_zh_text: 经指挥家神圣授权，<br>于此建立纺络忆廊。<br><br>铭记者永存不灭。
translated_text: With the driver 's consent,<br>Memorial at Farroom<br><br>What you remember is never lost.
secondary_translated_text: 운전자의 동의를 받으면,<br>Farroom Memorial 부근의 호텔<br><br>기억하는 것은 결코 사라지지 않는다.

original_en_text: A rune depicting paths away from Pharloom.
original_zh_text: 描绘离开纺络通路的符文。
translated_text: Ron drew a way out of guilt.
Recovering broken tools
Map of the Doors
secondary_translated_text: 문 지도 Map of the Doors

original_en_text: Due to unacceptably high injury and unsanctioned deaths, Ventrica travel shall henceforth be denied to all.<br> For Pharloom eternal, a bug who serves must never die.
original_zh_text: 鉴于伤亡过甚并且非授命死亡，即日起禁止所有虫民使用圣脉枢管。<br>永恒纺络需要活着的仆从。
translated_text: Travel to Madagascar will be banned due to the unacceptable number of casualties and unauthorized deaths.<br>For Lighthouse, the persistent service error will never go away.
secondary_translated_text: 마다가스카르로의 여행은 용납할 수 없는 수의 사상자와 무단 사망으로 인해 금지될 것이다.<br>Lighthouse 의 경우 지속적인 서비스 오류는 결코 사라지지 않습니다.

translated_text: The weakest map in the atlas

original_en_text: Pilgrim<br>Spare a song for those who lay here silent.<br>By strength abandoned, they fell before the final ascent.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者<br>为长眠于此的无声者歌一曲罢。<br>力竭而堕，未竟登攀。
translated_text: about pilots.<br>Leave the song to those who are silent.<br>They lost their strength and collapsed before they could make their final ascent.
secondary_translated_text: 조종사들에 관하여.<br>침묵하는 사람들에게 노래를 남기십시오.<br>그들은 마지막 등반을 하기 전에 힘을 잃고 쓰러졌다.

translated_text: Map of the abyss

original_en_text: <hpage>I understand now... The steel child’s servant grew bold...<hpage>I know what the fleeing bug seeks to call, and their etchings here suggest clear clues to where. <hpage>What they attempt is dangerous, stupid. It can only end badly. I must hurry if I’m to stop this.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我现在明白了……钢铁之子的手下越来越大胆……<hpage>也知道那只逃亡的虫子想召唤什么，这些刻痕明确指出了地点。<hpage>愚蠢又危险的做法，不会有好下场。得赶紧阻止。
translated_text: <hpage>Now I know that the servant boy has become brave.<hpage>We know what we call runaway insects, and the engraving here gives us a clear clue.<hpage>Their attempts are dangerous and futile.The result is simply bad.If you want to stop it, you need to hurry.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>이제 나는 하인 소년이 용감해졌다는 것을 안다.<hpage>우리는 우리가 도망친 곤충이라고 부르는 것을 알고 있습니다. 여기의 조각은 우리에게 명확한 단서를 제공합니다.<hpage>그들의 시도는 위험하고 헛되다. 그 결과는 단순히 나쁘다. 그것을 멈추고 싶다면 서둘러야 한다.

original_en_text: An old rune displaying the design for a Weaver weapon.
original_zh_text: 残破的织者武器设计图。
translated_text: Ancient races showcasing the chassis design.
Open the Rune of the Abyss.

original_en_text: Sister, spider, sat between salt and stone,<br>Build those tools of brilliant mind imagined,<br>Aid us when our Silk has waned.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，蛛族，坐于盐石之间，<br>铸造智械奇器，<br>助我们于灵丝枯竭之时。
translated_text: The Spider-Sister is between the salt and the stone.<br>Creating tools for the imaginary brain.<br>When the silk is falling, please help.
secondary_translated_text: 스파이더 자매는 소금과 돌 사이에 있다.<br>가상의 뇌를 위한 도구 만들기<br>실크가 떨어질 때 도와주세요.

original_en_text: An old stone gate with a simple keyhole.
original_zh_text: 带有简易锁孔的古石门。
translated_text: An ancient stone door with a simple opening for closing.
secondary_translated_text: 문을 닫을 수 있는 간단한 개구부가 있는 고대 돌문

original_en_text: Sister, spider, husk bound to branch,<br>Watch over these bugs, passing safe,<br>Warded by fear,<br>No longer your meal.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，蛛族，缚枝之壳，<br>庇佑这些过客安然。<br>以恐惧为甲，<br>不再化作食粮。
translated_text: Sisters, spiders, shells attached to branches,<br>To be aware of these mistakes and to go through them with confidence,<br>Accept fear,<br>It is no longer your food.
secondary_translated_text: 자매, 거미, 나뭇가지에 붙어있는 껍질,<br>이러한 실수를 인식하고 자신감을 가지고 통과하기 위해,<br>두려움을 받아들이며,<br>그것은 더 이상 당신의 음식이 아닙니다.

original_en_text: Bug born of Pharloom. You have been chosen.<br> May our Citadel’s holy gilding harden your soft shell.<page>Stand eternal as our arbiter, that no bug bearing sin shall ever step within our sacred halls.
original_zh_text: 纺络的虫民，你们已被选中，<br>愿圣堡的鎏金淬硬你们的软壳。<page>作为审判官永远伫立，使罪孽之徒永不得踏入圣殿。
translated_text: This is a battery born in Faro. You have been chosen.<br>Let the golden sanctity of our castle cover its tender shell.<page>Like our judges, we are always in our holy temple, without worms and sin.
secondary_translated_text: 이것은 파로에서 태어난 배터리입니다.당신은 이미 선택되었습니다.<br>우리 성의 황금 성스러운 성은 그 부드러운 껍질을 덮게 하십시오.<page>우리의 판사들처럼, 우리는 항상 벌레와 죄가 없는 거룩한 성전에 있습니다.

original_en_text: I have departed to pay my respects at the graves within the great wood.<br>- Pinmaster Plinney
original_zh_text: 我去密林深处的墓园祭拜先灵<br>——针匠普林尼
translated_text: I went to see the grave in the woods.<br>- Pinmaster Prinius (English)
secondary_translated_text: 나는 숲 속에 있는 무덤을 보러 갔다.<br>- Pinmaster Prinius (영어)

translated_text: Have you a map?

original_en_text: Penitent, First of the First.<br>Guilty of the sin of apostasy.<br>Penance by constriction.<br>Absolution denied.
original_zh_text: 罪人，第一组第一号。<br>犯背信之罪。<br>处以束刑。<br>永不赦免。
translated_text: First, the confessor.<br>and the sins of disobedience.<br>Recognition of boundaries.<br>Forgiveness is denied.
secondary_translated_text: 첫째, 고백자.<br>불순종한 죄와<br>경계를 인식하는 것.<br>용서는 거절당한다.

original_en_text: Weaver, in eighth part, last of their line, frail with age.<br>Tracked and taken in Sandsea Waste.<br>Seven Choristors, nine Envoys lost to task.
original_zh_text: 第八代织者，末裔，年迈体衰。<br>于沙海荒原追捕擒获。<br>折损七名圣咏使徒，九名特使。
translated_text: Weaver is the last member of the family, and as he gets older, his body weakens.<br>Sandy Creek Wildness<br>The seven commandments and the nine apostles failed in their mission.
secondary_translated_text: 웨이버는 가족의 마지막 멤버이며 나이가 들수록 몸이 약해집니다.<br>샌디 크리크 와일드니스 Sandy Creek Wildness<br>일곱 계명과 아홉 사도들은 그들의 임무에 실패했다.

translated_text: appearance of magnetism.

original_en_text: Cloth and materials that could be fashioned into additional pockets.
original_zh_text: 可缝制附加口袋的布料。
translated_text: Textiles and materials that can create additional pockets.
secondary_translated_text: 추가 주머니를 만들 수 있는 직물과 재료.

original_en_text: Sister, spider, husk bound to moss,<br>Watch over these bugs born low,<br>Raised up by fervour fostered,<br>Born and caught within our web unknowing.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，蛛族，缚苔之壳。<br>庇佑这些卑微生物。<br>养育于狂热之中，<br>生于罗网而不自知。
translated_text: Sisters, spiders, shells related to moss,<br>Be careful with this insect.<br>Growing in passion,<br>We are born unconscious and trapped in the net.
secondary_translated_text: 자매, 거미, 이끼와 관련된 조개,<br>이 곤충을 조심하세요.<br>열정으로 성장하는,<br>우리는 의식이 없고 그물에 갇혀 태어납니다.

original_en_text: Sister, spider, if seeking commune with the creature atop this mount, take the climb above as test, a challenge beyond even our setting.<page>Upon that summit gained, and creature hailed, know it shall choose what gift to grant, with death as likely as insight.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，若欲觐见此山巅之物，须攀登试炼之径，其险犹胜我等所设。<page>登顶谒见之时，须知其所赐或为顿悟，或为死期。
translated_text: Sisters, spiders, if you want to communicate with this mountain creature, try the creature above.<page>When it reaches its peak, and the living being rejoices and knows what gifts to give, death becomes possible as a perception.
secondary_translated_text: 자매 여러분, 거미 여러분, 이 산악 생물과 의사 소통을 하고 싶다면 위의 생물로 시도해 보세요.<page>그것이 정점에 도달하고 살아있는 존재가 기뻐하고 어떤 선물을 줄지 알 때, 죽음은 지각으로 가능해진다.

original_en_text: Hate for their light. Hate for their pins. For their waste poured thick and endless.<page>Fill your hearts with hate, for power has now been claimed, and with it we shall punish.
original_zh_text: 憎其光辉，恨其刺针。怒其秽流无尽<br>以恨意填膺，因权柄已夺，吾等将施以惩戒。
translated_text: I hated the light. I hated the pin. Their shit is constantly coming out.<page>Fill your heart with hatred, because power is removed, and we will punish it.
secondary_translated_text: 나는 빛을 싫어했다.나는 핀이 싫었다.그들의 똥은 끊임없이 나오고 있다.<page>당신의 마음을 증오로 가득 채우십시오. 권력이 제거되었으므로 우리가 그것을 처벌 할 것입니다.

original_en_text: Here we honour the seed that sprung the wood. <page>By her grace may all bugs pass safe to join us and our song.
original_zh_text: 此地敬奉孕育森林的种子。<page>承其恩泽，万虫皆可安然穿行，共奏圣歌。
translated_text: Here we pay tribute to the seeds that have grown.<page>Thank you for your kindness, and may all the insects return to safety and join us and our music.
secondary_translated_text: 여기서 우리는 자란 씨앗에 경의를 표한다.<page>당신의 친절에 감사드립니다, 그리고 모든 곤충이 안전으로 돌아와 우리와 우리의 음악에 합류하기를 바랍니다.

translated_text: Map of Rotten Tubes
Complete eruptions of volcanic rock.
The White Card.

original_en_text: Daughter of a distant land...<br>We who remained have waited long...<br>Bind our strength to yours...<br>Reclaim the future of our haunted kingdom...
original_zh_text: 远疆之女啊……<br>我们残存者久候……<br>愿以残力附汝身……<br>夺回这缠魂国度的未来……
translated_text: A daughter in a distant country.<br>Those who stayed here waited a long time.<br>Join our forces with yours.<br>Restoring the future of our ghost kingdom.
secondary_translated_text: 멀리 떨어진 나라에 있는 딸.<br>여기에 머물렀던 사람들은 오랫동안 기다렸다.<br>우리의 힘과 당신의 힘에 합류하십시오.<br>우리 유령의 왕국의 미래를 복원하다.

original_en_text: If the haunted continue their work, leave them be! Only those who frustrate production shall be removed.
original_zh_text: 受丝咒侵蚀者若仍旧劳作，勿扰！唯怠工者当除。
translated_text: If the ghost continues to work, let it go! Only what hinders production will be removed.
secondary_translated_text: 만약 유령이 계속 일한다면, 그것을 놓아!생산을 방해하는 것만이 제거됩니다.

original_en_text: An inert automaton with an empty chest.
original_zh_text: 胸腔空置的休眠自动机。
translated_text: Automation in an Empty Box

original_en_text: On the eighth harvest, send:<br>Fifty measures, nine beats dregthread, spooled,<br>Fourteen measures dregthread, twined,<br>Oath of fealty, all workers.<page>On the twelfth harvest, send:<br>Forty measures dregthread, spooled,<br>Two beats fine thread, twined,<br>Oath of fealty, all workers.<page>
original_zh_text: 第八次收成时运送：<br>五十节又九奏卷线渣，<br>十四节编线渣。<br>全体劳工需立忠誓。<page>第十二次收成时运送：<br>四十节卷线渣，<br>两奏精编丝线。<br>全体劳工需立忠誓。<page>
translated_text: On the eighth harvest, send the following:<br>Thread Dregg at 50 bars, 9 tempo<br>14 measures, drugtride, have,<br>All the officers were sworn to their loyalty.<page>For the 12th harvest season, please send the following:<br>40 Measures Thread, Reel<br>two lines,<br>All employees swear an oath of allegiance.<page>
secondary_translated_text: 여덟 번째 수확에, 다음을 보내십시오:<br>Thread Dregg 50 bar, 9 tempo<br>제 14 조, 약물트라이드,<br>모든 장교들은 그들의 충성을 맹세했다.<page>12 번째 수확기에는 다음을 보내주시기 바랍니다.<br>40 Measures Thread, Reel<br>두 줄,<br>모든 직원들은 충성을 맹세한다.<page>

original_en_text: In the air. The water. Everywhere.<br>Inside their shells. Twisted inside. Guts.<page>Tightest around heart. Pulsing rhythm.<br>Sick. Alive. Dead?<br>Something worse.<page>Deeper. Must look deeper.
original_zh_text: 空气中，水流中，无处不在。<br>甲壳内，脏器间，扭曲盘踞。<page>紧缚心脏，搏动如歌。<br>病态，鲜活，死寂？<br>某种更糟的存在。<page>需深究……再深究……
translated_text: There is water in the air everywhere.<br>Inside the silk. The inner part is deformed. Value, Value.<page>Around the heart there is a typhoid. Pulsating rhythm.<br>Was he sick or dead?<br>Even worse.<page>A thorough investigation is required.
secondary_translated_text: 곳곳에 공기 중에 물이 있다.<br>실크 안에.내부 부분이 변형되었습니다.값, 값.<page>심장 주변에는 장티푸스가 있다.맥박이 뛰는 리듬.<br>그는 병이 났거나 죽었습니까?<br>더 심하다.<page>철저한 조사가 필요하다.

original_en_text: A bucket overflowing with smouldering Flintstone.
translated_text: The Bucket of Primitive Flint

original_en_text: Pilgrim<br>This settlement welcomes all who step the holy path.<br>May you ease your shell within, that your strength renewed can carry you higher.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者<br>此镇欢迎任何踏入圣途者。<br>愿您在此养精蓄锐，登攀更高处。
translated_text: about pilots.<br>We welcome all who follow the path of God.<br>Allow your mind to relax and allow your new strength to lift you higher.
secondary_translated_text: 조종사들에 관하여.<br>우리는 하나님의 길을 따르는 모든 사람을 환영합니다.<br>당신의 마음이 휴식을 취하고 당신의 새로운 힘이 당신을 더 높이 들어 올릴 수 있도록하십시오.

original_en_text: Weaver of Pharloom.<br>By grace you warded. By thread you healed.<br>For your favour, eternal, we offer our song.
original_zh_text: 纺络的织者啊<br>您以恩赐庇护，以丝线疗愈。我们献永恒之歌，报答您的垂青。
translated_text: The Taver of the lighthouse<br>God bless you and heal you.<br>For your love and for your eternity, we dedicate a song to you.
secondary_translated_text: The Taver of the Lighthouse 부근의 호텔<br>하나님께서 당신을 축복하시고 치유하시길.<br>당신의 사랑과 영원을 위해, 우리는 당신에게 노래를 바칩니다.

translated_text: Extending the kit?

This is an old regulatory system.

original_en_text: O, great land whose flame doth falter!<br>Whose choir, conductors, all doth fail,<page>Observe! Take heart! That spark still burning,<br>Yon butterfly of crimson grace,<page>All bells shall peal, and voices raise,<br>When brave Trobbio steps, at last, upon the stage!
original_zh_text: 啊，辽阔疆土，其焰渐熄！<br>圣咏团与指挥皆已倾颓。<page>且看！且振作！星火犹存——<br>那优雅的绯红蝶影，<page>万钟齐鸣，众声高亢。<br>待勇者特罗比奥终登台！
translated_text: O great earth, tremble thy flame!<br>The choir and the conductor failed,<page>¡Look at me! Put your hands on me! Sparks are still burning.<br>Elegant butterflies of dark red color<page>Every bell rings, every sound rings.<br>When the brave Trophy finally comes on the scene!
secondary_translated_text: 오 위대한 땅아, 그대의 불꽃을 떨어라!<br>합창단과 지휘자는 실패했고,<page>나를 봐!내 위에 손을 얹어라!불꽃은 여전히 타오르고 있다.<br>짙은 빨간색의 우아한 나비<page>모든 벨이 울리고, 모든 소리가 울린다.<br>드디어 용감한 트로피가 무대에 올 때!

original_en_text: Erase our fear,<br>Eliminate our desire,<page>To suffer no more,<br>Void, cleanse us.
original_zh_text: 抹除恐惧，<br>涤净欲念，<page>苦难终止，<br>虚空啊，净化吾等。
translated_text: The fear increases.<br>To free yourself from your desires,<page>To stop suffering.<br>The vacuum cleanses.
secondary_translated_text: 두려움이 커지고 있다.<br>당신의 욕망에서 벗어나기 위해,<page>고통을 멈추기 위해.<br>진공이 청소한다.

original_en_text: I have departed to scale Pharloom’s frigid mount. If any bug exists brave enough to match my pin’s fatal resolve, then climb and face me upon its stormward side.<br>- Pinstress
original_zh_text: 我将攀登纺络寒峰。若有虫愿意成全遗志，持针之决意者，请至风暴面峰顶相会。<br>——针姬
translated_text: I began to climb the cold mountain lighthouse If there is an insect that matches my fateful resolve, climb next to the storm and face me.<br>- The Princess, Princess
secondary_translated_text: 나는 차가운 산 등대를 오르기 시작했다 나의 운명적 결심에 맞는 곤충이 있다면 폭풍 옆으로 올라가서 나를 마주하라.<br>- 공주, 공주

original_en_text: Flickering Flame<br>Five masks swirled soul, brought and broiled.<br>Four stones rage-baked, crushed powder coarse.<page>Three shells fresh from pilgrims fallen, to contain and age.
original_zh_text: 摇曳焰方<br>五具旋魂面甲，炙烤研磨。<br>四枚怒火焙石，碾作粗粉。<page>三副朝圣鲜壳，用以封存陈化。
translated_text: Flash the Fire (Flash of Fire)<br>Five masks rotate, wear and burn the soul.<br>He will burn the four stones and break the coarse dust.<page>The three shells that had just fallen from the pilgrims ' hands were sealed and decomposing.
secondary_translated_text: 플래시 오브 파이어 (Flash Of Fire)<br>다섯 개의 마스크가 회전하고 착용하며 영혼을 태워줍니다.<br>그는 네 돌을 태우고 거친 먼지를 깨뜨릴 것이다.<page>순례자들의 손에서 막 떨어지는 세 개의 껍질이 봉인되어 분해되었다.

original_en_text: Weaver, in eighth part, last of their line, mortally wounded.<br>Tracked and taken in the Blackbarrens.<br>Four Choristors, one Reed lost to task.
original_zh_text: 第八代织者，末裔，重伤濒死。<br>于黑荒原追捕擒获。<br>折损四名圣咏者，一名战士。
translated_text: Weaver finished on the eighth lap and was fatally injured.<br>Photographed in black.<br>Four commanders, including Reed, were killed in the line of duty.
secondary_translated_text: 웨이버는 8 번째 랩에서 마쳤고 치명적인 부상을 입었다.<br>검정색으로 찍은 사진.<br>리드를 포함한 4 명의 사령관이 직무 중에 사망했다.

original_zh_text: 展示圣堡结构的机械模型。
translated_text: Machines for exhibition of castle models.

original_en_text: <hpage>The second spot marked by the child of steel. This camp too was used by their vassal, and another rite was conducted here, this one incomplete. <hpage>The action was clearly taken in haste. Did they believe themself pursued? The etchings here are crude, but the words are disturbing... and desperate.
original_zh_text: <hpage>钢铁之子标记的第二处地点。他们的仆从也在这里进行过仪式，但没完成。<hpage>行动如此匆忙，难道是怕被追杀？刻的字歪歪扭扭，内容让人不安……且绝望。
translated_text: <hpage>Even the vassals used the field, and another ceremony was held, but this time it was not completed.<hpage>The action was obviously impulsive. Do you think they are being pursued? The cut here is rough, but it is uncomfortable and there.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>부하들도 그 밭을 사용했고 또 다른 의식을 열었지만 이번에는 완성되지 않았다.<hpage>그 행동은 분명히 충동적이었다.당신은 그들이 추격되고 있다고 생각합니까?여기의 컷은 거칠지만, 그곳은 불편하다.

original_en_text: Cloth and incendiary materials that could be fashioned into an explosive weapon.
original_zh_text: 可制成爆燃武器的布料与易燃物。
translated_text: Clothing and firebombs that can be used as explosive weapons.
secondary_translated_text: 폭발무기로 사용할 수 있는 의류와 화염탄.

original_en_text: Shellplates and cogs that could be fashioned into a flying automaton.
original_zh_text: 可组装飞行自动机的壳板与齿轮。
translated_text: Drugs and equipment can be used to create a flying robot.
secondary_translated_text: 약과 장비를 사용하여 비행 로봇을 만들 수 있습니다.

original_en_text: In silence your voice,<br>In darkness your form,<page>We higher who see you seeking,<br>Our shells yearn for your embrace.
original_zh_text: 静默即汝声，<br>晦暗即汝形。<page>吾等高瞻汝之追寻，<br>甲壳渴求汝之怀抱。
translated_text: Quiet in the heart,<br>In the darkness, in his form,<page>When you see a great man looking at you,<br>I 'm hungry for your arms.
secondary_translated_text: 마음속의 조용함,<br>어둠 속에서, 그의 형태 속에서,<page>위대한 사람이 당신을 바라보는 것을 보면,<br>나는 너의 팔이 배고프다.

original_en_text: -ilgrim<br>You who have held tight to faith have been carried far.<br>This station shall offer brief rest to those devout.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者<br>虔信之虫方能抵达此远境。<br>此站给予诚心者片刻安歇。
translated_text: - English.<br>Those of you who think you have been kidnapped.<br>The resort offers a bit of rest for pious people.
secondary_translated_text: - 영어로.<br>당신이 납치되었다고 생각하는 당신들.<br>이 리조트는 경건한 사람들에게 약간의 휴식을 제공합니다.

original_en_text: Half-spawn of a distant land...<br>Within this cage I have waited...<br>Let my strength be bound to yours...<br>Reclaim the future of our accursed kingdom...
original_zh_text: 异乡的半血之子啊……<br>我在此笼中久候……<br>愿以残力附汝身……<br>夺回这诅咒国度的未来……
translated_text: Half of them are from remote countries.<br>I was waiting in the cage.<br>By my strength and your strength,<br>Restore the future of our cursed kingdom.
secondary_translated_text: 그 중 절반은 외딴 나라 출신이다.<br>나는 새장에서 기다리고 있었다.<br>나의 힘과 너의 힘으로,<br>저주받은 우리 왕국의 미래를 회복시켜라.

original_en_text: Child, I have answered the call to climb. I rise to join our elders in that holy place far above. May you, in time, grow strong enough to meet us there.
original_zh_text: 孩子，我已应召攀登，将赴上方圣地与前辈们相聚。愿你成长强健，来日同聚。
translated_text: I answered the call to climb the mountain. I got up and went to a distant sanctuary with the elders. Be stronger and join us!
secondary_translated_text: 나는 등산을 하라는 부름을 받았다.나는 일어나 장로들과 함께 멀리 있는 성소로 갔다.더 강해지시고 우리와 함께 하세요!

original_en_text: An old map of the Putrified Ducts.
translated_text: An old map of rotten pipes.

original_en_text: This low, her gaze escaped.<br>Prepare, sisters. Weave hope anew.<br>That we might break free this accursed web born of our naive foundation.
original_zh_text: 此处卑微隐秘，逃出她的视线。<br>准备吧，姊妹。重织希望。撕破这由我等天真所结的诅咒之网。
translated_text: She was very low, and her eyes were slipping.<br>Prepare, sisters, reorganizing hope.<br>You can get out of the cursed net that was born from an innocent foundation.
secondary_translated_text: 그녀는 매우 낮았고, 눈은 미끄러져 있었다.<br>준비하라, 자매들아, 희망을 재조정하라.<br>당신은 순수한 기초에서 태어난 저주받은 그물에서 벗어날 수 있습니다.

translated_text: The door is locked by a simple lock.

original_en_text: Pilgrim<br>Accept the judgment of the rise beyond,<br>That all who stand at Pharloom’s holy crest prove pure of will and want.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者<br>接受至高审判的洗礼。<br>凡欲立于纺络之巅者，当证心志纯净。
translated_text: about pilots.<br>Accept judgments that go beyond Ascension<br>Every person who is in the crown of guilt is pure will and desire.
secondary_translated_text: 조종사들에 관하여.<br>Ascension 을 넘어서는 판단을 받아들이십시오.<br>죄책감의 왕관에있는 모든 사람은 순수한 의지와 욕망입니다.

translated_text: Have you a map?

original_en_text: Two children born entwined, apart,<br>Two children marked to rule,<page>They danced, they sang, proved blades beyond,<br>But none forgot their birth,<br>For lovers born on beat exact shall be forever cursed.
original_zh_text: 双子缠绕共生，命运连结，<br>双子共掌权柄，注定称王，<page>舞若惊鸿，歌撼四座，剑技超群，<br>但出身不可磨灭，<br>同卵双生之爱侣，诅咒永世缠身。
translated_text: Both babies are connected at birth.<br>Two minors have been convicted.<page>They will dance, they will sing, they will prove that the lama is outside.<br>No one will ever forget his birth.<br>For enthusiasts born in rhythm, accuracy is always a curse.
secondary_translated_text: 두 아기는 태어날 때 연결되어 있습니다.<br>두 명의 미성년자가 유죄판결을 받았다.<page>그들은 춤추고 노래하며 라마가 밖에 있다는 것을 증명할 것이다.<br>아무도 그의 탄생을 결코 잊지 못할 것이다.<br>리듬에서 태어난 열광자에게는 정확성은 항상 저주입니다.

translated_text: Map of the Memorial
secondary_translated_text: 기념관 지도 Map of the Memorial

original_en_text: Great bugs! You who weep as your kingdom fades,<br>join me upon the Stage.<br> Together, we shall enflame the passion of Pharloom!
original_zh_text: 伟大的虫民！为王国衰颓而泣者。<br>请至剧台与我相会。<br>共燃纺络之激情！
translated_text: Big Mistakes! Your kingdom will fall, and you will weep.<br>Come to the stage with me.<br>Let 's share our passion for the lighthouse!
secondary_translated_text: 큰 실수들!네 왕국이 무너질 것이며, 너는 울 것이다.<br>나와 함께 무대에 오세요.<br>등대에 대한 우리의 열정을 공유하십시오!

translated_text: Role of the Cradle
secondary_translated_text: 요람의 역할 The Role of the Cradle

original_en_text: <hpage>This location was marked by the steel child. This camp is old, but still shows clear evidence of an attempt at a rite.<hpage>Whatever the vassal hoped to achieve here seems to have failed. The other marked locations may provide more clues to its intent.
original_zh_text: <hpage>这是钢铁之子标记的地点。营地虽然老旧，但明显有试图举行仪式的痕迹。<hpage>无论仆从想做什么，似乎是失败了。其他标记点或许会有更多线索。
translated_text: <hpage>The camp is ancient, but there is clear evidence of attempts to perform rituals.<hpage>Everything you have hoped for seems to have failed.The location of other markers can give you more clues about your intentions.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>이 캠프는 오래되었지만 의식을 수행하려는 시도의 분명한 증거가 있습니다.<hpage>당신이 기대했던 모든 것이 실패한 것 같습니다. 다른 마커의 위치는 당신의 의도에 대한 더 많은 단서를 줄 수 있습니다.

original_en_text: Weaver, in quarter part, last of their line, staked to service.<br>Tracked and taken beneath the City of Steel.<br>Eight Choristors, twelve Envoys lost to task.
original_zh_text: 第四代织者，末裔，强制服役。<br>于钢铁之城地下追捕擒获。<br>折损八名圣咏使徒，十二名特使。
translated_text: Weaver serves in the fourth section (his last row).<br>Take a picture of the Iron City.<br>Eight of the twelve Rings have failed their mission.
secondary_translated_text: 4 위 (위버) 는 그의 마지막 줄에서 봉사합니다.<br>아이언 시티 (Iron City) 의 사진을 찍으세요.<br>12 개의 반지 중 8 개가 그들의 임무에 실패했다.

translated_text: Through the glory of our precious castle, let your godly people bathe in your holy light.
